Add the beef and cook for 2 minutes until the surface is sealed. Add the garlic, white part of the green onion and beans. Cook for another 1 minute until the beef is caramelised, stirring constantly so it doesn't catch and burn., Rice and sauce ‚Äì Add the rice and sauce. Toss for a good 1 1/2 ‚Äì 2 minutes to give the rice a chance to get toasty., Scramble egg ‚Äì shove all the rice to one side and shif the pan so the empty space is set over the flame. Add the remaining 1/2 tablespoon oil and spread. Pour the egg, swirl, give it 10 seconds to partially set then do lazy swirls with your spatula to scramble it softly. Once mostly cooked, quickly (but gently!) toss it though the rice., Serve ‚Äì Add the green part of the green onion and toss through. Divide between bowls and enjoy!

TITLE: No bake cheesecake
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 200g/7 oz digestive biscuits, 90g (6 tbsp) unsalted butter, melted, 1/2 cinnamon powder, 1 brown sugar, salt
2 1/4 gelatin powder, 2 cold tap water, 1 thickened or heavy cream, 500g/ 16 oz cream cheese block, 3/4 caster sugar / superfine sugar, 1 vanilla extract, 1 lemon juice
6 strawberries, Whipped cream
INSTRUCTIONS: Blitz crumb ingredients. Press into 20cm/8" inverted base lined springform. Bloom gelatine in the water, re-melt. Whip cream. In separate bowl whip cream cheese + sugar, then vanilla, lemon, salt and gelatine. Fold in 1/4 cream, then remaining cream. Fill crust, fridge 6 hours.

Invert & line ‚Äì Turn the base of a 20cm/8" springform pan UPSIDE DOWN (Note 6). Grease with butter very lightly. Place a square piece of parchment/baking paper on the base. Then clip into the springform pan ‚Äì excess paper will stick out., Line sides ‚Äì Butter and line the side of the pan.

Blitz ‚Äì Break up biscuits roughly by hand and place in a food processor. Blitz until it becomes fine crumbs (~30 seconds)., Add butter ‚Äì Add the butter, cinnamon and salt. Blitz until it resembles wet sand (~ 10 second). It should stay together when pinched between your fingers., Press ‚Äì Pour into the prepared cake tin. Use a spatula to roughly spread it out over the base and up the walls. Then flatten and press the base and walls using something with a flat base and vertical edges (I used a measuring cup). Aim for the wall to be ~9mm (0.35") from the top of the rim (Note 7). Refrigerate crust until required.

Bloom gelatine ‚Äì Put the water in a small bowl and sprinkle the gelatine across the surface (don't dump it in one place. Whisk until dissolved then set aside for 3 minute or until it firms up like rubber., Melt ‚Äì Microwave for 15 seconds on high or until it melts (do not let it boil). Cool for 5 minutes while you make the filling (make sure it's still liquid when you use it).

Whip cream ‚Äì Put the cream in a bowl and whip it with an electric beater on high for 2 minutes until firm peaks form (ie not softly whipped, we want good aeration!)., Whip cream cheese ‚Äì Put the cream cheese and sugar in a separate large bowl. Using the same beater (no need to clean), beat on high for 1 minute just until it's soft and smooth. Add the vanilla, lemon and melted gelatine, then beat for 10 seconds on high to mix it through thoroughly. Don't beat excessively as we don't want too many air bubbles in the cheesecake (unsightly)., Fold ‚Äì Add about 1/4 of the whipped cream into the cream cheese mixture. Gently fold through using a rubber spatula or large spoon (don't mix aggressively, you'll knock all the air out of the cream!). Then fold in the rest of the cream., Refrigerate ‚Äì Pour into the crust, smooth the surface. Refrigerate for 6 hours+ to set.

Remove sides of the cake pan. Use then overhang paper to slide cheesecake off the cake pan base onto a serving platter. Then slide the cheesecake off the paper., Decorate the top with whipped cream and strawberries, if desired (or just dollop whipped cream on the plate). Cut into slices and serve!

TITLE: Tzatziki Chickpea Salad
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 cucumbers, 1 1/4 Greek yogurt, 1 lemon juice, 2 1/2 extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 roughly chopped fresh dill, 1 large garlic clove, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt
2 x 400g / 14 oz cans chickpeas, 3/4 finely sliced celery, 2 chopped capers
INSTRUCTIONS: Mix ‚Äì Put the Tzatziki ingredients in a big bowl and mix. Add the chickpeas, celery and capers, mix again., Wait 1 hour ‚Äì You can eat it straight away but it's better if you can set aside for at least 1 hour to let the flavours meld (especially salt from capers & the garlic). It's even better the next day. Give it a taste and add a pinch of extra salt if needed (capers saltiness can differ)., Serve drizzled with extra olive oil and extra dill. Dive in!
As a side salad or salad meal, stuffed into sandwiches/wraps (+ avocado, good "glue"), add chicken or canned tuna for protein-boost salad meal.

TITLE: White Chocolate Raspberry Loaf
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 125 g/ 8 tbsp unsalted butter, 3/4 caster sugar (superfine sugar), 1 plain yogurt, 2 large eggs, 1 vanilla extract, 1 lemon zest
1 3/4 plain flour (all-purpose flour), 2 baking powder, 1/2 baking soda, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
1 1/2 raspberries, 2 flour, 1/2 white chocolate chips
6 ‚Äì 8 raspberries
1 icing sugar / powdered sugar, 1/2 vanilla extract, 6 milk, salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Toss raspberries in flour (if frozen, keep in freezer). Whisk butter and sugar then remaining Wet. Mix in dry, fold through choc and raspberries. Bake in  lined 22 x 12 cm pan (8.7 x 4.7") at 190¬∞C/375¬∞F (170¬∞C fan) for 40 minutes, cover with foil then bake another 35 minutes (+ 5 min for frozen raspberries). Cool, glaze!

Preheat the oven to 190¬∞C/375¬∞F (170¬∞C fan-forced). Grease and line a 22 x 12 x 7 cm loaf pan with paper (8.7 x 4.7 x 2.75", Note 6)., Toss the raspberries with the flour. If using frozen, put the bowl in the freezer (so they don't thaw)., Wet ingredients ‚Äì Put the butter in a heatproof bowl and microwave until melted. Cool for a minute then whisk in the sugar. Next, add the yogurt, eggs, vanilla and lemon. Whisk until combined., Dry ingredients ‚Äì Sprinkle the dry ingredients across the surface, then mix it in using a rubber spatula. Stop mixing as soon as the flour is incorporated ‚Äì some lumps in the batter is fine. (Over mixing = tough loaf), Raspberries ‚Äì Working fast, add the white chocolate and the raspberries (including any residual flour in the bowl), then mix briefly just to disperse the raspberries. (Fresh raspberries ‚Äì careful not to squish them. Frozen ‚Äì work fast, else the batter chills and thickens = takes longer to bake). Batter is pretty thick., Fill pan ‚Äì Scrape batter into the prepared pan. Roughly level the surface (spreads and levels in the oven). Press Extra Raspberries into the surface, if using., Bake 40 minutes. Cover loosely with foil then bake for a further 35 minutes for fresh raspberries, 40 minutes for frozen. A skewer inserted into the centre should come out without raw batter on it., Cool 5 minutes in the pan, then transfer onto a rack. Full cool before glazing.

Mix Glaze ingredients in a bowl until smooth., Glaze ‚Äì Put the rack on a tray or plate to catch glaze drips. Drizzle glaze all over the cake. Scrape up glaze from the plate and glaze again., Serve ‚Äì Leave for 20 minutes to let a crust form on the glaze before cutting thick slices to serve.

TITLE: One Pot Cajun Beef Pasta with lots-of-veg
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 olive oil, 2 garlic cloves, 1 onion, 500g/ 1 lb beef mince (ground beef), 1 carrot, 1 zucchini, 1 red capsicum, 2 tomato paste, 800g/ 28 oz canned crushed tomato, 400g/ 14 oz kidney beans, 2 chicken stock/broth, 2 water, 350g / 12 oz (3 cups) elbow pasta (macaroni), 1 1/2 colby cheese, 1 green onion stem
1 1/2 dried thyme, 1 1/2 paprika, 2 garlic powder, 2 onion powder, 1/2 cayenne pepper, 1/4 black pepper, 1 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Heat the oil in a large heavy based pot with a lid over high heat., Cook vegetables ‚Äì Cook the onion and garlic for 2 minutes. Add the beef and cook, breaking it up as you go, until you no longer see red meat. Add the carrot and zucchini, cook for 2 minutes until the water they release mostly evaporates. Add the capsicum and cook for 2 minutes., Spices ‚Äì Add the tomato paste and Cajun Spices. Cook for 1 minute., Pasta sauce ‚Äì Add the canned tomato, water (I swill the cans clean), stock and beans. Mix and bring to a simmer., Add the pasta, stir, let it come back up to the simmer. Put the lid on and lower the heat slightly to medium so the liquid is simmering (not bubbling madly)., Cook for 15 minutes, stirring every few minutes so the base doesn't catch. The pasta should be a bit firmer than you want in the middle, and still a bit soupy which is good! Liquid gets absorbed in the next step., Melt cheese ‚Äì Give it a stir, smooth the surface, sprinkle with cheese. Put the lid on then turn the stove off (leave the pot on the stove). Leave for 3 minutes so the residual heat melts the cheese and the pasta finishes cooking., Serve ‚Äì Remove from the stove, sprinkle with green onion if desired, then serve immediately while saucy and the cheese is gooey!

TITLE: Golden Halloumi with Honey and Thyme
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 225-250g/ 8oz halloumi, 2 olive oil
1 1/2 honey, 1/2 fresh thyme leaves and tiny sprigs, 2 ‚Äì 3 chilli flakes
INSTRUCTIONS: Cut into 1 ‚Äì 1.25cm / 0.4 ‚Äì 0.5‚Ä≥ slices, pat dry. Pan fry in the oil on medium high until golden, serve on pre-warmed plate, with optional finishes.

Cut halloumi into 1-1.25 cm thick slices (0.4 ‚Äì 0.5") (see Note 3). Place the slices on a paper towel and pat the surface dry., Warm a serving plate. (Note 4), Heat the oil in a non stick pan over medium high heat., Fry ‚Äì Carefully place the halloumi in the pan (I use my hands). Cook for 1 1/2 minutes or until the underside is golden. Shuffle if needed so they cook evenly., Turn gently (I use a spatula + butter knife to guide) and cook the other side for 1 ‚Äì 1/2 minutes until golden., Transfer onto the serving plate., Optional finishes ‚Äì Working quickly, drizzle with honey, sprinkle with thyme and chilli flakes. I do full honey coverage for some slices, and for others just a drizzle., Serve immediately, quick, before the halloumi goes squeaky! üôÇ Though actually, the squeak doesn‚Äôt bother me but it's at its prime straight out of the pan when the surface is still crisp and the inside is soft. (Note: Honey on the plate is ideal for bread mopping)

TITLE: Chicken and Leek Pie
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 50g/ 3 1/2 tbsp unsalted butter, 750g/ 1.5lb chicken thighs, 1/4 each black pepper and cooking salt

80g / 3 oz streaky bacon, 2 leeks, 2 celery stems, 2 garlic cloves, 1/3 chardonnay, 1/4 flour, 1 dijon mustard, 2 thyme sprigs, 2 bay leaves, 1 chicken stock / broth, 1 thickened / heavy cream, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
2 frozen butter puff pastry sheets, 1 egg
INSTRUCTIONS: Sear surface of chicken in half butter, remove. Cook bacon 1 minute, then leek, celery and garlic 5 minutes. Deglaze with wine, melt remaining butter, then cook flour 1 minute. Add stock, then remaining Filling ingredients. Add chicken, thicken sauce (~5 minutes)., Cool filling 1 hour, assemble pie with double layer puff on rim, brush lid with yolk, bake 45 minutes 200¬∞C/375¬∞F (180¬∞C fan).

Trim the reedy dark green ends and root off, then cut in half. Cut each piece in half lengthways. Remove the outer 5 to 6 layers (keep them together), lay them flat, cut in half lengthways then into 1.8cm / 3/4" squares. Cut the inner core into 2cm / 0.8" pieces.

Chicken ‚Äì Melt half the butter in a large pan over high heat. Add the chicken, salt and pepper. Cook until the surface changes from pink to white (inside still raw), then remove into a bowl using a slotted spoon. Leave residual butter and chicken juices in the pan., Saut√© ‚Äì In the same pan, cook the bacon for 1 minute. Add the leek, celery and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes until the celery is softened. Don't let the leek brown ‚Äì lower the heat if needed., Deglaze ‚Äì Add the wine and simmer rapidly on high heat, stirring, until it is mostly evaporated., Roux ‚Äì Lower the heat to medium. Add the remaining butter. Once it melts, sprinkle the flour across the surface (don't dump in one place) and stir for 1 minute., Creamy sauce ‚Äì While stirring, slowly pour the stock in. The mixture will thicken into a thick sauce once combined. Then add the mustard, cream, thyme, bay leaves, salt and pepper. Stir to combine, then add the chicken including all the juices accumulated in the bowl., Simmer ‚Äì Increase the heat, stir to combine. Once it comes to a simmer, reduce the heat to medium high. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring regularly, or until the sauce is a thick creamy consistency you want in the finished pie (ie sauce thickness now = thickness in the baked pie, see Note 7)., Cool ‚Äì Remove the pan from the stove and cool for 1 hour. (You can also store in fridge for 3 ‚Äì 4 days).

Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C/375¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced). Use a 1.5 litre / 1.5 quart baking pan (Note 9) or 4 to 5 x ~350ml / 12 oz ramekins., Connect puff pastry sheets (if needed) ‚Äì Semi-thaw the puff pastry (Note 6). Brush the edge of one sheet with egg white, then overlap 0.5cm / 0.2" with the other sheet to connect them. Use the back of a spoon to "smear" the pastry to hide the seam and firmly connect., Cut out the pie lid (I use the dish as a cutting guide)., Optional strips for extra puffy edges (Note 8): Cut strips using the residual pastry to line the rim of the dish (if your dish has a thick rim, like mine) and place on the rim of the dish., Fill the pie dish with the cooled filling and smooth the surface. Brush the pastry strips on the rim with egg white (if not using strips, don't do this step) then cover with the puff pastry lid., Brush the lid with egg yolk. Cut a small X in the middle., Bake 45 minutes or until the surface is a deep golden brown. Rest 5 minutes then serve!

TITLE: Wholesome Cinnamon Breakfast Muffins
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 3/4 walnuts, 2 shredded carrot, 1 1/4 shredded Granny Smith apple,, 1/2 desiccated coconut, 3/4 raisins
2 wholemeal flour, 1 3/4 baking soda, 2 cinnamon powder, 1 ground ginger, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt
3/4 brown sugar, 3 large eggs, 2/3 olive oil, 1/4 orange juice
INSTRUCTIONS: Toast walnuts 190¬∞C/375¬∞F (170¬∞C fan) 8 minutes. Cool, roughly chop. Whisk dry, whisk wet in separate bowl. Add wet into dry with add-ins, mix, fill oil-sprayed muffin tin. Bake 25 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 190¬∞C/375¬∞F (170¬∞C fan-forced)., Toast walnuts ‚Äì Put the walnuts on a tray and toast for 8 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes on the tray then roughly chop into 5mm / 0.2" pieces., Spray a 12 hole standard muffin tin with oil, or line with muffin cases., Batter ‚Äì Whisk the dry ingredients in a large bowl. Whisk the wet ingredients until combined in a separate bowl. Pour the wet ingredients and all the add-ins into the Dry Ingredients bowl. Mix with a wooden spoon just until you can no longer see flour, then stop mixing (over-mixed batter = tough muffs!)., Divide the mixture between the holes ‚Äì they will mound above the rim! (See photos in post). A lever ice cream scoop is super useful here. And don't worry, they won't overflow, they rise and dome., Bake for 25 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean., Cool for 5 minutes in the muffin tin, then transfer onto a cooling rack and cool for at least another 5 minutes before grabbing on. Slathering with softened salted butter is encouraged!

TITLE: Nagi‚Äôs Big, Easy Pasta Salad
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 500g/ 1 lb bow tie pasta (farfalle)
2 cucumbers, 3 cups (500g) cherry or grape tomatoes, 1/3 roughly chopped Kalamata olives, 200g/ 7oz Greek feta, 1 basil leaves
1/2 extra virgin olive oil, 1/3 apple cider vinegar, 2 garlic cloves, 2 dijon mustard, 2 honey, 1 1/2 Italian herbs mix, 3/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
INSTRUCTIONS: Cook pasta until soft, toss with 2/3 Dressing, cool. Toss with everything else except basil, then add basil. Serve!

Dressing ‚Äì Shake the Dressing ingredients in a large jar. It should be sharp, the flavour mellows once tossed., Cook pasta until soft ‚Äì Bring a large pot of salted water to the boil. Cook the pasta until it is very soft, about 2 ‚Äì 3 minutes longer than the time on the packet but taste to check because packet directions have been known to lie! Pasta firms up when it's cold (nobody likes hard, cold pasta!), so cook the pasta until extra soft., Flavour soak ‚Äì Drain the pasta very well, shaking off excess water. Transfer into a large bowl. Give the Dressing a good shake then pour over about two-thirds. Toss well, then leave the pasta to soak up the dressing as it cools (~40 minutes)., Toss ‚Äì Add the tomato, cucumber, feta and olives. Pour over the remaining Dressing. Toss well. Add basil, toss again., Serve ‚Äì Tumble into big serving bowl. Dig in!

TITLE: Hot buttered corn rice
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 50g/ 4 tbsp unsalted butter, 3 big garlic cloves, 2 frozen corn, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, of pepper, 1 long grain rice, 1 1/2 low-sodium chicken stock/broth, 2 green onion stems
INSTRUCTIONS: Pot size ‚Äì Use a small pot or large saucepan about 20-22 cm/8-9". (Note 3), Saut√© ‚Äì Melt half the butter in a pot over high heat. Add the garlic and stir for 15 seconds. Add the corn and half the salt. Stir for 2 minutes., Bring to simmer ‚Äì Add the rice and stir for 30 seconds. Add the stock and remaining salt, and pepper. Stir, bring to a simmer (make sure the whole surface is bubbling/ripplling), then put the lid on and turn the heat down to medium low (or low, if your stove is strong). (Note 4), Cook for 12 minutes (no peeking, no stirring!). The liquid should be absorbed by now ‚Äì tilt the pot and take a quick peek to check., Rest 10 minutes ‚Äì Remove the pot from the stove and let it rest for 10 minutes with the lid on. This step is key, do not skip it! (Note 5), Toss ‚Äì Lift the lid, add the remaining butter, fluff the rice to melt the butter through. Add green onion and toss through., Tumble into serving bowl. Serve hot!

TITLE: Homemade artisan crackers ‚Äì sesame sea salt flavour
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 plain flour / all-purpose flour, 1/4 cooking salt, 1 white sesame seeds, 1/3 water, 2 extra virgin olive oil
1 white sesame seeds, 1/2 salt flakes, Olive oil spray
INSTRUCTIONS: Mix dry ingredients, make well, stir in wet. Divide in half, roll out 3mm / 1/8" thick. Transfer to paper, sprinkle with sesame and flakes, roll to 2mm / 1/12". Cut into 5cm / 2" pieces, transfer to tray, spray with oil. Bake 12 min, rearrange to colour evenly, bake 8 to 10 min until light golden.

Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C / 400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced)., Mix the flour, sesame and salt in a bowl using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon. Make a well in the centre then add the water and oil. Using the handle of the spatula to mix until the flour is incorporated., Roll out #1 Sprinkle the counter lightly with flour. Scrape the dough out then knead a few times to bring it together into a ball. Cut in half. Roll one piece out to 3mm / 1/8" thin oval shape. (Note 3), Sprinkle ‚Äì Place a sheet of baking paper (parchment) on a cutting board. Transfer the rolled out dough onto the paper. Sprinkle with half the sesame and half the salt flakes. Roll out even thinner on the paper to 2mm / 1/12" (thinner = crispier)., Cut into 5cm / 2" squares using a pizza cutter or knife (Note 4). You'll have smaller pieces on the edge and corners, that's fine. Leave the pieces as is, don't try to move them (so thin, it's too hard!). Slide the paper onto a tray. Repeat with the other piece of dough., Bake ‚Äì Spray with oil. Bake both trays together for 12 minutes. Remove from the oven. Re-arrange to move the more golden pieces on the outer rim of the tray to the centre (so they cook evenly). Bake for a further 8 to 10 minutes or until all the pieces are light golden (white = not crispy!)., Serving ‚Äì Remove from the oven and leave the crackers to cool on the tray (~20 minutes). Make dip or prepare cheese platter worthy of your homemade crackers. Then attack!

TITLE: Greek Kofta Kebabs
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 500g/ 1 lb lamb mince, 3 large garlic cloves, 2 paprika, 2 mustard powder, 4 1/2 dried oregano, 1 1/2 curry powder, 3/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
1 olive oil, 8 skewers
3/4 plain yogurt, 2 mayonnaise, 2 extra virgin olive oil, 1 American yellow mustard, 1 1/2 garlic powder, 1 1/2 paprika, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt
4 Greek pita bread, 2 tomatoes, 1/2 red onion, Iceberg lettuce
INSTRUCTIONS: Sauce ‚Äì Mix the ingredients in a bowl and set aside to let the flavours meld while you make the kofta kebabs., Kofta kebabs ‚Äì Put all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well with your hands until the spices are mixed through. Divide into 8, shape into 13cm/5‚Ä≥ logs. Thread onto skewers then flatten slightly to about 1.25cm / 0.5‚Ä≥ thick (Note 5)., Cook ‚Äì Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large non stick pan over medium high heat. Cook half the koftas for 2 minutes on each side until golden, then about 30 seconds on each short edge (just for a bit of colour). Reduce the heat if they‚Äôre browning too fast. Transfer to a serving plate, loosely cover with foil to keep warm. Cook the remaining koftas. (Scrape out loose burnt bits, if any. You shouldn‚Äôt need extra oil.), Serve and assemble! Pile the lettuce, tomato and onion on the plate and put the sauce in a bowl. To assemble, take a warm pita bread and smear some sauce down the middle. Top with lettuce and 1 or 2 koftas (removed from the skewers), tuck tomato down the side and sprinkle with onion. Fold and EAT!

TITLE: Pistachio Cake
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 125g/ 4.4oz pistachio kernels
1 plain flour, 1 1/4 baking powder, 1/4 baking soda, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
3/4 yogurt, 60g/ 4 tbsp unsalted butter, 1/4 plain oil, 3/4 caster sugar, 1/2 vanilla extract, 1 large egg
4 green food colouring
100g/ 3.5oz cream cheese, 3/4 thickened cream, 3 caster sugar, 1/2 vanilla extract, 2 lemon juice, salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞ fan-forced). Grease and line a 20 cm / 8" round cake pan with baking paper (parchment paper).

Toast ‚Äì Spread the pistachios on a tray. Bake for 12 minutes, shaking once halfway, or until the pistachios smell nutty and are crisp (eat to check!). Fully cool on the tray (~15 minutes)., Blitz ‚Äì Measure out 3/4 cup pistachios (save the rest for decorating). Blitz into a powder using pulses, taking care not to turn it into a paste. I use a NutriBullet (2 x 2 sec bursts). Spice grinder or small food processor would also work. Some larger pistachio bits are fine, but aim for 98% powder. (Note 6)

Break up clumps ‚Äì Put the pistachio powder in a large bowl with the flour. Briefly whisk to combine then use your fingers to rub pistachio powder clumps into a powder. No need to be meticulous here, just get the larger ones., Dry ‚Äì Add the remaining Dry ingredients then whisk to combine., Wet ‚Äì Put all the Wet ingredients in a separate bowl and whisk until combined., Combine wet & dry ‚Äì Pour the Wet into the Dry ingredients bowl. Use a rubber spatula to mix until the flour is almost mixed in., Colour it! Add the food colouring. Then finish mixing the batter until mostly lump free (small lumps will dissolve when baked)., Scrape the batter into the pan and spread out it out (no need to be meticulous, the surface will smooth out in the oven)., Bake for 40 minutes, turning the pan at 30 minutes so the surface browns evenly, or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out without batter on it., Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a cooling rack and cool completely. (~1 hour), Chop the reserved pistachios (mix of finely chopped and larger chunks)., Spread the cake with the Cream Cheese Whip (steps below). Sprinkle with chopped pistachios. Cut and eat!

Beat the cream cheese for a good 2 minutes on medium high until it's really light and creamy, scraping down the sides as needed. Do not shortcut this step, else you may end up with cream cheese lumps!, Whip ‚Äì Add the remaining ingredients then beat until the cream is softly whipped and spreadable, about 1 minute on medium high.

TITLE: Hokkien noodles with chicken
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 500g/ 1 lb hokkien noodles, 350g/ 12 oz chicken thighs, 2 canola oil, 2 garlic cloves, 8 green onion stems, 1 red capsicum (bell peppers), 3 green cabbage
2 light soy sauce, 1 1/2 dark soy sauce, 2 oyster sauce, 1 Mirin or Chinese cooking wine, 1 sesame oil, 1/8 white pepper
White sesame seeds, Finely sliced green onion
INSTRUCTIONS: Marinate chicken with 1 1/2 tbsp Sauce. Cook chicken 1 min, add garlic and white part of green onion, cook 1 min. Add capsicum & cabbage, cook 2 min. Add green part of green onion, noodles, sauce, toss 2 min. Serve!

Sauce ‚Äì Mix the sauce in a small bowl., Briefly marinate chicken ‚Äì Toss the chicken with 1 1/2 tbsp of the Sauce. Marinate for 10 minutes while you prepare the noodles and vegetables., Rinse noodles ‚Äì Prepare the noodles per the packet directions (soak in boiling water or briefly boil). Drain in a colander then rinse briefly under tap water (Note 8), Sear chicken ‚Äì Heat the oil in a large non-stick pan over high heat until very hot (mine is 30cm/12", Note 9 re: wok). Add the chicken and toss for 1 minute. Add the garlic and white part of the green onion, then toss for another 1 minute or until the surface of the chicken is sealed (but still a bit raw inside), Cook veg & noodles ‚Äì Add the capsicum and cabbage. Toss for 2 minutes until the cabbage is mostly wilted. Add the green part of the green onions, noodles and sauce. Toss for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes until the noodles are stained a lovely mahogany colour., Serve immediately, sprinkled with sesame seeds and green onion if desired!

TITLE: Cheesymite Scrolls (Cheese & Vegemite!)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 bread flour, 3 instant yeast, 2 white sugar, 1 1/4 cooking salt, 1 1/2 cups+ 2 tbsp warm milk
50g/ 3 tbsp salted butter, 3 Vegemite, 5 cups (500 g) Colby cheese
INSTRUCTIONS: Mix dry ingredients, add milk, knead 5 min. Rise until doubled (1.5 hours). Punch, roll out to 48 x 28 cm / 11 x 19‚Äù rectangle. Spread with butter, Vegemite then 300g cheese. Roll, cut into 12, put in lined pan, rise 30% (30 min). Top with remaining cheese., Bake 25 minutes at 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan), rotate, bake 10 minutes 200¬∞C/375¬∞F (180¬∞C fan) ‚Äì keep an eye on it. Cool 10 min, eat!

Check yeast ‚Äì If your yeast is old or you weren't storing it in the fridge, check it's still good, see Note 6., Make dough ‚Äì Put the flour, yeast, sugar and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook. Briefly mix to combine. Add the milk then mix on low until you no longer see flour. Then beat, starting on low then increasing to medium partway through, for 5 minutes until the dough is smooth (see video for before/after visuals). (Note 8), Rise #1 ‚Äì Shape the dough into a ball then put it back in the bowl. Cover with cling wrap. Let it rise in a warm place for 1 1/2 hours or until it doubles in size (see steps in post for more guidance)., Roll out ‚Äì Punch the dough to deflate in the bowl. Lightly flour a work surface, turn the dough out then use your hands to roughly shape it into a rectangle. Then roll out into a 48 x 28 cm / 11 x 19‚Äùrectangle using a rolling pin., Spread the dough with butter then with Vegemite. Sprinkle the whole area evenly with 3 cups (300g) of the cheese., Cut ‚Äì Roll up into a log then cut into 12 even pieces., Pre-heat the oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced). Lightly grease a 23 x 33cm / 9 x 13‚Ä≥ pan with butter. Then line with baking paper with overhang (so you can lift the slab out later)., Rise #2 ‚Äì Place the scrolls into the pan, evenly spaced apart. Spray a piece of cling wrap lightly with oil then cover the pan. Let the scrolls rise in a warm place for 30 minutes or until they expand/rise by about 30-50%., Bake ‚Äì Top the scrolls with the remaining cheese. Bake for 25 minutes. Then rotate the pan and bake for a further 10 minutes at 200¬∞C/375¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced) or until the cheese on the surface of the scrolls around the edge of the pan are light golden., Rest ‚Äì Cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Use the paper overhang to lift the slab onto a cooling rack then cool for a further 5 minutes. Peel the scrolls apart then devour! Best eaten warm. 20 seconds in the microwave!

TITLE: Crispy pea fritters ‚Äì great emergency meal!
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1/4 flour, 1/4 cornflour / cornstarch, 1/2 baking powder, 1/2 garlic powder, 1/2 cooking salt, 1/4 black pepper, 1 large egg, 2 milk
2 frozen peas, 1 shredded cheese, 3/4 finely sliced green onion
1/4 olive oil
1/2 plain yogurt, 2 lemon juice, 2 extra virgin olive oil, 1/8 finely grated garlic, each salt and pepper
INSTRUCTIONS: Mix the Batter ingredients. Stir in the Add-ins. Scoop, flatten, cook 1 1/2 minutes each side. Eat!

Lemon Yogurt Dipping Sauce ‚Äì Mix the ingredients together in a bowl and set aside while you cook the fritters to let the flavours meld., Fritter batter ‚Äì Mix the Batter ingredients until combined. Add the Add-ins, then mix until the batter coats all the peas. It will look like waaaay too much peas for batter, but have faith! The batter will set as it cooks., Measure & flatten ‚Äì Heat enough oil to cover the base of a pan on medium high (~2 1/2 tbsp). Pack a 3 tbsp cookie scoop (#20) or 1/4 cup measure firmly with the mixture. Place mound in the pan, then flatten to 1.25 / 0.5" thick. Repeat to to fill the pan (I do 4 ‚Äì 5 at a time), Cook ‚Äì Cook for 1 1/2 minutes until the underside is golden, then turn and cook the other side for 1 1/2 minutes until golden and crispy. Transfer onto a paper towel lined tray. Repeat with remaining batter to make 9 -10 in total., Serve with Lemon Yogurt Dipping Sauce!

TITLE: Jam Drops (Thumbprint Cookies)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 225g (2 sticks) unsalted butter, softened, 3/4 caster sugar / superfine sugar, 2 vanilla extract, 1 large egg, 2 1/2 plain flour, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/2 strawberry or raspberry jam
INSTRUCTIONS: Cream butter and sugar. Beat in vanilla, egg and salt, then beat in flour. Roll 3cm/1.2" balls (#60 cookie scoop), flatten, indent, fill. Bake 14 minutes 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan), cool on tray.

Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced). Line 2 trays with baking paper/parchment paper., Cream butter and sugar ‚Äì Beat the butter and sugar until creamy ‚Äì about 1 1/2 minutes on medium speed using an electric beater or stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment., Crumbly dough ‚Äì Add the vanilla, egg and salt, then beat for ~20 seconds until incorporated. Add the flour and salt, then beat until you cannot see white flour. The mixture will be crumbly., Form cookies ‚Äì Measure out 1 tablespoon of mixture, very tightly packed (#60 cookie scoop). Tap out onto your hand, scrunch in your first to press into a dough then roll into a smooth ball (3cm/1.2"). Flatten into a 1.25cm / 0.5" thick disc then use your thumb to make an indent. (This method avoids cracks, see Note 3)., Fill ‚Äì Place cookie on the tray, and repeat to make 25 ‚Äì 28 cookies, leaving 3.5cm / 1.5" between each. Fill the indent with slightly heaped 1/2 teaspoon jam (Note 4)., Bake for 14 minutes (both trays at the same time), or until the edges are light golden and the surface is pale golden. Rotate and switch the tray shelves at the 10 minute mark, so they cook evenly., Cool fully on the tray (the base will finish cooking). Then grab and devour!

TITLE: Creamy chicken noodle soup with mini croutons
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 400g/10oz chicken breast, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper

4 strips streaky bacon, 30g/ 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 1/2 onion, 2 garlic cloves, 2 sprigs thyme or 1/2 tsp dried thyme, 2 celery stalks, 1 carrot, 3/4 corn kernels, 4 flour, 3 milk, 2 low sodium chicken stock/broth, 2 water, 1 cooking salt, 1 1/3 cups (100g) broken angel hair pasta, 3/4 frozen peas, 1/2 finely chopped parsley
1 bread, 2 olive oil, Pinch cooking salt / kosher salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Croutons ‚Äì Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C/3450¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced). Toss the bread  with the oil and salt. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, tossing halfway, until golden and fully crisp (some breads take longer eg sourdough). Cool on the tray, set aside., Season chicken ‚Äì Sprinkle both sides of the chicken with the salt and pepper., Crispy bacon ‚Äì Place the bacon in a single layer in an un-heated, large pot. Turn the heat onto medium high then cook the bacon until golden on both sides (~2-3 minutes first side, 1 1/2 minutes second side). (Note 2). Remove bacon (leave fat in pot), drain on paper towels. It will crisp as it cools. Finely chop, set aside for garnish.

Cook chicken ‚Äì Using the same pot, still hot, cook the chicken in the tasty bacon fat for 1 1/2 minutes on each side until light golden. Remove onto a plate. Once cool enough to handle, chop into small 8 mm / 1/3" cubes., Broth ‚Äì Lower heat to medium high. In the same pot, melt the butter. Add the onion, garlic, celery, carrot, thyme sprigs. Cook 5 minutes until the carrot is softened, stirring regularly (don‚Äôt let the onion brown). Add flour and stir for 1 minute. While stirring, slowly pour the milk in. Once the flour is dissolved, add the stock, water and salt, then stir., Simmer ‚Äì Turn the heat up to high and bring to a simmer, then lower the heat and simmer gently for 5 minutes, stirring every now and then. (The soup will seem thin, it thickens as the pasta cooks. Trust!), Pasta ‚Äì Turn the heat back up to high. Add the pasta and corn. Cook for 5 minutes or until pasta is soft, adding the peas and chicken (including any juices pooled) for the last 2 minutes of cook time., Serve ‚Äì Ladle into bowls, sprinkle with bacon, croutons and a pinch of parsley. Eat!

TITLE: Spicy edamame
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 300g/10oz frozen edamame in the pods, 2 cooking salt / kosher salt
1 grapeseed oil, 2 garlic, 1 sambal oelek, 2 sesame oil, 1 Japanese soy sauce, 1 mirin, 1/4 miso paste, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Spicy garlic sauce ‚Äì Heat the oil in a small pan over medium low heat. Cook the garlic until very light golden, then add everything else. Stir, then simmer on low for 1 minute. Remove from stove., Edamame ‚Äì Bring a large pot of water to the boil and add the salt. Put the frozen edamame in the water. Bring it back up to the boil then cook for 2 minutes (Note 5 ‚Äì ignore the packet times, they always say too long!). Drain well, shaking off excess water., Toss ‚Äì Transfer edamame into a bowl, pour over sauce, toss. Transfer into a serving bowl ‚Äì scrape out every drop of sauce! Serve warm or at room temperature., To eat, pick up a sauce-slathered pod. Bite the pod so the soybeans pop out into your mouth, and suck all the sauce off the skin. Discard the skin, repeat and repeat!

TITLE: Beef Tataki
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 250g / 8 oz beef tenderloin/fillet (PREMIUM option), 300g /10 oz sirloin steak
1/2 vegetable oil, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
1 cooking sake, 2 mirin, 1 rice vinegar, 1 1/2 Japanese soy sauce, 1 yuzu
2 grapeseed oil, 3 garlic cloves
Crispy potato straws, Crispy fried shallots
1 green onion
INSTRUCTIONS: Prep ‚Äì Preheat the oven to 130¬∞C / 275¬∞F (all oven types). Rub the beef with the oil and sprinkle with salt. Place on a rack set on a tray., Roast for 18 ‚Äì 20 minutes or until the internal temperature in the middle is 41¬∞C / 105¬∞F (check first at 15 minutes, Note 9)., Sear ‚Äì Heat a cast iron skillet on high heat until it is smoking. Sear each side of the beef for just 10 seconds, no longer (I do 4 sides)., Cool ‚Äì Transfer the beef onto a rack on a tray. Cool for 30 minutes on the counter then refrigerate uncovered for 2 hours., Thinly slice ‚Äì When ready to serve, slice it as thinly as you can without tearing the beef, aiming for 3mm / 1/16" but up to 5mm / 1/8" thick is fine. (Note 10 for tips)
Place the sake and mini in a tiny saucepan on low heat. Bring to a simmer, then simmer for 1 minute. Pour into a bowl, let it cool.  Then stir in remaining dressing ingredients.

Put the garlic and oil in a tiny saucepan on low heat. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring a few times, until the garlic is light golden. Cool for 15 minutes then strain (reserve crispy garlic for another use)

Plate up ‚Äì Lay the beef slices on a plate, overlapping slightly. Drizzle with 3-4 tbsp of the Dressing, then 1 1/2 tbsp of the garlic oil. Pile the crispy potato in a heap in the middle, sprinkle with green onion. (Or use the easy steak garnish options above instead)., To eat ‚Äì Serve straight away. Make sure you get some crispy potato in every bite, and squidge the beef around in the tasty sauce.

Cook ‚Äì Rub the steak with the oil then sprinkle with the salt. Heat a cast iron skillet on high heat until it is smoking. Cook the steak to rare (1 1/2 ‚Äì 2 minutes on each side, but it will depend on thickness of steak), or to your taste (Note 11 for doneness). Cool & thinly slice steak per beef tenderloin steps above., Assemble ‚Äì Place the slices in a line, slightly overlapping. Drizzle over Dressing and oil (or alternative Sauce of choice). Sprinkle crispy fried shallots down the centre then green onion. Serve!

TITLE: Crispy potato straws (Pommes Paille)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 potato, 1 1/2 ‚Äì 2 vegetable oil, Sea salt flakes
INSTRUCTIONS: Shred ‚Äì Finely julienne the potato using a julienne mandoline, 2-4 mm / 1/16 ‚Äì 1/8" thick. (Note 2), Rinse ‚Äì Place potato in a bowl of water and rinse, changing the water as needed, until the water is clear. Drain in a colander. (Potato can be kept in water overnight in the fridge)., Dry ‚Äì Spread on tea towels then pat dry. If time permits, spread out and air dry for 1 hour+. (Drier potato = less oil bubbling + crispier fries)., Heat the oil in a saucepan over high heat to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F, ensuring there is 10 cm/4" clearance above the oil surface (the oil bubbles up)., Add potato into oil ‚Äì SLOWLY scatter potato across the surface of the oil (don't dump in once place). ‚ö†Ô∏èThe oil will bubble up to ~7cm/3", so add potato slowly, and you can pause until the bubbles subside before adding more. (Note 3 for cooking tips), Fry for 1 1/2 ‚Äì 2 minutes, using chopsticks (or similar) to stir once or twice. Once light golden and crisp, scoop out and drain on paper towels. (It goes more golden as it drains). Repeat with remaining potato., Season ‚Äì Carefully slide the fries into a bowl. Sprinkle with salt and gently toss. Serve immediately while warm, or cool., Serve in bowls for munching, as a garnish like for Beef Tataki or serve a mound alongside a juicy steak or other protein (see in post for more ideas).

TITLE: Blondies
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 125g/8 tbsp (1 US stick) unsalted butter, 1 brown sugar, 1 large egg, 1 vanilla extract, 1 flour, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
1 white chocolate chips, 1/2 walnuts
1/4 sea salt flakes
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced). Grease a 20 cm/8" square pan with butter and line with baking paper (parchment paper)., Toast walnuts (Note 3) ‚Äì Spread the walnuts on a tray and roast for 5 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool., Browned butter (don't skip this step): Place the butter in a silver saucepan (not black) over medium high heat. Once melted, lower the heat to medium so it's simmer gently. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring every now and then (it will go foamy), until it smells nutty and you see little golden specks in the butter. Immediately pour the butter and all the golden bits into a bowl., Batter: Add the sugar into the hot butter and mix to combine using a wooden spoon. Leave to cool for 3 minutes. Add the egg and vanilla, mix until combined. Add the flour and salt, and mix to combine. It will be very thick, almost like roll-able cookie dough. Add the chocolate chips and walnuts and mix through., Bake: Scrape into the prepared pan, spread and smooth the surface (I use my hands). Bake for 25 minutes or until the edges are lightly tinged with gold and the surface has a paper thin "crackly" layer., Rest in the pan for 10 minutes before lifting onto a cutting board. Cool for at least another 10 minutes (else it's still a bit too soft and smeary), sprinkle with salt flakes (if using). Cut into 16 squares or 9 giant squares, then devour!

TITLE: Mediterranean tuna salad with creamy feta dressing
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 3 finely chopped curly kale, 2 tomatoes, 1 red capsicum / bell pepper, 1 cucumber, 1 roughly chopped parsley leaves, 8 red radish, 1/2 whole pitted kalamata olives, 50g/ 1.5 oz Danish feta, 425g/ 15 oz canned tuna in oil
100g/ 3.5 oz Danish feta, 3 lemon juice, 4 extra virgin olive oil, 1/2 small garlic clove, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 1 water
Pita bread pockets, Also see Dressing extra flavour options
INSTRUCTIONS: Dressing ‚Äì Put all the ingredients EXCEPT the water in a jug just large enough to fit the head of a stick blender. Blitz until smooth. Add water 1 tsp at a time until it's a thick drizzle-able consistency (don't dilute flavour too much). Then taste and add more salt if needed (feta saltiness varies by brand)., Salad ‚Äì Place all the salad ingredients EXCEPT the feta and tuna in a large bowl. Pour over the dressing, toss. Crumble feta in, toss (it will smear ‚Äì we like!). Add the tuna and gently toss, trying to keep some chunks rather than it all crumbling into tiny pieces., Taste and add more lemon if desired (I enjoy this on the tart side ‚Äì tuna can take it!)., Serve in bowls with spoons for digging in! Tuck warm pita pockets on the side, or use the tuna salad to stuff inside the pita (it's sooooo good!).

TITLE: Crispy oven baked beef quesadillas
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 olive oil, 250g/ 8oz beef mince, 1 tomato paste, 1/3 corn kernels, 1/3 black beans, 2 water
4 flour tortillas, 3 olive oil, 1 1/4 shredded cheese
1/2 EACH ground garlic, 1 EACH cumin, 1/8 cayenne pepper, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
Avocado sauce, Pico de Gallo, Sour cream, Nothing
INSTRUCTIONS: Filling ‚Äì Heat the oil in a non stick pan over high heat. Add the beef and cook, breaking it up as you go, until the red colour is mostly gone. Add the Taco Seasoning and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato paste and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in the beans and corn, then add the water and stir. The filling should be juicy (not dry) but not watery (compromises crispiness!). Remove into a bowl and cool for at least 15 minutes., Preheat the oven to 220¬∞C / 425¬∞F (200¬∞C fan-forced). Grease a metal tray with 1 teaspoon of olive oil (I use my hand)., Assemble quesadillas ‚Äì Spread the filling on one side of the quesadilla. Top with cheese, fold to cover. Place on tray, repeat with remaining quesadillas., Drizzle the top of each with 1/2 tsp olive oil then spread using your hands (top and sides, not underside). Press the quesadilla down to flatten the surface., Bake for 8 minutes. Flip the quesadillas, bake for 5 minutes, flip again then bake for a further 2 minutes or until crispy. (Sometimes I spritz with oil to give it a helping hand), Serve ‚Äì Cut each into half and serve immediately with dipping sauce/toppings of choice.

TITLE: Easy Ricotta Gnocchi with creamy mushroom sauce
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 250g / 8oz ricotta, 3/4 cup (75g) freshly grated parmesan cheese, 1 large egg, 1 egg yolk, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, Pinch black pepper, 3/4 ‚Äì 1 flour

30g / 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 2 garlic cloves, 1/2 onion or 1 eschallot, 2 thyme sprigs, 250g / 8oz white mushrooms, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 1/3 chardonnay, 1/2 chicken stock/broth, 2/3 thickened / heavy cream
Freshly grated parmesan, Fresh parsley
INSTRUCTIONS: Mix ‚Äì Put all the gnocchi ingredients in a bowl except the flour. Use a rubber spatula or wooden spoon to mix until combined (smear up the wall if needed, to help cream the ricotta)., Add flour ‚Äì Add 3/4 cup of flour and mix until just combined so it is a very sticky dough that will hold its shape in a mound, but is not runny like a muffin batter (see video for consistency). Stickier dough = softer gnocchi! Use the remaining flour, 1 tbsp at a time, if needed, but try to stick with 3/4 cup. You can always add more flour in the next step. (Note 3), Form disc ‚Äì Sprinkle a work surface with flour then scrape the dough out onto it. Sprinkle the top lightly with flour then use your hands to give the dough a light knead to bring it into a ball then pat it into a disc about 2.5cm/1" thick. Cut it into 8 wedges, using a knife or dough scraper dusted with flour as needed between each cut, Roll and cut ‚Äì Roll each piece into a log 25cm/10" long, about 1.25cm / 1/2" wide. Cut into 1.5 cm / 3/5" pieces (Can freeze at this point ‚Äì Note 4)

Cook mushrooms ‚Äì Melt the butter in a large pan over high heat. Add the onion, garlic and thyme sprigs. Cook for 1 minute. Add mushrooms, salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes until the mushrooms is softened., Sauce ‚Äì Add the wine and simmer rapidly for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring to scrape the base of the pan, until mostly evaporated. Add the stock/broth and cream, then stir., Simmer ‚Äì Bring to a simmer then reduce the heat to medium low and simmer gently for 5 minutes until thickened. (It's ok if it seems a bit thin, the starch from gnocchi will thicken it quickly, have faith!).

Cook gnocchi ‚Äì Bring a large pot of water to the boil with 2 teaspoons of salt. Tumble the gnocchi in and cook for around 2 1/2 minutes, or until the gnocchi is floating on the surface for around 30 seconds, no longer (else they overcook!), Sauce it ‚Äì Use a spider or large slotted spoon to scoop the gnocchi out of the water and straight into the sauce (excess water drips in the sauce are good!). Turn the heat up to medium and toss gently for 1 minute or until the sauce thickens and coats the gnocchi. If the sauce gets too thick, add a splash of the gnocchi cooking water., Serve immediately, garnished with freshly grated parmesan and parsley, if desired.

TITLE: Chicken Cacciatore
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 bone in chicken thighs large, 4 chicken drumsticks, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 1 olive oil

1 onion, 2 rosemary sprigs, 2 bay leaves, 3 garlic cloves, 3 anchovy fillets, 250g / 8 oz mushrooms, 2 red capsicum, 1/3 tomato paste, 3/4 pinot noir, 2 chicken stock/broth, 400g/14 oz canned crushed tomato, 16 whole kalamata olives, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 1 dried oregano
Mashed potato, Finely chopped parsley
INSTRUCTIONS: Season ‚Äì Spread the chicken out on a tray. Sprinkle both sides with the salt and pepper., Brown skin ‚Äì Heat the oil over high heat in a large, deep, heavy based pan, preferably one with a lid (Note 4). Place the chicken thighs in the pan, skin side down, and cook until the skin is golden brown, around 6 minutes. Turn and cook the flesh side for just 1 minute, then remove the chicken onto the same tray. Then add the drumsticks and brown each side as best you can, about 1 1/2 minutes on each side (the shape makes it awkward). Remove onto the tray.

Onion ‚Äì Pour off and discard all but about 2 tablespoons of fat. Turn the heat down to medium and let the pan cool slightly. Add the onion, rosemary leaves, bay leaves and dried oregano. Cook for 3 minutes until the onion is starting to soften., Garlic and anchovies ‚Äì Clear a space in the middle of the pan. Add the anchovies and garlic, cooking, mashing up the anchovies, until the garlic is light golden, then stir it into the onion., Vegetables & tomato paste ‚Äì Turn the heat back up to high. Add the mushroom and capsicum. Stir until softened ‚Äì about 5 minutes (the mushrooms will go watery then the water will evaporate). Add the tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes to cook out the sour flavour ‚Äì do not shortcut this., Sauce ‚Äì Add the wine. Stir, bring to simmer then allow to reduce by around 75%. Add the stock, canned tomato, salt and pepper. Stir, bring to a simmer., Simmer ‚Äì Then carefully place the chicken into the sauce (skin side up) and pour any juices on the tray in as well. When the liquid returns to a simmer, cover, reduce the heat to medium then simmer energetically for 20 minutes. Remove lid, add olives, simmer for a further 10 minutes (no lid). This will reduce and thicken the sauce., Serve ‚Äì  Serve the chicken with plenty of sauce over mashed potato or polenta, sprinkled with parsley if desired.

TITLE: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cake for a Crowd
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 3/4 flour, 3/4 cocoa powder, 1 1/2 baking powder, 1 1/2 baking soda, 2 white sugar, 1 cooking / kosher salt, 2 large eggs, 1 milk, 1/2 vegetable oil, 2 vanilla extract, 2 instant coffee powder, 1 boiling water
250g / 2 sticks unsalted butter, 4 cups (500 g) soft icing sugar / powdered sugar, 1/2 cup (120 g) smooth peanut butter, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1 milk
1/2 chocolate chips or melts, 2 cream, 3 peanut butter, 120g / 4 oz mini Reece's Peanut Butter Cups, 10+ miniature Reece's Peanut Butter Cups, 1/4 salted peanuts
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180C¬∞/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan)., Grease a 23 x 33cm / 9 x 13" metal cake pan with butter. Then line with paper with overhang, to make it easier to lift out. (For round pans, see Note 4).

Dry ingredients ‚Äì Sift flour, cocoa, baking powder and baking soda into a large bowl. Add Sugar and salt. Whisk briefly to combine., Wet ingredients ‚Äì Add eggs, milk, oil and vanilla. Whisk well to combine until lump free ‚Äì about 30 seconds., Boiling water ‚Äì Add the coffee powder then the boiling water. Whisk to incorporate. The batter is VERY thin (see video). Pour batter into the cake pan.
Bake for 45 minutes or until a wooden skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean., Cool for 10 minutes, then fully cool on a wire rack before frosting (~2 hours).

Beat butter¬†for 3 minutes on high until soft and fluffy, using a stand mixer with the paddle attachment or handheld beater., Icing sugar ‚Äì Add icing sugar in 3 lots. Beat it in, starting on low speed then increasing the speed (to avoid a snow storm). Once incorporated, add more icing sugar and repeat., Beat 3 minutes ‚Äì¬†Once the icing sugar has all been added, added the peanut butter, salt and milk. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes to make it really nice and fluffy. Ready to use!

Chocolate drizzle ‚Äì Place the chocolate and cream in a small bowl. Microwave in 15 second increments on high, stirring in between, until smooth. Cool for 10 minutes before using., Frost ‚Äì Spread all the frosting across the surface of the cake, from edge to edge., Decorate ‚Äì Drizzle the top randomly with half the chocolate drizzle and melted peanut butter. Sprinkle with the peanut butter cups. Drizzle with remaining chocolate and peanut butter and sprinkle with the peanuts., Serve immediately! Cut into pieces as large (or small üò¢) as you want. Refrigerate leftovers for 5 days though always bring to room temperature (because the frosting goes hard when cold).

TITLE: My quickest Chinese Vegetable Soup ‚Äì low calorie miracle!
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 1 litre / 4 cups chicken stock/broth,, 2 garlic cloves, 1.5 cm / 1/2" ginger piece,, 1 star anise, 1 1/2 light soy sauce, 2 sugar, 1 1/2 chinese cooking wine, 1/2 sesame oil
4 ‚Äì 6 stems Chinese broccoli, 1 small carrot, 75g / 2.5 oz enoki mushrooms
1/2 coriander/cilantro sprigs/leaves, 1 green onion, 2 crispy fried shallots, Chilli crisp, chilli sauce or sriracha, Other ideas: sesame seeds, sliced chilli, Thai basil
INSTRUCTIONS: Infused broth ‚Äì Place Broth ingredients in a large saucepan over high heat. Place lid on, bring to a simmer then reduce to the lowest heat and simmer gently for 10 minutes to allow the flavours to infuse. (Meanwhile, chop the veg), Cook vegetables ‚Äì Turn the heat up to high and bring the liquid back to a rapid simmer. Add the carrots, Chinese broccoli stems and enoki mushrooms. Cook 3 minutes. Add Chinese broccoli leaves, push in a simmer for 2 minutes until wilted., Serve ‚Äì Pick the garlic and ginger out of soup.  Divide between 2 bowls. Top with a mound of coriander, sprinkle with green onions, shower with crispy shallots, and a good dollop of chilli sauce or chilli crisp. Dig in, feel good!

TITLE: Lamb korma curry
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 large onions, 8 large garlic cloves, 4cm/ 1.5" ginger
1/4 cashews, 1/3 water

3 ghee, 800g / 1.6 lb lamb shoulder, 1/2 ground turmeric, 2 1/2 ground ginger, 5 1/2 garam marsala, 1 kashmiri chilli powder, 2 chicken stock/broth, 10 cardamom pods, 2 cinnamon sticks, 4 white sugar, 1 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/2 coconut cream, 1/2 cream
Basmati rice, Naan, Cashews finely chopped, Coriander/cilantro leaves
INSTRUCTIONS: Onion puree ‚Äì Place the onion, garlic and ginger into a tall container that fits the head of a stick blender. Blitz until smooth ‚Äì about 5 to 10 seconds. Scrape into a bowl, set aside., Cashew puree ‚Äì In the same jar, while covering the mouth of the jar with your hand (to prevent flying cashew comets), blitz the cashews and water with the stick blender until smooth, about 10 seconds. , Set aside., Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced)., Reduce onion puree ‚Äì Melt and heat ghee in a ~24 cm/ 10" oven-proof pot over high-heat. Cook the onion puree, stirring regularly, for 8 minutes until it has reduced by half. Don‚Äôt let it caramelise., Add lamb, reduce to medium-high heat then stir until the meat changes from red to light brown. Don‚Äôt try to brown the meat (it won't happen)., Sauce ‚Äì Add turmeric, ground ginger, garam marsala and kashmiri chilli, then stir through. Pour in the stock (the liquid should just barely cover the meat). Add cardamom pod sachet and cinnamon sticks, then stir. Bring to a simmer, cover with a lid then transfer to the oven., Slow cook ‚Äì Cook for 1 1/2 hours. Stir in Cashew Puree, put the lid back on then return to the oven for another 30 minutes. The sauce should have thickened to a creamy consistency and lamb should be tender end to pull apart with forks with no effort. (Note 6), Creamy sauce ‚Äì Place the pot on a low heat. Add the sugar, salt, coconut cream and cream, then stir. Simmer for 2 minutes, then you‚Äôre done!, Serve over basmati rice with a sprinkle of cashew nuts and coriander, if desired. Naan for dunking highly recommended!

TITLE: Moussaka beef rice pilaf
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 olive oil, 4 garlic cloves, 1 onion, 500g / 1 lb beef mince / ground beef, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1 1/2 dried oregano, 2 tomato paste, 300g/ 10oz eggplant, 1/3 pinot noir, 1 basmati rice, 400g / 14 oz can chickpeas, 400g / 14 oz can crushed tomato, 1 1/2 chicken stock/broth, 1 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper
1 parsley, Extra virgin olive oil, Dollop of Greek yogurt
INSTRUCTIONS: ‚ö†Ô∏è Eggplant cube size ‚Äì Make sure they're no larger than 1.5 cm / 1/2" max, else they may not cook through properly!, Cook beef ‚Äì Heat the oil on a large pot over high heat. Add the onion and garlic, cook for 2 minutes. Add the beef and cook, breaking it up as you go, until you no longer see red. Add the 1/2 tsp salt and oregano. Cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute (don't shortcut this step ‚Äì Note 3)., Deglaze ‚Äì Add the eggplant and the cubes are coated in the red beef juices. Add the wine, bring it to a simmer, stir (scrape the base of the pot) then let it mostly evaporate., Broth ‚Äì Add the rice and stir to coat. Add remaining ingredients, stir, bring to a simmer. Give it one last stir then once there are gentle bubbles all across the surface (not just around the edge), put the lid on and turn the heat down to medium low (or low, if using a strong stove)., Steam rice ‚Äì Cook for 20 minutes, no peeking, no stirring! The liquid will be absorbed by the stage though there will be a layer of tomato on the surface (peek quickly!)., Rest ‚Äì Remove the pot from the stove and rest for 10 minutes (lid still on) ‚Äì residual liquid will be absorbed and the rice will finish cooking., Eat! Toss the rice ‚Äì it will be juicy but not mushy! Divide between bowls, drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with parsley and enjoy!

TITLE: Smoky Roasted Tomato Soup
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1.5kg/ 3 lb tomatoes, 5 garlic cloves, 2 olive oil, 1 1/2 smoked paprika, 1 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
1 olive oil, 2 garlic cloves, 1 onion, 1 litre (4 cups) vegetable stock/broth, 1/2 white sugar, 1/2 cream, 1/4 roughly chopped fresh basil leaves
Grilled cheese!
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat the oven to 220¬∞C/425¬∞F (200¬∞C fan-forced)., Toss & squidge ‚Äì Place the tomatoes and unpeeled garlic cloves on a tray. Drizzle/sprinkle with the oil, paprika, salt and pepper. Toss to coat, squidging the cut face of the tomato in the oil on the tray to thoroughly coat. Arrange tomatoes cut face up., Roast for 40 to 45 minutes or until there is some charring on the tomatoes (see photos).

Saut√© ‚Äì Heat the oil in a large pot over medium high heat. Saut√© the garlic and onion for 3 minutes or until the onion is translucent., Tomatoes ‚Äì Remove the garlic cloves from the baking tray. Scrape all the tomatoes and juices into the pot. Squeeze garlic flesh into the pot. Add vegetable stock., Blitz with a stick blender until smooth (or do this in a food processor or blender)., Simmer ‚Äì Bring to a simmer then lower heat to medium and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the cream., Ladle into bowls, drizzle with cream and garnish with basil. Dunk in grilled cheese and enjoy!

TITLE: Pizza Capricciosa
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 classic pizza dough, 1 fast no-yeast pizza dough, 1 Store bought
1/4 tomato paste, 1/4 cooking salt  / kosher salt, 1/2 white sugar, 1/2 water, 1/2 garlic clove, 1/8 EACH dried parsley¬†, basil and oregano
1 1/3 cup (130 g) mozzarella cheese, freshly shredded, 1/2 artichokes, 3 button mushrooms, 2/3 cup (70 g) shaved leg ham, 1/4 sliced kalamata olives
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 250¬∞C / 480¬∞F (both fan and standard). Allow time to get it nice and hot!!, Pizza sauce ‚Äì Mix the ingredients in a small bowl then set aside., Pizza base ‚Äì Make and stretch out your chosen pizza base (no rolling pin!), stretch onto a pizza pan or baking tray per the directions in your chosen pizza base. (Note 4 for pizza stone), Top ‚Äì Spread the pizza sauce on the pizza, leaving a 1 cm/1/2" border along the edge. Sprinkle with cheese first, then drape the ham randomly across the surface, sprinkle with olives, artichoke slices and mushrooms. (If using the no-yeast pizza base, spray/brush exposed crust with olive oil.), Bake for 10 ‚Äì 12 minutes, turning after 4 minutes, or until the the cheese has golden spots and the crust is crispy. Cut and eat, stat!

TITLE: Easy Singapore Chicken Vermicelli Noodles
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 100 g/3.5 oz dried vermicelli noodles
3 light soy sauce, 3 Chinese cooking wine, 3 curry powder, 1 white sugar, 1/2 white pepper
150g/ 5 oz skinless boneless chicken thighs, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/2 curry powder
2 plain oil, 2 eggs, 100g/3 oz streaky bacon, 1/2 brown onion, 3 garlic cloves, 1 red capsicum, 1 bean sprouts, 1 baby spinach
INSTRUCTIONS: Sauce ‚Äì Mix the sauce in a small bowl or jug., Season chicken ‚Äì Toss the seasoned chicken ingredients in a bowl., Prepare noodles per the packet directions then drain in a colander (usually says to soak in boiled water for 3 ‚Äì 5 minutes)., Egg ribbons ‚Äì Heat a small amount of the oil in a large non stick pan over medium high heat. Pour the egg in a swirl to make a thin omelette. Once the surface is set (literally 30 seconds), slide or flip it onto a cutting board. Cool so you can handle it, roll it up into a cigar then cut into 7mm / 1/3" strips. Separate. Voila! Egg ribbons!, Stir-fry ‚Äì Heat the remaining oil in the same pan over high heat. Add the bacon and cook for 1 minute. Add the onion and cook until it starts to wilt and the bacon is light golden (about 2 minutes). Add the chicken and cook until the surface is seared. Then add the garlic and capsicum and cook for another 2 minutes until the chicken is cooked., Noodles ‚Äì Add (in this order) the baby spinach, bean sprouts, noodles then sauce. Using 2 spatulas, toss well for 1 1/2 minutes or until the sauce stains the noodles. There will be noodle breakage ‚Äì that's normal., Finish ‚Äì Toss through the egg ribbons (gently, just to disperse) then serve immediately!

TITLE: The most amazing Chicken Kale Salad
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 5 Tuscan kale (cavolo nero), 1 extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 salt and pepper
1/4 red onion, 1 1/2 shredded cooked chicken, 2 soft boiled eggs
1 1/2 cherry or grape tomatoes, 2 extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 cooking salt/kosher salt, 1/8 black pepper
400 g/ 14 oz chickpeas, 1 olive oil, 1/2 smoked paprika, 1/4 EACH garlic powder , onion powder, 1/4 EACH cooking salt / kosher salt & black pepper
4 tbsp (60 g) tahini, 2 1/2 lemon juice, 3 extra virgin olive oil, 1/3 parmesan, 1/2 cooking salt/kosher salt, 1/8 black pepper, 1 large garlic clove, 4 water
INSTRUCTIONS: Oven ‚Äì Roast tomatoes 12 min at 200¬∞C/425¬∞F (180¬∞C fan). Roast plain chickpeas 10 min, toss with oil & seasonings, roast 20 min until crispy (same temp)., Salad ‚Äì Massage kale, leave 20 min. Blitz dressing. Toss kale, chicken, tomatoes, onion with half. Pile on chickpeas, drizzle with remaining dressing, shower with parmesan. EAT!

Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C/425¬∞F (180¬∞C fan)., Roast tomatoes ‚Äì Toss the tomatoes with the oil, salt and pepper on a small tray. Roast 12 minutes, then cool on the tray., Crispy chickpeas ‚Äì Drain the chickpeas then spread on a tray (still wet). Bake 10 minutes (same time as tomatoes). Push the oven dried chickpeas to one side of the tray. Drizzle with the oil and sprinkle with the chickpea spices, salt and pepper. Toss well using a rubber spatula, then return to the oven for a further 20 ‚Äì 25 minutes until they're crispy (They should clatter! Note 4)., Soften kale ‚Äì Rub/scrunch the kale with the oil, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Put the kale in a large bowl then drizzle with the oil and add the salt and pepper. Set aside for 20 minutes (softens leaves)., Tahini dressing ‚Äì Put the ingredients in a jug just large enough to fit the head of a stick blender. Blitz until smooth, using extra water if needed to loosen into a thick but pourable consistency (see video)., Toss ‚Äì Pour half the dressing over the kale and toss. Add onion, chicken and most of the tomatoes (save a few for decoration). Toss again., Serve ‚Äì Transfer into a serving bowl or individual bowls. Top with remaining tomatoes, all the chickpeas and eggs if using. Drizzle with remaining sauce then sprinkle with extra parmesan. DIG IN. SWOON!

TITLE: Zucchini cheese muffin slab
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 zucchinis, 3/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 2 shredded cheese at room temperature
1 medium zucchini, 1 extra virgin olive oil, black pepper, 2 sea salt flakes
2 3/4 flour, 3 1/2 baking powder, 1/2 baking soda / bi-carbonate of soda, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt
2 garlic cloves, 1 milk, 50g / 3 tbsp unsalted butter, 3 neutral oil, 2 large eggs, 1 white vinegar
INSTRUCTIONS: Sweat zucchini ‚Äì Grate 2 of the zucchinis using a box grater. Toss with the salt then set aside for 20 minutes. Grab handfuls and squeeze out excess liquid (no need to be super forceful here but make a bit of effort!). You should have 2 very tightly packed cups. Set aside., Decorative zucchini ‚Äì Finely slice the 3rd zucchini however you want, to decorate the surface. I cut the zucchini in half then into long strips. Thin coins is also nice. Toss with the oil and pepper., Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced). Lightly grease a 23 x 33cm / 9 x 13" metal pan with butter. Line with paper with overhang (so you can lift it out later).

Batter ‚Äì Whisk the Dry ingredients in a large bowl using a handheld whisk. Make a well in the centre. Whisk the Wet ingredients in a separate bowl until combined. Pour the Wet into the Dry ingredients. Mix using a wooden spoon until the flour is mostly incorporated but there's still flour visible., Add-ins ‚Äì Add zucchini and cheese then mix through. Some flour lumps is fine. Minimise mixing else the crumb will be tough. The batter will be thick ‚Äì the zucchini will sweat more in the oven., Bake ‚Äì Scrape into the prepared pan and smooth the surface. Top with the zucchini slices. Bake for 40 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the middle comes out clean., Cool ‚Äì Sprinkle with sea salt flakes. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Use the excess paper to slide the slab onto a cooling rack then remove the paper. Cool for at least another 10 minutes., Cut into pieces (3 x 5 pieces, or 4 x 5). Nobody ever says no to a smear of butter either, especially if served warm!

TITLE: Crispy Pork Belly Banh Mi
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1kg / 2 lb pork belly with skin on, 1 1/2 canola or vegetable oil, 1/2 Chinese Five Spice, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
4 Hoisin sauce, 3 coconut milk, 1/2 dark soy sauce

5 crusty white rolls, 120g/ 4 oz chicken pate, 6 whole-egg mayonnaise, 1 Vietnamese pickled carrots and daikon, 3 green onion stems, 2 cucumbers, 2 coriander/cilantro leaves, 3 Birds Eye or Thai chillis, 8 crispy fried shallots
INSTRUCTIONS: Dry skin overnight: Place pork belly on a plate. Pat skin dry with paper towels. Leave uncovered in fridge overnight to dry out the skin. (If you don't have time, pat the skin dry as best you can)., Preheat oven to 140¬∞C/285¬∞F (both fan and standard ovens)., Season flesh: Drizzle flesh side with 1 tsp oil. Sprinkle over 1/2 tsp salt, and all the pepper and Chinese five spice. Rub all over the flesh, including on the sides., Foil boat: Place 2 pieces of foil on a work surface. Put the belly in middle of foil, skin side up. Fold the sides in to enclose the belly, forming an open box, pinching corners to seal tightly and make it as snug as possible. Place meat on a tray., Season skin: Pat skin dry with paper towels. Rub with 1/2 tsp oil then sprinkle remaining 1/2 tsp salt evenly all over the skin surface, from edge to edge., Slow roast 2 hours: Place in the oven and roast for 2 hours, tightening the foil around the pork after 1 hour (the pork will shrink). This protects the flesh from drying out., Increase heat: Remove pork from oven, then increase heat to 240¬∞C/465¬∞F (all oven types)., Level pork: Remove pork from foil, discard fat and foil. Place pork on a rack set over a tray. Use scrunched up balls of foil stuffed under pork to prop it up so the skin surface is as level and horizontal as possible (see photos in post)., 30 minutes blast! Place the pork back in the oven for 30 minutes, rotating after 15 minutes as needed, until the crackling is deep golden, puffy and crispy all over. If some patches are browning faster, protect with foil patches., Rest 10 minutes: Remove pork from oven. Rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

Sauce ‚Äì Mix the ingredients in a bowl then set aside. This will keep for 5 days in the fridge ., Chop pork ‚Äì Cut the pork into 1 1/2 cm / 0.6" thick slices, then each slide into 1 1/2 cm / 0.6" chunks., Split & spread ‚Äì Split the roll in half down the side, keeping the lid attached. Smear the base with 1 1/2 tbsp of pate, then 1 1/2 tbsp of mayonnaise (on top of the pate), Stuff ‚Äì Pile about 1/3 cup pickled vegetables on the mayonnaise. Lay 2 slices of cucumber and 2 green onions against the lid. Pile pork on top. Drizzle pork with 1 tbsp of sauce. Stuff coriander/cilantro down the side, sprinkle with chilli then2 tablespoons of crispy shallots as you want (if using)., Serving ‚Äì Eat immediately! Banh mi is definitely one of those foods best eaten freshly made!

TITLE: Vietnamese pickled carrots and daikon (radish)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 medium carrots, 1/2 large daikon (white radish), 1 1/2 boiling water, 1/2 white sugar, 4 cooking / kosher salt, 3/4 rice wine vinegar
INSTRUCTIONS: Pickle ‚Äì In a large bowl, dissolve the salt and sugar in the hot water. Stir in vinegar. Add carrots and daikon ‚Äì they should just about be covered., 2 hours ‚Äì Leave for 2 hours until the vegetables are slightly floppy., Using ‚Äì Drain well to use, or just take out what you need (no liquid, just the vegetables)., Storing ‚Äì The vegetables will keep in the fridge for 2 months, in the pickling liquid. Use airtight glass containers or jars (not plastic).

TITLE: Tray bake dinner: lamb kofta meatballs
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1/2 onion, 500 g / 1 lb lamb mince, 1/4 panko breadcrumbs, 2 garlic, 2 coriander/cilantro
2 cumin, 2 coriander, 2 paprika, 1 1/2 ground cinnamon, 3/4 cayenne pepper, 3/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper
1 red capsicum, 1 yellow capsicum, 1 red onion, 1 extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 each cooking/kosher salt and pepper
Olive oil spray, 4 flatbreads, 1 Tahini sauce, 3 shredded iceberg lettuce, 2 tomatoes, 1 coriander/cilantro leaves
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced)., Kofta meatballs ‚Äì Place the Kofta ingredients and spices in a bowl. Use your hands to combine thoroughly then roll 16 large-ish meatballs (I scoop all mixture onto a tray, then roll into balls). Spread them out on a large tray., Vegetables ‚Äì Toss the vegetables with the oil, salt and pepper. Scatter around the meatballs., Bake ‚Äì Spray the meatballs with oil. Bake for 15 minutes then switch the oven to the grill/broiler on high. Cook for a further 5 minutes to get some colour on the surface., Serve ‚Äì Sprinkle with the chopped coriander then serve! To make wraps, stuff with lettuce, tomato, meatballs, and the cook capsicum and onion. Drizzle with lots of tahini sauce then tuck in! Other ideas: rice or couscous bowls or big salads ‚Äì see below.

TITLE: Tahini Sauce
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1/4 tahini, 2 1/2 ‚Äì 3 water, 1 lemon juice, 1/2 garlic clove, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 white pepper, 1 1/2 honey
1/4 flaked almonds, pine nuts or pistachios
INSTRUCTIONS: Mix Tahini Sauce ingredients until combined. It should be loose enough so it can be drizzled, but not too runny. Set aside 15 minutes to let the flavours meld.

Sauce for Middle Eastern cooked proteins (like Chicken Shawarma, Lamb Shawarma, koftas and meatballs) and in wraps, sandwiches, Roasted vegetables ‚Äì drizzle over roasted vegetables (carrots, cauliflower, broccoli, pumpkin, green beans and asparagus are some favourites), Dip for pita bread, crisps or raw vegetable sticks, and things like Arayes (crispy Lebanese Meat Stuffed Pita Breads).

TITLE: Crunchy muesli bars (granola bars)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1/4 honey, 1/4 natural peanut butter, smooth
1 1/2 rolled oats*, 1/2 almonds*, 1/4 pepitas*, 1/2 sultanas*, 3/4 cinnamon powder, 1/4 cooking / kosher salt, 2 small chocolate chips
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat the oven to 160¬∞C/325¬∞F (140¬∞C fan-forced). Place a sheet of baking paper over a 20 cm / 8" square tin with overhang so it's easy to lift out later (no greasing needed)., Toast: Spread the oats, chopped almonds and pepitas on a tray. Bake for 10 minutes. Tip into a heatproof bowl. (Note 5) Add the sultanas, cinnamon and salt., Muesli mixture: Microwave the honey and peanut butter in a heatproof jug for 30 seconds on high. Mix to combine. (Note 6) Pour over the oat mixture and mix through. It might seem like it won't mix in, but persist, it will! Use a cutting motion if needed. Last resort ‚Äì Note 7, Press: Tip the muesli mixture into the pan then press firmly into the pan. Once cooled, scatter the choc chips across surface (if using). Cover with a sheet of paper then press down firmly with your hands to push the choc chips in., Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm enough to lift out without bending., Preheat the oven to 160¬∞C/325¬∞F (140¬∞C fan-forced)., Cut: Use the paper overhang to lift the muesli slab onto a cutting board. Cut in half, then each into 5 (10 bars). Transfer onto a tray using the paper, then space the muesli bars out., Bake for 25 minutes or until quite golden on the surface and golden brown on the edges but not burnt., Cool & crunchy: Remove from the oven and cool on the tray ‚Äì it will become crunchy! Store in an airtight container once cooled, in the fridge if it's warm where you are. It will still be crunchy 3 weeks later!

TITLE: Sausage ragu with pappardelle pasta
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 olive oil, 1 small onion, 3 garlic cloves, 1 carrot, 2 celery stalks, 1 fennel seeds, 350g / 12 oz pork sausages, 350g / 12 oz beef sausages, 2 tomato paste, 1 pinot noir red wine, 1 chicken stock/broth, 400g/14 oz can crushed tomato, 3 thyme sprigs, 2 bay leaves, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 1/4 chilli flakes
500g/ 1 lb pappardelle pasta, Parmesan or parmigiano reggiano, Parsley
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C (160¬∞C fan-forced)., Soffrito ‚Äì Heat the oil in a large heavy based pot (with a lid) over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, carrot, celery and fennel seeds. Cook for 8 minutes until the carrot is soft and sweet, but not golden., Cook sausage ‚Äì Turn the heat up to high and add the sausage. Cook, breaking it up as you go, as best you can. It doesn't crumble as well as mince/ground meat but that's ok, we will break it up more later., Deglaze ‚Äì Once the meat is no longer pink (it doesn't really brown), add the tomato paste. Cook for 1 minute. Add the wine and let it simmer rapidly for 2 minutes until reduced by half, stirring regularly to scrape the base of the pot clean., Slow cook #1 (1 hr) ‚Äì Add the remaining ragu ingredients. Stir, bring to a simmer, put the lid on and place it in the oven for 1 hour., Slow cook #2 (45 min) ‚Äì Remove from the oven and use a potato masher to mash the meat finer. Put the lid back on, and return to the oven for 45 minutes. The sauce will be quite thick, it gets loosened when tossed with the pasta., Salt ‚Äì Taste and add more salt if desired. (Sausages vary in saltiness so I always start with less)

Cook pasta ‚Äì Cook the pappardelle according to the packet instructions. Just before draining, scoop out 1 1/2 cups of the cooking water and set it aside., Toss with sauce ‚Äì Have the ragu pot on the stove over medium heat. Add the pasta into the pot along with 1/2 cup of the pasta cook water. Use two spatulas to toss the pasta until the ragu is tangled in the pasta strands and it is stained red from the sauce. Use extra pasta cooking water if needed to loosen it up., Serve in pre-warmed bowls, garnish with parmesan and a pinch of parsley if desired. Eat immediately!

TITLE: Crispy Salt & Pepper Squid
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 700 g / 1.4 lb medium whole baby squid, 500 g / 1 lb squid tubes
2/3 cornflour / cornstarch, 1/3 plain / all-purpose flour, 1/2 baking powder, 1/2 cooking / kosher salt, 1/4 white pepper powder, 2/3 cold tap water
3 ‚Äì 4 vegetable or canola oil, Cooking / kosher salt, White pepper powder
1/2 whole egg mayonnaise, 1/2 finely grated garlic
INSTRUCTIONS: Cut one side of the squid tube to lay it out in one flat piece. Pat both sides dry with a paper towel., Lightly score the inside with a small sharp knife in 1.5 cm / 0.6" diamonds (don't cut all the way through). (Note 3), Cut the squid into pieces 5 x 2cm (2 x 1") rectangles (approximately).
Mix the ingredients together in a bowl and set aside for at least 20 minutes (up to 24 hours).

Batter ‚Äì Whisk the flour, cornflour, baking powder and salt in a bowl. Then whisk in water until smooth. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. (Note 4), Heat oil ‚Äì Fill small heavy based pot or large saucepan with 4cm / 1.5" of oil. Heat to 160¬∞C/320¬∞F on medium high heat. (I use a Thermapen to check the temp), Give the batter a quick whisk then add all the squid in a toss to coat. (Including tentacles if using baby squid ‚Äì it's the crunchiest!)

Batter ‚Äì Cook the squid in 3 batches. Pick up some squid and let the excess batter to drip off. Careful place in the oil. Use chopsticks to seperate the pieces that stick together., Fry baby squid for 2 minutes or the regular squid tubes for 3 minutes until light golden. Use a spider or slotted spoon to remove the squid on a paper towel lined tray., Repeat ‚Äì Fry remaining squid, making sure the oil comes back to temperature before cooking batches 2 and 3.

Increase oil temp ‚Äì Increase the stove to high and bring the the oil up to 200¬∞C/390¬∞F., Bowl ‚Äì Line a large mixing bowl with double layer of paper towels., Fry ‚Äì Place half of the squid in the oil (it's ok to crowd the pot). Cook for 1 1/2 minutes, until it becomes deep golden and crispy. Remove into the bowl. Bring the oil back up to 200¬∞C/390¬∞F then fry the remaining squid., Season ‚Äì Remove paper towel. Taste first then sprinkle lightly with as much salt and pepper as you want (the batter has salt in it already). Toss well.
Pour into a serving bowl and serve with aioli! This batter is so good, it will stay crispy even once the squid has gone cold.

TITLE: Spicy maple roast carrots with crispy chickpeas and yogurt sauce
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 16 Dutch carrots, 600 g/ 1.2 lb regular carrots
3 maple syrup, 2 sriracha, 1 1/2 olive oil, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
400g/ 14 oz can chickpeas, 1 olive oil, 1/2 smoked paprika, 1/4 garlic powder, 1/4 onion powder, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
1 maple syrup, 1/2 sriracha
1 plain yogurt, 1/2 garlic, 1 lemon juice, 1 extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
2 finely chopped coriander/cilantro leaves, 3 toasted pistachios
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C/425¬∞F (180¬∞C fan). Arrange the oven racks so they are 20 cm/8" apart (for air circulation)., Chickpeas & carrots ‚Äì Drain the chickpeas then spread on a tray (still wet). Toss the carrots with the Spicy Maple Sauce ingredients. Put both trays in the oven (carrots on the top shelf)., Crispy chickpeas ‚Äì Remove the oven dried chickpeas from the oven after 10 minutes (Note 4). Push them to one side of the tray, drizzle with the oil and sprinkle with the chickpea spices, salt and pepper. Toss well using a rubber spatula, then return to the oven for a further 20 ‚Äì 25 minutes until they're crispy (listen for the clatter when you shake the tray ‚Äì or eat one! Note 4)., Carrots 30 min  ‚Äì Roast the carrots for 30 minutes, tossing halfway, until they are tender and caramelised on the edges., Yogurt Sauce ‚Äì Mix the ingredients in a bowl and set aside for at least 20 minutes to allow the flavours to develop., Extra sauce ‚Äì Mix until combined., Assemble ‚Äì Spread the yogurt sauce on a plate. Pile on the carrots, scraping out every drop of juices on the tray. Drizzle with extra sauce, if using. Sprinkle over chickpeas, then coriander and pistachios. EAT!

TITLE: Jalape√±o poppers
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 12 jalape√±os
150g / 5oz streaky bacon, 250g/ 8 oz cream cheese, 1 1/2 cups (150g) sharp cheddar cheese,, 1/2 green onion, 2 garlic cloves, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1/8 black pepper
2/3 panko breadcrumbs, 1/8 salt, 1 ‚Äì 2 olive oil
1 cup (100 g) sharp cheddar cheese,, 2 chives
INSTRUCTIONS: Crumbled bacon ‚Äì Place bacon in a single layer in a large unheated non-stick pan (no oil, Note 2). Turn the stove onto medium high. As the pan heats up, the fat will start to melt. Once sizzling, cook each side for 2 minutes or until golden. Remove onto paper towels to drain the fat (leave fat in the pan). Repeat with remaining bacon. Once cool and crisp, finely chop into crumbs., Toast breadcrumbs ‚Äì Top up the bacon fat with the oil so you have 2 tablespoons in total. Cool the pan slightly then return to medium heat.
