Add the breadcrumbs and salt. Toast, stirring regularly, until evenly golden ‚Äì about 3 minutes. Transfer into a bowl and set aside., Filling ‚Äì Put 3/4 of the bacon in a bowl (reserve the rest for topping). Add remaining ingredients then stir with a wooden spoon until combined., Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/375¬∞F (180¬∞C fan). Line a tray with foil then place a rack on it (to keep jalape√±os level)., Stuff jalape√±os with the filling, slightly above the rim (it sinks a bit) but not too high else there will be overflow. Place on the rack so the surface is level. Top with the shredded cheese, press down to flatten. Spoon over panko., Bake 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and jalape√±o is softened but still holding its shape (not saggy)., Transfer to serving platter, sprinkle with reserved bacon and chives. Serve hot! No dipping sauce needed.

TITLE: Lemon garlic salmon tray bake ‚Äì easy & healthy!
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 x 180g/6 oz salmon fillets
1 lemon zest, 1 lemon juice, 2 extra virgin olive oil, 1 dijon mustard, 2 garlic cloves, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
3 bunches asparagus, 200g/ 7 oz cherry tomatoes, 2 extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 each salt and pepper
Olive oil spray, Parmesan, Lemon wedges or slices, Parsley, Crusty bread or toast
INSTRUCTIONS: Lemon garlic paste ‚Äì Mix the marinade ingredients in a small bowl. Slather onto the top and sides of the salmon. If time permits, marinade for 1 hour. Otherwise, proceed with recipe., Preheat oven grill / broiler to 280¬∞C/525¬∞F or as high as yours goes. Place the oven shelf 20 cm /8" from the heat source., Prepare tray ‚Äì Toss the asparagus and cherry tomatoes with the olive oil, salt and pepper. Spread out on a large tray then clear space for the salmon. Place salmon on the tray leaving a bit of space between each. Spray surface of salmon with oil., Cook ‚Äì Grill/broil for 11 minutes or until the salmon is done ‚Äì the flesh should flake, the internal temperature should be 50¬∞C/122¬∞F (Note 5)., Serve ‚Äì Transfer salmon and vegetables to plate. Grate parmesan over the vegetables. Squeeze lemon juice over the salmon, sprinkle with parsley. Eat!

TITLE: One pot chicken risoni with crispy salami (orzo)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1/2 olive oil, 100g/ 3 oz salami stick, 2 x 250g / 8 oz chicken breasts
1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 1/2 garlic powder, 3/4 paprika, 1/4 sage powder

2 garlic cloves, 1/2 onion, 1/4 chardonnay or other dry white wine, 1/4 tomato paste, 1 1/4 risoni/orzo, 400g / 14 oz canned chickpeas, 3 chicken stock, 1/2 cooking / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 3/4 thickened / heavy cream, 1/3 parmesan, 150g/ 5 oz baby spinach, 1/3 sun dried tomato
2 roughly chopped basil
INSTRUCTIONS: Spice Mix ‚Äì Mix the ingredients in a small bowl then sprinkle both sides of the chicken., Crispy salami ‚Äì Heat the oil in a large non-stick pan over medium high heat. Cook the salami for 2 minutes, stirring constantly, until crispy and golden. Remove into a paper towel lined bowl using a slotted spoon, leaving the tasty salami fat in the pan., Cook chicken ‚Äì In the same pan, cook the chicken for 3 minutes on each side until dark golden and just cooked through (internal temperature 67¬∞C/153¬∞F). Remove onto a plate and cover loosely with foil to keep warm., Saut√© ‚Äì Still on medium high, cook the garlic and onion for 1 1/2 minutes until the onion is translucent. Add the wine and let it simmer rapidly for a couple of minutes until mostly evaporated, stirring to dissolve the fond (gold bits) on the base of the pan into the wine., Risoni (orzo) ‚Äì Add the tomato paste and stir for 1 minute to cook out the sour raw flavour. Add the risoni and stir to coat in the tomato paste. Add the chickpeas, chicken stock, salt, pepper., Simmer ‚Äì Bring to a simmer, then cook for 8 minutes, stirring every minute or so, until the risoni is just about cooked. Lower the heat to medium as it gets thicker so the base doesn't catch., Cream & spinach ‚Äì Add the cream, parmesan, spinach and sun dried tomatoes (if using). Stir until the spinach is wilted then remove from the heat. The risoni should be oozy and tender. (Still firm? Note 6), Finish ‚Äì Cut the chicken into thick slices. (Bit cool? Note 7) Spoon risoni into bowls. Top with the chicken, sprinkle with lots of crispy salami, parmesan and basil (if using). Dig in!

TITLE: Mango muffins
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 1/4 plain flour, 1 1/4 baking soda, of salt
1/3 unrefined coconut oil, 1 large egg, 1 white vinegar, 3/4 white sugar, 1 vanilla extract, 1 cup (260g) mango pur√©ed mango
2 cups (370g) chopped mango, 1/2 desiccated coconut
2 demerara sugar
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 220¬∞C/425¬∞F (200¬∞C fan-forced). Spray a muffin tin with canola oil or grease well with butter. (Note 5), Batter ‚Äì Whisk Dry ingredients in a medium bowl. Whisk all the Wet ingredients well in a separate large bowl until smooth. Pour the Dry ingredients into the Wet ingredients. Use a rubber spatula to mix together until the flour is almost incorporated., Add-ins ‚Äì Add the chopped mango and coconut, then mix until you no longer see flour ‚Äì stop mixing, even if there are a few flour lumps, else the muffin will be dry and tough. The mixture will be thicker than typical muffin batters because it gets a lot of moisture from the mangoes as it bakes., Crunchy top ‚Äì Divide between muffin holes, it should be slightly mounded (as pictured in post). Sprinkle the top of each with 1/2 teaspoon of Demerara sugar., Bake ‚Äì Place in the oven. Immediately turn the oven down to 200¬∞C/390¬∞F (180¬∞C fan). Bake for 24 minutes or until the surface is golden and crunchy, and a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean., Cool ‚Äì Leave in the muffin tin for 10 minutes then transfer onto a cooling rack. Cool for at least another 10 minutes before grabbing one!

TITLE: Vietnamese Peanut Sauce Lettuce Wraps
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 300g / 10 oz peeled whole cooked prawns/shrimp, 75g / 2.5 oz dried vermicelli noodles, 12 large or 16 -20 small lettuce leaves
1 quick pickled carrots and daikon, 2 beansprouts, 2 cucumbers, 2 mint leaves, 2 coriander/cilantro sprigs, 3 birds eye red chilli, 1/4 roasted peanuts
2 natural peanut butter, 2 hoisin, 1 ‚Äì 2 lime juice, 1/3 LOW FAT coconut milk, 1 large garlic clove, 1 sambal oelak, 1 dark soy, 1 white sugar, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt
2 medium carrots, 1/2 large white radish (daikon), 1 1/2 boiling water, 1/2 white sugar, 4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 3/4 rice wine vinegar
INSTRUCTIONS: Pickle first ‚Äì Put the boiling water, salt and sugar in a bowl. Mix to to dissolve, then add vinegar. Submerge vegetables and leave for 2 hours. Drain then use per recipe (or store in fridge submerged in liquid)., Peanut sauce ‚Äì Mix the peanut sauce ingredients and set aside for the flavours to meld while you prepare the platter. Start with 1 tbsp lime juice and add more if you want tarter., Prawns (shrimp) ‚Äì Cut the prawns in half horizontally and remove the vein., Noodles ‚Äì Soak the noodles in boiling water per packet directions. Rinse under cold water (to prevent stickiness) then drain very well., Lay it all out ‚Äì Pile everything onto a giant platter or put things in little bowls, then let everybody help themselves!, Assemble ‚Äì Here's my order: lettuce leaf, noodles first, then veg* (carrots, bean sprouts etc), prawns, stuff herbs down the side, drizzle with sauce, sprinkle with peanuts and chilli. Bundle and bite!

TITLE: Hot Ham and Cheese Sliders
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 12 standard or 24 small soft white roll slab, 1/3 American mustard, 350g/ 12 oz ham, 250g/ 8 oz Swiss cheese
100 g (7 tbsp) unsalted butter, 1/4 onion, 2 American mustard, 1 poppyseeds, 1 Worcestershire sauce, 1 garlic powder, 1/2 cooking / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C / 350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced). Line the base of a 23 x 33cm / 13 x 9" pan with paper (Note 5), Savoury Butter ‚Äì Mix ingredients together., Assemble base ‚Äì Cut the slab of rolls in half horizontally. Spread base and lid with the 1/3 cup mustard. Place bread in pan, top with ham then cheese. NO LID YET!, Bake topless ‚Äì Bake 10 minutes until the cheese is melted. (Note 6), Smother ‚Äì Remove bread from oven. Top with bread lid, pour/spoon over butter, leaving no patch naked., Bake covered ‚Äì Cover with foil, bake 20 minutes., Pierce for soakage ‚Äì Remove foil. Pierce the intersections where the corners of the rolls meet to encourage pooled butter to soak into the bread., Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or until top is crusty., Cut while hot then serve!

TITLE: Mignonette Sauce for Oysters
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 1/2 eschalot, 3 red wine vinegar
12 ‚Äì 24 oysters, Black pepper
INSTRUCTIONS: Mignonette ‚Äì Mix together in a bowl then set aside for at least 2 hours to let the flavours meld., Serving ‚Äì Transfer into a little dish with a small spoon. Serve alongside oysters (generally people help themselves)., Using ‚Äì Most people just use about 1/2 tsp for small oysters and 3/4 tsp for large. Some people will use more liberally! Comes down to personal taste.

TITLE: Tetsuya‚Äôs Oysters with Japanese Dressing
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 white sugar, 1 1/2 Japanese soy sauce, 2 rice vinegar, 2 mirin, 3 grapeseed or vegetable oil, 2 sesame oil, 1 1/2 grated ginger
12 oysters, 20 g / 2/3 oz (1 heaped tbsp) salmon roe, 2 chives, Rock salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Combine sugar, soy, rice vinegar and mirin in a jug or bowl. Whisk well until sugar is dissolved. Add oils and ginger. Whisk again and use immediately.

Place oysters on a serving platter on ice or rock salt (Note 7)., Spoon dressing in each ‚Äì I use 3/4 teaspoon on small oysters and 1 1/4 teaspoon for large. Or more!, Top with a small pile of salmon roe, sprinkle with chives. Serve!

TITLE: Cucumber lime jalapeno granita for oysters
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1/2 cucumber, 1 lime zest, 3 lime juice, 2 caster sugar, 1 finely chopped jalape√±o
12 ‚Äì 24 oysters, Jalape√±o slices
INSTRUCTIONS: Granita ‚Äì Place ingredients in a jug just large enough to fit a stick blender. Blitz until smooth ‚Äì it should be like a smoothie. Pour in a small container so the depth is no deeper than 3cm / 2.2". Freeze for 6 hours+., Scrape ‚Äì Use a fork to scrape into shavings (it's not hard). Use immediately or return to freezer until required., Serving ‚Äì Place oysters on a serving platter. (Note 3)

TITLE: Beef Tenderloin with Creamy Mushroom Sauce
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 ‚Äì 1.25kg/ 2 ‚Äì 2.5lb centre cut beef tenderloin, 1 1/2 cooking / kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 1 vegetable oil
75g/ 5 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 garlic, 1 fresh thyme leaves, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
150g/5 oz white mushrooms, 1/2 garlic, 1 thyme sprig, 3/4 marsala, 1/2 chicken stock, 3/4 thickened cream, 1/4 black pepper
INSTRUCTIONS: Prep beef ‚Äì Pat beef dry with paper towels, sprinkle with salt and pepper all over. Place the beef on a rack on a tray then refrigerate uncovered 12 to 24 hours. (Can skip, Note 5), Butter Slather ‚Äì Mix Butter Slather ingredients in a bowl., De-chill ‚Äì Remove the beef from the fridge 2 hours prior to cooking. This helps the beef cook evenly., Sear ‚Äì Heat oil in an ovenproof heavy based pan over high heat until smoking. (Note 6) Brown the surface of the beef all over, aggressively and quickly. Then put the beef back on the rack to cool for 15 minutes (so the butter doesn't instantly melt when you put it on)., Preheat oven to 120¬∞C/250¬∞F (both fan and standard ovens) (Note 7)., Butter ‚Äì Put beef back in cooled skillet. Slather 3/4 of the butter onto the beef ‚Äì top and sides (not underside)., Roast 40 ‚Äì 50 minutes ‚Äì Roast for 15 minutes. Remove, slather remaining butter onto the top and sides. Roast for a further 25 ‚Äì 35 minutes or until the internal temperature is 53¬∞C/127¬∞F for medium rare (Note 8 for other levels of doneness)., Rest & serve ‚Äì Remove beef from the skillet onto a cutting board and rest for 10 minutes. The internal temperature will rise 56-58¬∞C / 133-136¬∞F (this is medium rare). Slice thickly and serve with Creamy Mushroom Sauce!

Roasting juices ‚Äì Pour all juices in skillet into a bowl or jug. The fat will rise to the surface. Pour off 1/4 cup (60ml) of the fat back into the skillet (reserve the rest for later)., Cook mushrooms ‚Äì Turn the stove onto high. Once the butter is hot, add mushrooms and cook until they start to sweat. Then add thyme and garlic, and cook for a further 2 minutes until the mushrooms are softened., Sauce ‚Äì Add chicken stock/broth and reduce by half. Add marsala, cream, pepper and remaining reserved roasting juices. Simmer on medium / medium high for 5 minutes until it reduces by half and the sauce is thickened. Taste ‚Äì it should be slightly on the salty side (which will seem just right with each mouthful of beef). Add more salt if needed. Serve with beef.

TITLE: Brie Potato Dauphinoise (Gratin)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 1/2 thickened / heavy cream, 2 garlic cloves, 30g / 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 1.25 kg / 2.5 lb starchy potatoes, 1 cooking / kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 2 thyme leaves, 3 x 125g / 4oz small brie (8cm / 3.2" wide)
INSTRUCTIONS: Cream Mixture: Place butter, cream and garlic in a jug. Mix until combined., Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (both fan and standard ovens)., Slice potatoes: Peel the potatoes and slice them 1/8"/3 mm thick. Or use a slicer!, Layer 1: Spread 1/3 of the potatoes in a 1.5 litre / 6 cup baking dish (Note 5). Then pour over 1/3 of the Cream Mixture, scatter with 1/3 of the salt, pepper and thyme., Layers 2 & 3: Repeat for the 2nd and third layer., Cover & bake: Cover with foil, and bake for 1 hour 20 minutes or until the potatoes in the middle are soft (use knife to test), it might take 1 1/2 hours. (Note 6), Top with brie, bake again: Remove foil. Place brie on the surface, cut side down. Bake for a further 30 minutes until the brie is oozy and the edges tinged with gold., Serve ‚Äì Stand 5 minutes before serving and be prepared to swoon!

TITLE: Seafood Platter
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 kg / 3 lb whole prawns, 24 oysters ‚Äì Sydney Rock or Pacific, 4 blue swimmer crabs (400g/14oz+), 8 Moreton Bay bugs, 200g / 7 oz smoked salmon, 250g / 8 oz sashimi, 1 kg / 2 lb mussels
Cocktail Seafood Sauce, Tartare Sauce, Marie Rose / Thousand Island, Thai Chilli Lime Sauce, RecipeTin Family Favourite Seafood Sauce
Sauces for oysters, Soy sauce and wasabi
Ice, Lemon wedges, Parsley sprigs, Bowls, Finger bowls, Napkins
Good bread, Perky green salad or vegetable sticks, Lots of cold beer, wine and champagne!
Marinated crispy baby octoptus, The crispiest salt and pepper squid, Cheese and crackers, More extras ‚Äì
INSTRUCTIONS: Purchase all seafood as close as possible to the serving date. We often do the 5AM shop at the Sydney Fish Markets on Christmas Eve, because we are slightly crazy! We don't order online (we like to choose our own)., Storage ‚Äì Cooked seafood will easily keep 2 days, fresh raw for cooking will too if you take it out of the plastic bags, put in a colander or similar and very loosely cover with cling wrap (breathing = less stinky)., Crab ‚Äì To cut the crab, follow directions in How to Cut a Whole Crab except DO NOT cut off the claws if you are using a Blue Swimmer Crab. (See note), Moreton Bay bug ‚Äì To cut the bug, flip it on to its back. Cut down through the middle (the shell is not too hard). Clean out the yellow and brown matter in the head, then it's ready to serve. Recipe video above., Sauce ‚Äì Make your sauces of choice. They will be used for dipping prawns, Moreton Bay bugs and crab (I also use for vegetable sticks and bread!). Refrigerate until required (2 days+)., Mussels ‚Äì Make mussels, if using. Great served at room temperature on a cold seafood platter.

Ice (optional) ‚Äì Cover a large platter with ice. This keeps the seafood cold as well as providing a non-slip bed., Pile the prawns, crab and bugs on to the platter. Drape smoked salmon randomly around. Fan out the sushi., Oysters ‚Äì Place them level to avoid the juices in the shells spilling out (what a waste!)., Mussels ‚Äì Break off one shell, and serve in the remaining shell. Then place the mussels in a single layer, or shingled (stacked but level). Spoon on a little of the diced vegetables and some reserved mussel cooking liquor., Sauce and lemon ‚Äì Nestle bowls filled with sauces amongst the seafood and scatter over lemon wedges. Serve alongside finger bowls for cleaning and bowls to discard shells, and lots of napkins. Fill glasses with wine, cheers to Christmas! Now dive in!

TITLE: Mini Christmas Cakes ‚Äì ideal for gifting!
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 300g / 10 oz raisins, 150g / 5 oz diced dried apricots, 75g / 2 1/2 oz mixed peel, 150g / 5 oz glace cherries, 180g / 6 oz dates, 1 cup + 2 tbsp apple juice

115g / 8 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 1/2 brown sugar, 1/2 vegetable oil, 3 molasses or golden syrup, 1/2 salt, 1/2 all spice, 1/2 cinnamon, 1/2 nutmeg, 3 eggs, 1/2 baking powder, 1 2/3 plain flour, 3/4 walnuts
Icing sugar, for dusting, Christmas fondant ‚Äì see directions here
1 1/2 soft icing sugar / powdered sugar, 1 tbsp / 15g unsalted butter, softened, 1/2 vanilla, 1 1/2 ‚Äì 3 milk
INSTRUCTIONS: Heat ‚Äì Place dried fruit and juice/brandy in a large microwavable container. Microwave 1 1/2 minutes on high or until hot., Soak ‚Äì Stir to coat all fruit in liquid. Cover then set aside for 1 hour (to plump up/soak and cool).

Preheat oven to 160¬∞C / 320¬∞F (140¬∞C fan). Grease and line a 20cm / 8" square cake pan with baking paper / parchment paper, or larger pan to get more cakes out of it. (Note 5 on pan size)., Beating ‚Äì Using an electric beater, beat butter and sugar until smooth and creamy (about 1 minute on speed 5). Add oil and molasses, beat until combined. Add salt, spices and baking powder ‚Äì beat until incorporated. Add eggs, one at a time, beating until just incorporated., Stir in the flour with a wooden spoon, then the dried fruit (including all the extra liquid in bowl) and walnuts (if using)., Pour into the cake pan, it will fill it right to the top (it won't spill over, the cake barely rises). Cover the surface with paper then cover with foil., Bake 2 1/2 hours ‚Äì Bake for 2 hours, remove the foil and paper, then bake for a further 30 minutes. A skewer inserted into middle should come out clean with no batter on it., Remove from oven and cool for 20 minutes before transferring to cooling rack. Cool completely before cutting., Cutting ‚Äì Trim off the sides (to make them neat). Then cut into 9 squares (or more, if you want). Trim the surface (to make them level as the cake slightly domes). Then flip upside down and decorate the base of the cake.

Simple ‚Äì Dust with icing sugar. That's all this cake needs, it's so full flavoured and moist! Wrap with cellophane and ribbon to gift., Ribbon ‚Äì Wrap and tie a ribbon around each cake. Nice way to present for serving. (Optional to include for gift wrapping too, but then there's a double ribbon situation happening ‚Äì ie ribbon and cake, ribbon on cellophane!), Drippy white glaze  ‚Äì Mix the icing sugar, butter, vanilla and start with 2 tbsp milk. Mix really well (it will take time to come together, be patient). Then adjust thickness using 1/2 tsp milk at a time. BE CAREFUL ‚Äì it goes from too thick to too thin very easily! Goal: Thick glaze that will ooze "pudding style", as pictured, rather than dripping in long streaks. Spoon onto cake, coaxing it down the sides. Allow to set before wrapping., Fondant ‚Äì See directions in my classic round Christmas Cake., Serving ‚Äì serve with custard for a traditional experience! Either homemade custard or store bought pouring custard.

TITLE: Qeema Indian Curried Beef
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 3 vegetable or canola oil, 4 ginger, 5 large garlic cloves, 1 large onion, 500g / 1 lb beef mince (ground beef), 3/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1 cayenne pepper, 1 1/4 garam masala, 1 1/4 cumin powder, 1 1/4 coriander powder, 1/2 turmeric powder, 1 water
1 green cayenne pepper, Cilantro/coriander leaves, Plain yogurt or Mint yogurt (below)
3/4 plain yogurt, 1/2 mint leaves, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Saut√© ‚Äì Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Add ginger and garlic and saute for 30 seconds until golden, don't let it burn! Add onion and cook for 1 minute until it is starting to turn translucent., Add beef and cook, breaking it up as you go, until it changes from pink to light brown. Add remaining ingredients EXCEPT water. Cook for a further 2 minutes to let the spices bloom., Cook 10 minutes ‚Äì Add water, give it a stir, then put a lid on (or cover with a baking tray). Turn heat down to medium and let it simmer for 10 minutes or until most of the water has evaporated., Serve over with basmati rice or plain white rice, garnished with extra chilli and coriander/cilantro, and lots of Mint Yogurt. Naan or flatbreads would make it even better, though if time is not your friend, try frozen roti (pictured in post, Note 3).

Blitz then stir ‚Äì Put just 1/4 cup of the yogurt with the mint leaves and salt in a jug just big enough to fit the head of a stick blender. Blitz until mint is very finely chopped. Then stir in remaining yogurt. (Note 4) Refrigerate until required.

TITLE: Holiday Stuffed Sweet Potato
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 sweet potatoes, 1/2 cooking / kosher salt, 4 unsalted butter, 5 pecan nuts, 200g / 7 oz streaky bacon, 1 1/2 colby cheese, 1/4 black pepper, 1/4 garlic powder, 1/4 onion powder, 1/4 paprika
1/4 cooking / kosher salt, 1/2 panko breadcrumbs, 2 sage leaves
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C / 400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan forced)., Bake  ‚Äì Prick the skin of the potatoes 15 times with a fork. Place on a foil lined baking tray and bake for 75 minutes or until soft all the way through (check with a butter knife)., Scoop ‚Äì Once potatoes cooked, allow to cool for 10 minutes just to handle. Cut in half lengthwise then scoop out the flesh, leaving a 0.5cm (0.2") wall (use a tea towel if hot). Place flesh in a bowl., Stuffing (*see below for prepping components*)- Mash the potatoes with a fork. Then add the browned butter, 1/2 tsp salt, pepper, garlic, onion powder and paprika. The add half of each the pecans, bacon and cheese (rest reserved for toppings). Stir until combined., Stuff ‚Äì Place halved sweet potato back on a paper lined baking tray and stuff them equally with filling. Sprinkle with leftover cheese and bake for 25 minutes until cheese is melted., Crunchy topping ‚Äì Top with reserved pecans, bacon and panko mixture. Bake for another 3 to 4 minutes, Rest for 5 minutes then serve!

Prepare these while the potatoes are baking., Browned butter ‚Äì Melt the butter in a small silver pan or saucepan over medium heat. Leave to simmer on medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes, stirring every now and then, until (when you push foam aside) you see little golden-brown bits and it smells nutty. Immediately pour into a small bowl (including the golden bits) and set aside., Toast pecans ‚Äì Heat a non-stick pan over medium high heat. Add pecans and toast for 2 to 3 minutes until they have golden spots. Transfer to cutting board, cool then finely chop., Crispy bacon ‚Äì Add bacon into the same pan over medium heat. When the fat starts to melt, turn the heat up to medium high and cook until golden (4 to 5 minutes). Scoop out bacon with a slotted spoon and place into a small bowl. Leave leftover fat in the pan., Golden panko ‚Äì Still on medium high, add the Panko topping ingredients. Stir until golden, around 2 minutes, then scrape into a bowl.

TITLE: Thai Turmeric Chicken (Gai Yang Khamin)
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 5 chicken thighs, skin-on, bone-in
4 garlic cloves, 2 fish sauce, 2 1/2 oyster sauce, 1 white pepper, 1 ground turmeric, 1/4 brown sugar
INSTRUCTIONS: Marinade chicken ‚Äì Mix Marinade ingredients in a large bowl. Add chicken and toss to coat. Marinade for at least 3 hours, preferably overnight., Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced)., Prepare ‚Äì Line a tray with baking paper/parchment paper. Place chicken on the tray, skin side up. Scrape all Marinade out of th bowl and dab onto chicken., Bake for 40 minutes, basting at the 30 minute and 40 minute mark using the tray juices to make it golden brown and sticky, and rotate the tray as needed for even colour., Increase the oven temperature to 200¬∞C/390¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced). Pop the chicken back in for a final 10 minutes to caramelise the skin., Rest for 3 minutes before serving with jasmine or coconut rice, and plain chunks of tomato and cucumber the Thai way!

TITLE: Mini chocolate cakes
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 plain flour / all-purpose flour, 1/3 cocoa, 3/4 baking powder, 3/4 baking soda / bi-carb, 1 white sugar, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1 large egg, 1/2 milk, 1/4 plain oil, 1 vanilla extract, 1/2 boiling water, 1 instant coffee powder
250g / 1 cup unsalted butter, 4 soft icing sugar / powdered sugar, 1/2 cocoa powder, 1 vanilla extract, 5 milk
Dark chocolate, Raspberries, rosemary sprigs
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C / 350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced)., Baking pan ‚Äì Butter a 40 x 28.5 x 2.5cm cm tray (15.8 x 11.3 x 1" ‚Äì US standard jelly roll pan) then line with baking paper (parchment paper).

Whisk dry ‚Äì Sift the flour, cocoa, baking powder and baking soda into a bowl. Add the sugar and salt, then whisk to combine., Mix in wet ‚Äì Add the egg, milk, oil and vanilla. Whisk to combine. Dissolve the coffee in the hot water, then add into the batter. Whisk to combine. The batter will be VERY thin!, Bake ‚Äì Pour into the pan and bake for 13 minutes., Cool for 10 minutes then use the paper overhang to lift the cake onto a rack and cool for 30 minutes (leave it on the paper). Then refrigerate uncovered for at least 1 hour before cutting rounds (cake is too soft when freshly baked).

Cutting rounds ‚Äì Cover the sticky surface with paper. Then flip upside down onto a cutting board (ie sticky side down). (Note 4) Peel the paper off the base. Then press out 21 x 6cm / 2.4" rounds (or other size or shape as you desire)., Pipe frosting ‚Äì Place a piece of cake on a small piece of paper, using a dab of frosting to stop it from sliding. Pipe coils of frosting on the layers, using 3 rounds for each cake. Pipe frosting around the sides and on the top. (A cake turntable is handy if you've got one but not essential.), Smooth frosting ‚Äì Smooth the frosting using a small offset spatula or knife, taking care to only touch the surface. Avoid touching the cake because it will dislodge crumbs that will end up in your frosting!, Decorate with piles of chocolate shards. I also used raspberries and rosemary for the photos in the post!

Beat butter for 3 minutes on high until soft and fluffy. Add icing sugar in 3 lots. Beat it in, starting on low speed then increasing the speed (to avoid a snow storm). Once incorporated, add more icing sugar and repeat., Beat 3 minutes ‚Äì Once the icing sugar has all been added, added the cocoa powder, milk and vanilla. Beat again, starting on low speed then increasing the speed gradually. Once the cocoa is incorporated, beat on high for 3 minutes to make it really nice and fluffy., Piping bags ‚Äì Transfer to a piping bag for frosting. (This is the fastest and easiest way, trust me on this. Even a ziplock bag will work here).

TITLE: Green Beans with a Mountain of Panko
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 700 g/1.4lb green beans, 1 extra virgin olive oil, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
1 plain yogurt, 2 1/2 tahini, 1 1/2 lemon juice, 1 garlic clove, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt
3/4 panko breadcrumbs, 3 extra virgin olive oil, 1/8 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 parmesan
INSTRUCTIONS: Toss blanched beans with oil, salt and pepper. Whisk Tahini ingredients, microwave 20 seconds, whisk again. Toast Panko mix on stove. Assemble ‚Äì beans, sauce then panko. Attack!

Cook beans ‚Äì Bring a large pot of water to the boil. Add beans, let it come back to the boil, cook for 2 minutes, then drain in a colander. Rinse under cold running water for 10 seconds to stop cooking (there is NO NEED to use ice!)., Season ‚Äì Spread beans on a tea towel then dry with a 2nd tea towel. Transfer into bowl, toss with the oil, salt and pepper., Panko Mountain ‚Äì Mix the ingredients in a bowl. Preheat a large non-stick pan on medium high. Add the panko mixture and stir for 4 ‚Äì 5 minutes until golden brown. Transfer back into the bowl then let it cool., Whipped Tahini Yogurt ‚Äì Whisk ingredients in a heat-proof bowl just to combine. Microwave for just 20 seconds on high, then whisk again for 10 seconds ‚Äì it will resemble softly whipped cream. (Note 4) Use immediately or at room temperature., Assemble ‚Äì Spread green beans on plate. Pour over sauce, pile on panko. Attack!

TITLE: Lamb Souvlaki
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1.2 kg/ 2.4 lb boneless lamb leg, 1 cooking / kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 1 extra virgin olive oil, 8 ‚Äì 12 skewers
5 garlic cloves, 5 lemon juice, 2 lemon zest, 2 dried oregano, 3 fresh bay leaves, 1/3 white wine vinegar, 3 extra virgin olive oil, 1 cooking / kosher salt
4 ‚Äì 6 pita bread, 1 tzatziki, Greek salad, Greek lemon rice
INSTRUCTIONS: Mix marinade ingredients in a bowl. Add lamb and toss to coat., Marinate in fridge for 12 ‚Äì 24 hours.

Skewer ‚Äì Remove meat from marinade and thread 3 to 4 pieces on each to make 12 skewers, or 5 to make 8 larger skewers (pictured in post)., Sprinkle the meat with the salt and pepper. (This really makes a difference to the finished dish, better than just in the marinade)., Cook ‚Äì Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large non-stick pan over high heat. Cook half the skewers for 3 minutes, turn then cook the other side for 3 minutes until nicely seared (target internal temp 60¬∞C/140¬∞F for medium rare, optimum juiciness)., Transfer to a plate and loosely cover with foil to keep warm while you cook the remaining skewers.

Soak skewers ‚Äì Soak wood/bamboo skewers in water for 30 minutes if planning to cook on the BBQ (prevents burning). My skewers are 18cm/7‚Äù which fit in a pan (stove cooking)., Preheat BBQ to medium high. Flat iron hot plate is safer for wooden skewers (so they don't catch fire) else use metal skewers on the grill side., Skewer, oil & season ‚Äì Skewer per above. Drizzle with the oil (so it doesn't stick to the BBQ) then sprinkle both sides with the salt and pepper., BBQ cook for 3 minutes on each side.

Pile Souvlaki onto a serving platter for DIY wraps with tzatziki (from this recipe), toasted pita bread and Greek salad (chopped small), or shredded lettuce and tomato slices. Else, make plates with lemon rice and a Greek Salad!

TITLE: Melting Moments
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 250g (2 sticks + 1 tbsp) unsalted butter, 1 vanilla extract, 1/2 soft icing sugar / powdered sugar, 1 1/2 plain / all-purpose flour, 1/2 cornflour / cornstarch
100g / 7 tbsp unsalted butter, 2 soft icing sugar / powdered sugar, 2 lemon zest, 1 lemon juice
80g / 6 tbsp unsalted butter, 2 soft icing sugar / powdered sugar, 4 fresh passionfruit pulp, 1 lemon juice
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C / 350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced). Line 2 trays with paper., Cream butter ‚Äì Place butter, vanilla and icing sugar in a bowl. Beat for 1 minute until smooth and fluffy (start on low to avoid an icing sugar cloud-storm)., Dry in 3 lots ‚Äì Stir in cornflour and flour in 3 lots using a rubber spatula. (ie add 1/3 of flour + cornflour, stir in, repeat twice more)., Scoop 1 tablespoon of the mixture onto the trays (cookie scoop handy here), then roll into balls using lightly floured hands (to prevent it from sticking). You should have 24 ‚Äì 28 balls., Bake ‚Äì Press down into 1 cm / 0.4" thickness using a fork. Bake for 15 minutes, switching the trays at the 10 minute mark. Fully cool on trays., Sandwiching ‚Äì Pipe frosting onto half the melting moments, then sandwich with remaining cookies., Set ‚Äì Refrigerate for 1 hour to set the frosting (else it's so soft, it squirts out!). Then remove from the fridge 30 minutes prior to serving.

Cream butter ‚Äì Place butter in a bowl and beat with an electric mixer on medium high for 1 minute until smooth and fluffy. Add 1/3 of the icing sugar, then beat in starting on low and increasing to high (to avoid snow-storm!). Repeat another 2 times., Beat 2 minutes ‚Äì Add lemon zest and juice. Then beat on high for 2 minutes until fluffy. Transfer to piping bag, snip end off to make a 1cm / 1/2" hole. Use per recipe.
Same method as above for lemon icing.

TITLE: Avocado salad
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 big ripe avocados, 3 cucumbers, 1/4 red onion, 2 dill, 2 coriander/cilantro leaves
3 extra virgin olive oil, 3 lime juice, 1/4 chilli flakes / red pepper flakes, 1/4 black pepper, 3/4 cooking / kosher salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Put all the salad ingredients in large bowl. Drizzle over lime juice and oil, sprinkle with salt, pepper and red chilli flakes., Toss gently using your hands, gently separating the avocado slices as you go. Taste and add more lime if you want., Tumble into a bowl and serve!

TITLE: One-pan Baked Butter Chicken
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1.2 kg/ 2.4lb bone-in chicken thighs
1/2 plain yoghurt, 1 lemon juice, 1 ginger, 2 garlic, 1 turmeric powder, 2 garam masala, 1/2 chilli powder, 1 ground cumin, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt
2 tbsp/ 30g melted ghee or butter, 1 tomato passata, 3/4 heavy / thickened cream, 1 1/2 white sugar, 3/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
1/2 coriander leaves (cilantro), Basmati rice, Naan
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C / 400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced)., Coat chicken ‚Äì Mix the marinade ingredients in a bowl, then add the chicken and toss to coat., Optional marinade ‚Äì overnight. (Note 5), Assemble ‚Äì Mix Sauce ingredients in a 23 x 33cm / 9 x 13" baking dish. Place chicken in, smooth side up. Scrape residual marinade out of bowl and dab onto chicken surface., Bake 45 minutes, basting with sauce at the 30 minute and 40 minute mark. The sauce will change from pink to orangey-red (Note 6 for sauce thickening)., Serve ‚Äì Rest for 5 minutes. Then serve over basmati rice, garnished with coriander if desired! Naan for mopping would make everyone extra happy. üôÇ

TITLE: Fondant Potatoes (Melting potatoes)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 large floury potatoes, 3/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 2 extra virgin olive oil, 3 tbsp / 50g unsalted butter, 6 thyme sprigs, 1 chicken stock / broth
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C / 390¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced)., Carve / cut each potato into cylinders ~ 6cm/ 2" diameter, 7 cm height. Then cut in half so you have 8 short cylinders 3.5 cm / 1.4" tall. See cutting method options below., Season ‚Äì Pat potato dry. Place in a large bowl and toss with half the oil plus all the salt and pepper., Sear ‚Äì In an ovenproof heavy based skillet (Note 2), heat the remaining 1 tbsp oil over medium high heat. Put the potato in and cook each side for 6 ‚Äì 8 minutes or until golden., Cook ‚Äì Add butter and thyme. Once melted, spoon the butter over the potato ("basting"). Add stock, bring to a boil then transfer to the oven and bake for 30 minutes until the potatoes are tender, basting at the 15 minute mark. The stock will be absorbed by the potato, leaving just butter., Serve ‚Äì Baste one more time then serve! For a restaurant-y option, serve alongside steak with b√©arnaise sauce and buttered peas.

Prep for all methods ‚Äì Trim a bit off both ends so the potato stands upright. Once carved into a tall cylinder 6cm/ 2" diameter, at least 7cm/3" height, so we can cut into 3.5 cm / 1.4" tall pieces. Save leftover potato to make mash (keep in water to prevent turning brown)., Pro method ‚Äì Lie potato on its side and use a knife to carve around to form a cylinder., Intermediate (I do this)‚Äì Stand potato upright and use a knife to shave thin slivers down, rotating as needed, to carve into a cylinder. You can use a potato peeler for some of this too (just be a bit careful, less control)., Easy ‚Äì Use 6cm/ 2" (or as close as possible) wide cutters to press rounds out!, Easy potato peeler ‚Äì Use a potato peeler to shape as best you can, rotating as you go., Doesn't matter! ‚Äì Just cut potatoes into 3.5cm / 1.4" thick slices! Even if your rounds are not so round, it will still taste delicious. Only cut enough to fill the pan, as pictured, else you'll have too much potato for the stock being used (flavour dilution),

TITLE: Penne all‚ÄôArrabbiata (spicy tomato pasta)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 400g/ 14oz penne or ziti, 1 cooking / kosher salt
4 extra virgin olive oil, 3 garlic cloves, 1 red cayenne pepper chilli, 1/2 chilli flakes, 800g / 28 oz canned crushed tomato, 1 1/4 cooking / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 1/2 white sugar
parmesan, 2 finely chopped parsley
INSTRUCTIONS: Saut√© ‚Äì Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic and stir for 10 seconds. Add cayenne and chilli flakes. Cook for 1 minute, or until garlic is light golden., Add tomato, salt and pepper. Rinse out the tomato cans with the water and add into the pot., Simmer ‚Äì Turn up the heat to high, stir, then once it comes to a simmer, turn back down to medium heat and simmer for 15 minutes. (Taste check at 10 min ‚Äì if sour, add the sugar.), Cook pasta ‚Äì Meanwhile, bring a large pot of water to the boil with the 1 tablespoon of salt. Add pasta and cook per packet directions., Save water ‚Äì Just before draining, give the pot a big stir (to agitate the starch) then scoop out 1 cup of the water and set aside. (Note 4) Drain pasta., Toss ‚Äì Add pasta into the sauce along with 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water. Toss well (still on the stove) until the pasta is coated with the pasta sauce. Use extra pasta cooking water if needed, to loosen., Serve ‚Äì Divide between bowls and serve immediately with parmesan and parsley, if using.

TITLE: Bursting Blueberry Crumb Cake
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2/3 flour, ¬Ω caster sugar, 1/2 cinnamon powder, 1/8 cooking/kosher salt, 60g / 4 tbsp melted butter, 1/4 vanilla extract
1 1/3 flour, 2 baking powder, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 3/4 caster sugar, 1 vanilla extract, 1 lemon zest, 2 large eggs, 90 g / 6 tbsp unsalted butter, 1/3 sour cream, 1/3 milk
500 g / 1 lb fresh blueberries, 2 lemon juice, 2 caster sugar, 3 flour
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C / 400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced). Line a 20cm springform pan with paper (here's how I do it)., Crumb ‚Äì Put the flour, sugar, cinnamon and salt in a medium bowl and mix together with a fork. Then add the butter and vanilla, and use the fork to mix until all the flour is wet, then stop mixing. We want it lumpy and crumbly!, Zest the lemon first and put it aside for the batter before measuring out juice for the blueberry tossing., Blueberries ‚Äì Toss the blueberries with lemon juice to wet the surface. Sprinkle with sugar and flour, toss to coat. Set aside.

Whisk dry ‚Äì Whisk the flour, baking powder and salt in a small bowl., Whisk wet ‚Äì In a larger bowl, whisk the sugar, vanilla, zest and eggs until the surface is a bit foamy (~ 15 sec by hand). Add the butter and sour cream, whisk until smooth., Combine wet and dry ‚Äì Switch to a rubber spatula. Add the flour in 3 batches, folding in between until the flour is mostly incorporated. Then add the milk and stir until combined. Some small lumps is ok!, Assembling ‚Äì Pour the batter into the pan. Scatter blueberries on top. Sprinkle any leftover flour at the bottom of the blueberry bowl on top of the blueberries. Cover with chunks of crumb, aiming for ~85% coverage. If necessary, enclose powdery bits in your fist to press them into clumps!, Bake for 65 minutes, rotating the pan halfway, until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean (blueberry smear is ok!)., Cool 10 minutes in the pan. Remove the cake from the springform pan then cool for at least another 10 minutes before cutting to serve., Serving ‚Äì For the best blueberry crumble-cake experience, serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream! Otherwise, be normal and serve it at room temperature. Ice cream or cream also welcome here.

TITLE: Almost no-oil Pan Fried Eggplant
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 large eggplant, Olive oil spray, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 1/4 water
See in post for ideas and links to recipes for sauces etc!
INSTRUCTIONS: Cut the eggplant into 2cm / 0.8‚Äù rounds., Spray each side generously with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper., Brown ‚Äì Heat a large non-stick pan with a lid over medium high heat, no oil. (Note 3) Add the eggplant slices and pan fry for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes on each side or until you get some nice browning on it. As much or as little as you want!, Pan steam ‚Äì Carefully add water around the eggplant (it will bubble and steam, so do this carefully). Then immediately cover with a lid to trap the steam in. Steam for 2 minutes or until the water has evaporated., Check ‚Äì Use a butter knife to check to ensure the eggplant is cooked through. If not, add a bit more water and steam again!, Serve ‚Äì Transfer to a serving plate and serve! Great as is, or to dress it up a tiny bit, add a swish of olive oil, squeeze of lemon juice and parsley leaves, or a smear of chilli crisp! See in post for more ways to serve.

TITLE: African coconut chicken curry ‚Äì Kuku Paka
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 chicken thigh fillets, 4 chicken drumsticks, 3/4 cooking / kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper

2 coconut oil, 1 onion, 3 garlic cloves, 2 ginger, 1 coriander powder, 1/2 cumin powder, 1/2 turmeric powder, 1 pure chilli powder or cayenne pepper, 400g / 14 oz coconut milk, 400g / 14 oz crushed canned tomato, 1 1/4 cooking / kosher salt, 2 lemon juice, 1/2 coriander/cilantro leaves
Basmati rice
INSTRUCTIONS: Season chicken ‚Äì Pat chicken dry using paper towels then sprinkle with the salt and pepper., Brown chicken ‚Äì Heat oil in a large heavy based pot over high heat. Add the thighs, skin-side down, and cook for 4-5 minutes until golden brown. Turn and cook the other side for 1 minute. Transfer to a plate (it will still be raw inside). Then brown the drumsticks as best you can. I do 3 sides, 2 minutes each side. Transfer to the plate., Saut√© aromatics ‚Äì Turn heat down to medium high. Add the onion and cook for 1 minute until softened. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 30 seconds. Add the coriander, cumin, turmeric and chilli. Stir for 30 seconds., Sauce ‚Äì Add coconut milk, tomato and salt. Stir, then return chicken into the pot (including juices on the plate). Submerge chicken as best you can., Simmer 30 min ‚Äì Once the sauce comes to a simmer, reduce the heat so it‚Äôs bubbling gently. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Remove the lid and simmer for a further 20 minutes, stirring occasionally to ensure the base doesn't catch., Finish & serve ‚Äì Stir in lemon and half of the coriander. Lade into bowls and serve garnished with the rest of the coriander!

TITLE: Pumpkin Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 1 2/3 fresh pumpkin puree, 15 oz / 425g canned pure pumpkin
4 large eggs, 1 2/3 white sugar, 1 vegetable or canola oil, 2 plain/all-purpose flour, 4 baking powder, 2 cinnamon powder, 1 cooking / kosher salt
6 oz / 180g cream cheese, 1 cup / 225g unsalted butter, 1 vanilla extract, 4 soft icing sugar / powdered sugar
1/3 ‚Äì 1/2 maple syrup, 1/2 pecans
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced). Spray and line a large pan around 9 x 13" / 23 x 33cm with baking paper with overhang. (Note 6), Batter ‚Äì¬†In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, sugar, oil and pumpkin. Add remaining ingredients and mix well., Bake ‚Äì Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean., Cool for 10 minutes before turning out onto cooling rack to cool completely (~ 2 hours) before frosting., Frosting ‚Äì Spread frosting on then use the back of a spoon to make swirly dents. Drizzle over maple syrup, concentrating on the dents to create maple syrup pools! Sprinkle with pecans. Then serve.

Cream butter ‚Äì Place the cream cheese and butter in a bowl. Beat for 2 minutes until smooth and fluffy., Add the icing sugar in 3 batches, starting the beater on low after each addition to avoid a snowstorm. Once incorporated, turn the beater up to high and beat for 3 minutes or until the frosting is light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla. Use frosting immediately.

TITLE: How I cook frozen peas ‚Äì Garlic Buttered Peas
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 50g / 3 tbsp unsalted butter, 2 garlic cloves, 500g / 1 lb frozen peas, 1/2 cooking / kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 1 water
INSTRUCTIONS: Saut√© garlic ‚Äì Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until light golden., Cook ‚Äì Add frozen peas, salt, pepper and water. Turn heat up to medium high and cook for 5 minutes, stirring every now and then, until the water is evaporated, the peas are hot and coated in the tasty garlic butter., Serve ‚Äì Tumble into a bowl and serve!

TITLE: Chicken Francese
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 large chicken breasts, 1/4 flour, 1 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1 black pepper, 2 large eggs, 1 milk
3 extra virgin olive oil, 1 lemon, 50g / 3 tbsp unsalted butter, 2 flour, 2 chicken stock/broth, 1/3 Chardonnay or other dry white wine, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1 finely chopped parsley
INSTRUCTIONS: Cut each breast in half horizontally to form 4 thin steaks in total., Whisk eggs and milk in a small bowl. Set aside., Flour coating ‚Äì Mix flour, salt and pepper on a plate (I use my fingertips). Coat the chicken in the flour, shaking off excess, then set aside on a plate., Heat the oil in a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat., Cook chicken ‚Äì Dip the chicken in the egg, allow excess to drip off, then put into the pan. Cook for 3 minutes until golden. Flip, lower heat to medium, then cook for 4 minutes until the chicken is golden (internal temp 68¬∞C/155¬∞F). Remove onto a plate., Lemon ‚Äì Add the lemon slices to the pan. Cook for a minute or until the lemons go soft / brown, then turn and cook the other side for 30 seconds. Remove onto a plate. (Note 2), Wipe the pan clean using paper towels., White wine sauce ‚Äì Still on medium heat, melt the butter in the pan. Add flour and stir for 1 minute using a wooden spoon. While stirring, slowly pour in half the stock. Once the flour is dissolved into the liquid, stir in remaining stock, then the wine and salt. (See Note 3 for lumps tip), Thicken sauce ‚Äì Turn the heat up slightly then simmer for 3 ‚Äì 4 minutes or until the sauce thickens into a syrupy consistency., Sauce it! Return the chicken and lemon slices to the pan, then spoon the sauce all over the chicken. Sprinkle with parsley then serve the chicken with the sauce (use it ALL!).

TITLE: Pierogi Ruskies ‚Äì Polish Dumplings
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 flour, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 50g / 3 tbsp unsalted butter, 1/2 water, 1 large egg
500g / 1 lb potatoes, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 30g / 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 shredded cheddar cheese, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper
30g/ 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 onion, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt
1 cooking/kosher salt, 25g/ 1 1/2 tbsp unsalted butter, Sour cream, Parsley or chives
INSTRUCTIONS: Boil potatoes ‚Äì Put potato and 1 tbsp salt in a large saucepan. Add cold tap water so it's 3cm/1 inch above potatoes. Bring to a boil on high heat then reduce heat to medium high and simmer for 15 minutes or until potatoes are soft., Mash ‚Äì Drain, then pass the potatoes through a potato ricer into a bowl (or use potato masher), Cheese it ‚Äì Immediately add butter, cheese, salt and pepper. Mix with a wooden spoon until fully combined., Cool ‚Äì Spread out ~1cm / 1/2" thick on a tray. Cover with cling wrap, pressing so it is fully in contact. Cool on the counter (~30 min) then refrigerate until cold (1 hour+).

Melt butter ‚Äì Heat up the water and butter in a small saucepan over medium heat just until butter is melted, do not boil water. (Or do this in the microwave). Turn off heat., Mix dough ‚Äì Whisk the flour and salt in a mixing bowl. Make a well in the centre and then add the butter water plus egg. Mix to combine into a shaggy dough., Knead ‚Äì Scrape out onto a lightly floured work surface. Knead for 5 minutes until the dough becomes smooth (Note 3). You could also use your stand mixer., Rest ‚Äì Wrap with cling wrap and leave on the counter for 30 minutes.

Roll & cut ‚Äì On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to 3mm / 1/8" thickness. Cut out rounds using a 7.5 cm / 3" cutter. Do as many as you can, then gather surplus dough into a ball, wrap with cling wrap and set aside for later., Fill & wrap ‚Äì Place 1 tablespoon of cheesy potato filling in the middle of a round. Dip finger with water and run along edge of half the circle. Fold dough over to enclose the filling and press to seal, making slight indents (no pleats)., Wrap remaining ‚Äì Place them on a lightly floured tray and continue to wrap remaining Pierogi (including rolling out the remaining dough). You should get ~30 pierogis.

In a non stick skillet, melt the butter until foamy over medium heat. Add onion and salt, then cook, stirring regularly, for 10 to 15 minutes until golden on the edges. Scrape out into a bowl, then set aside (OK to cool).

Batch cooking ‚Äì Directions below are for cooking and serving 10. Boil pierogis in batches of 10 to 12 max, they need space to bounce around in the water, and you need space to toss them in the butter. (Note 4 for big batch cooking), Boil 5 minutes ‚Äì Bring ~3 litres/quarts of water to the boil with 1 tbsp salt. Lower 10 piergosi into the water. Cook for 5 minutes ‚Äì they should be floating on the surface., Reserve water & drain ‚Äì Dip a jug into the water and scoop out ~1 cup water. Then use a slotted spoon to transfer pierogi into a bowl (or drain, if not cooking more)., Butter sauce ‚Äì Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1/3 of the onion butter plus the cooked pierogis with 2 tablespoons of the reserved cooking water. Toss for 1 minute, still on the stove, until the pierogis are coated in the butter. (Note 4 on scaling up), Serve ‚Äì Slide onto a serving plate, scraping out every drop of butter. Sprinkle with parsley, add a dollop of sour cream. Eat and be happy!

TITLE: Hasselback potatoes
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 5 ‚Äì 6 potatoes, 1 1/2 extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt
1/4 extra virgin olive oil, 1 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 4 garlic cloves, 3 rosemary sprigs
INSTRUCTIONS: Hasselback slice 2mm thick. Rub/sprinkle with 1 1/2 tsp oil and 1/4 tsp salt., Bake 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan) for 30 min. Pour over oil, sprinkle with salt, throw garlic and rosemary on tray. Bake further 40 min, basting generously every 10 min (getting oil between slices key), until cooked. Crank up to 220¬∞C/425¬∞F (200¬∞C fan), baste, bake 10 ‚Äì 15 min until extra golden.

Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced)., Cut prep ‚Äì Cut a thin slice off the base of a potato to make it sit flat while cutting. Place the potato between 2 wooden spatulas or chopsticks (no thicker than 1cm / 0.4" ‚Äì Note 4), to make it impossible for you to accidentally cut all the way through!, THIN slices ‚Äì Cut the potato into very thin slices, aiming for 2 mm. The cuts on the edges of the potato can be slightly thicker as the edges bake up crisper. (Note 4 for tips), Rub ‚Äì Drizzle each potato the 1 1/2 tsp oil then sprinkle/rub with the 1/4 tsp salt (ie share across all).

Bake 1 ‚Äì Place the potatoes on a tray. Bake for 30 minutes, then remove from oven., Baste 1 ‚Äì The potato slices should be slightly less "stuck" together at this stage. Pour the 1/4 cup olive oil over the potatoes then sprinkle the salt evenly over. The salt gets spread later, so don't worry if it looks like a lot! Throw the garlic and rosemary on the tray., Baking/basting ‚Äì Bake the potatoes for another 40 minutes, basting with the oil on the tray every 10 minutes. Brush with a bit of pressure across the surface of the potatoes to encourage the oil and salt to drip down. Once oil gets between the slices, they will fan out more and more., CRISP IT! ‚Äì Once the potatoes are soft in the centre (check with knife), turn the oven UP to 220¬∞C/425¬∞F (200¬∞C). Baste the potatoes again then bake for a further 10 ‚Äì 15 minutes until the edges are nice and golden. I am quite bold with this step, many others do not seek as much crispy edges., Serve immediately while hot and the edges are crispy! Peeling off those end bits are the BEST.

TITLE: Calabrian Fish Ragu
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 250g/ 8 oz firm white fish fillets, 3/4 black peppercorns, 1 fennel seeds, 1 smoked paprika, 1/2 red chilli flakes, 1/2 nutmeg powder, 1/2 caster / superfine sugar, 3/4 cooking / kosher salt, 3 extra virgin olive oil, 2 tomato paste
250g/8 oz linguine pasta, 1 cooking / kosher salt, 1 1/2 extra virgin olive oil, 3 garlic cloves, 3/4 tomato passata
1 finely chopped parsley, Parmesan cheese
1 stale bread like sourdough, ciabatta, 2 extra virgin olive oil, 1 cooking / kosher salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Toast & grind ‚Äì Preheat a large deep skillet or pot over medium heat (Note 5), no oil. Toast black peppercorn and fennel for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes until it smells fragrant and the fennel is lightly browned. Transfer to a mortar and use a pestle and grind to a powder while still hot., Coat fish ‚Äì Transfer to a medium bowl with remaining Calabrian spiced fish ingredients. Stir well with a spatula until combined. Set aside., Cook pasta ‚Äì Boil 3 litres of water with the cooking salt. Cook pasta per packet directions minus 1 minute. Just before draining, scoop out 1 1/2 cups pasta cooking water. Then drain in a colander and leave until ready to use., Calabrian fish ragu ‚Äì While the pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in the same skillet you used to toast the fennel on medium high. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the fish. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring regularly. Add tomato passata. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add 1 cup of the reserved pasta cooking water and simmer for 2 minutes., Toss pasta ‚Äì Add pasta and 3/4 of the parsley. Toss for 1 minute to coat the pasta with the sauce. Most of the fish will break up into flakes but some will remain in larger chunks ‚Äì this is good! We don't want disintegrated mush, nor giant chunks. Once the pasta turns red and the sauce and fish bits are clinging to the pasta straws, remove from heat and divide between bowls immediately., Serve ‚Äì Sprinkle with pasta, pangrattato and parmesan. Eat immediately!

Preheat oven to 180¬∞C / 350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced)., Toss bread, oil and salt in a small bowl. Spread on a tray and bake for 10 minutes, tossing at the 5 minute mark, or until light golden and fully crisp.

TITLE: Chocolate Cream Pie
AUTHOR: ERROR
INGREDIENTS: 25 Oreo biscuits, 60g / 4 tbsp unsalted butter

1/4 cornflour / cornstarch, 2/3 caster sugar, Pinch of salt, 2 milk, 1 cream, 4 egg yolks, 2 tbsp / 30g unsalted butter, 1 vanilla extract, 150g/ 5 oz dark 70% cocoa chocolate, 75g/ 3 oz milk chocolate
1 1/2 thickened / heavy cream, 2 white sugar, 1/2 vanilla extract
Chocolate
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞ fan-forced)., Cut round paper ‚Äì Cut a round piece of baking / parchment paper, the size of the pie dish (to prevent skin forming on custard). (Note 5)

Blitz ‚Äì Break up Oreos roughly by hand and place in a food processor. Blitz into crumbs (~10 sec). Add butter, blitz to mix through. Mixture should resemble wet sand. (No food processor? Bash in ziplock bag with a rolling pin)., Press ‚Äì Pour into a 23cm / 9" pie dish. Spread crumbs out and press firmly into the base and up the walls using your hands, spatula or something flat., Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven ‚Äì the crust will be slightly puffed. Press down gently using a rubber spatula (makes it even crustier!) then allow to cool on the counter before filling.

Whisk dry, then wet ‚Äì Place cornflour, sugar and salt in a large saucepan. Whisk to combine. Add milk, cream and yolks. Whisk to combine., Heat to thicken ‚Äì Turn heat onto medium high. As the mixture warms up, whisk every now and then, but not constantly. As the liquid starts to get hot at around the 3 ‚Äì 5 minute mark (you'll see steam), turn the stove down to medium low and start to whisk constantly. You will feel and see the mixture start to thicken. Got lumps? See Note 6!, 45 second whisk ‚Äì When you see slow, lazy bubbles (~6 minutes, you will need to pause whisking to see bubbles), whisk constantly for 45 seconds then take it off the stove., Chocolate and butter ‚Äì Add butter, chocolate and vanilla. Whisk until chocolate melts and filling is smooth.

Pour hot filling into pie crust, filling it right to the top, smooth surface. Gently place round baking paper on surface. (Surplus custard? Note 7), Cool on the counter for 2 hours then refrigerate for 12+ hours to allow the custard to fully set., Whipped cream ‚Äì Beat whipped cream ingredients in a bowl on high for 2 to 3 minutes until softly whipped., Topping ‚Äì Carefully peel back paper. Pile on the whipped cream, then grate chocolate across the surface., Serving ‚Äì Keep the pie in the pie tin. Cut and serve!

TITLE: Maple Roasted Pumpkin with Chili and Feta
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 2 lb / 1 kg pumpkin, 1 red onion, 1/2 walnuts, 3 olive oil, 3 maple syrup, 3/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1 ‚Äì 1 1/2 dried chili flakes
3/4 Danish feta, 1 large red chilli, 1 parsley
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced)., Toss ‚Äì Place the pumpkin, onion and walnuts on a large, paper lined tray. Drizzle with olive oil and maple syrup, then toss to coat (hands really is best). Sprinkle with chilli and salt, toss again, then spread out on a tray. Don't crowd them else they will stew instead of roast!, Roast for 30 minutes, or until the pumpkin is lightly browned and cooked through, tossing once at the 20 minute mark., Finishes ‚Äì Remove from the oven. Gently toss again, then transfer to a serving platter in a single layer. Crumble over feta, sprinkle with parsley and chilli. Or do the sprinkling on the tray then pile into a bowl. Serve immediately!

TITLE: Ultra Crunchy Fried Chicken Burger
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 chicken breast, 4 boneless thigh fillets
3/4 buttermilk, 1 1/2 cooking / kosher salt, 1 large egg
4 soft buns, 2 ‚Äì 3 iceberg lettuce, 2 tomatoes, 2 gherkins / dill pickles
2/3 mayonnaise, 3/4 garlic
3/4 flour, 1/4 corn flour / cornstarch

1/4 celery salt, 1/2 sweet paprika, 1/8 cayenne pepper, 1/2 onion powder, 1 garlic powder, 1/4 mustard powder, 1/4 ginger powder, 1/2 dried thyme, 1/2 dried oregano, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1 1/2 black pepper
3 vegetable oil
INSTRUCTIONS: Shortform recipe:, Pound chicken to 1cm / 0.4" thickness, trim, marinade 3 ‚Äì 24 hrs. Mix coating and seasoning, mix in 2 tbsp marinade. Coat chicken, fry at 180¬∞C/350¬∞F for 4 min (don't touch for first 90 sec). Assemble!, Full instructions:, Chicken ‚Äì Cover the chicken with a freezer bag or plastic sheet and pound to 1cm / 0.4" even thickness. Trim to just a touch larger than the size of your bun. Save off-cuts for another use (stir fry ‚Äì or Dozer, in my case!)., Marinade ‚Äì Whisk Marinade ingredients in a bowl. Add chicken, toss. Marinate in the fridge for 3 hours minimum, to overnight (don't go beyond 24 hrs)., Garlic mayo ‚Äì Mix in a small bowl and refrigerate until required., Prepare crunchy coating ‚Äì Mix flour, cornflour and Seasoning ingredients in a bowl. Drizzle over 2 tablespoons of the marinade, then use fingers to mix through to form lumps ‚Äì when this sticks to the chicken, it fries up into awesome crunchy bits!!, Heat oil in a large heavy based pot over medium high heat to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (Note 2)., Coat chicken ‚Äì Pick up a piece of chicken and allow excess marinade to drip off. Press to coat in flour coating. Shake off excess, then fry for 2 minutes on each side until golden. DO NOT TOUCH for the first 90 seconds to allow the coating to adhere. I fry 2 at a time. Drain on paper towels, cook remaining chicken., Assemble ‚Äì Smear garlic mayo on the top and bottom of the buns. Pile lettuce on the base, top with tomato if using. Then chicken, gherkins and put the lid on. Sink your teeth into it immediately and enjoy!

TITLE: Miso butter corn
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 30g / 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 1/2 white miso
200g / 7oz streaky bacon, 3 corn kernels, 2 garlic cloves, 2 cooking sake, 1/8 white pepper, 1 green onion
INSTRUCTIONS: Miso butter ‚Äì Mix butter and miso together in a small bowl until combined., Golden bacon ‚Äì Put bacon in an unheated large non stick pan, no oil. Turn the stove onto medium high heat ‚Äì as it heats up, the fat will start to melt so the bacon cooks in its own fat. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes until golden, then use a slotted spoon to transfer onto a paper towel lined plate. Reserve bacon fat in the pan., Cook corn ‚Äì Top up with butter if you don‚Äôt have 1 tbsp fat left in pan. Still on medium high, add corn, then stir only every minute or so (this lets it get some nice golden spots), for about 5 minutes until corn is just cooked and is sweet. Add garlic, stir for another 30 seconds. Add sake, stir until evaporated (~15 seconds)., Melt miso butter ‚Äì Turn off stove. Add miso butter, stir until melted. Add pepper, bacon and green onion, toss until coated with sauce. Serve!, Serve as a side dish. In a corn taco with a fried egg and avocado (OMG SO GOOD).

TITLE: Basque Cheesecake
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 750 g / 1.5 lb cream cheese blocks, 1 caster / superfine sugar, 1 1/4 whipping cream, 1/4 flour, 1 vanilla bean extract, 3/4 cups + 1 tbsp lightly whisked eggs
INSTRUCTIONS: See below for full length written recipe. Shorthand recipe is for experienced bakers.

Prep ‚Äì Preheat oven¬†to 220¬∞C / 425¬∞F (200¬∞C fan) with the shelf in the middle. Press scrunched paper into 20cm/8" springform pan., Batter ‚Äì Beat cream cheese 2 minutes on medium. Beat in sugar on low speed for 10 seconds. In separate bowl, hand whisk 1/4 cup cream with the flour (becomes like paste). Whisk in remaining cream and vanilla. While beating on low, slowly pour cream into cream cheese, then eggs (don't overbeat)., Bake ‚Äì Pour into pan, bang pan on counter, pop bubbles with knife. Bake 45 min (up to 65 min possible, Note 8) until top deep golden. Cool 2 hrs on counter then 8 hrs+ in fridge uncovered. Ready for serving!

Preheat oven to 220¬∞C / 425¬∞F (200¬∞C fan) with the shelf in the middle of the oven., Pan prep (Note 4) ‚Äì Press 2 x 40cm/16" sheets of scrunched up baking/parchment paper arranged in an "X" into a 20cm/8" springform pan (6cm / 2.5" tall), and fold down over the rim to hold in place. You'll need to scrunch/pleat to fit which creates the signature rustic sides! The batter will weigh it down so don't worry if it doesn't stay in., Beat the cream cheese in a large bowl on medium speed for 2 minutes, scraping down the sides as needed, until smooth and lump-free. Add sugar and beat on low speed for 10 seconds., Flour & cream (Note 6) ‚Äì Put about 1/4 of the cream and all the flour in a medium bowl. Hand whisk until lump free (it will be paste-like), then slowly pour in the remaining cream while whisking. Once flour is incorporated, whisk in vanilla. (PS not making whipped cream here! Should be pourable), Slowly pour the cream into the cream cheese bowl with the beater going on low. Beat just until combined. Then slowly pour the eggs in while the beater is still on low speed. As soon as the eggs are incorporated, stop beating to minimise getting bubbles in the batter (Note 7)., Remove air bubbles ‚Äì Pour into the prepared pan. Bang the pan on the counter then pop bubbles that rise to the surface with a small sharp knife. I do repeat 3 to 5 times. (Note 7), Bake 45 minutes or until the surface is a deep golden brown. It can take up to 65 minutes and that's fine! (Seriously, read Note 8) Keep a close eye on it for the last 15 minutes, you want it deeply golden but not burnt. The centre will still be wobbly and the cake will rise like a souffl√©., Chill overnight ‚Äì Cool in the cake pan for at least 2 hours on the counter (it will sink, that's normal). Then refrigerate for a minimum of 8 hours, uncovered., Serving ‚Äì Release the sides of the springform pan. Hold excess paper overhang to lift off base onto a cutting board or plate. Fold down sides ‚Äì I love serving it on the paper, it's part of the visuals! Bring to room temp for 30 minutes if time permits, though also great served chilled. Cut like cake! Eat as is ‚Äì doesn't need cream, berries etc.

TITLE: Easy roast potatoes
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 kg/ 2 lb baby potatoes, 4 extra virgin olive oil, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 5 garlic cloves with skin on, 5 thyme sprigs
Finely chopped parsley or fresh thyme
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C / 400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan)., Smashed garlic ‚Äì Place side of knife on unpeeled garlic clove. Hit firmly with palm of hand so the garlic bursts open a bit but mostly stays in tact., Toss ‚Äì Put potatoes on a tray and push together. Drizzle with oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Toss through thyme and garlic. Spread out on tray., Roast 1 hour ‚Äì Roast for 30 minutes. Toss. Roast for a further 25 to 35 minutes, or until the potatoes are golden. (Note 4 for stuck potatoes & golden TIPS!), Serve ‚Äì Sprinkle with parsley, if using, and serve immediately!

TITLE: Homemade sausage patties
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 500g/ 1 lb pork mince (ground pork), 1 dried ground sage, 1/2 dried thyme, 1 onion powder, 1/2 garlic powder, 1 black pepper, 3/4 cooking / kosher salt, 1/2 sugar
2 olive oil, Ketchup for serving
INSTRUCTIONS: Make patties ‚Äì Place sausage pattie ingredients in a bowl and mix well with your hands. Divide into 8 and form 1 cm / 0.4" thick patties. Make a shallow dent in the middle of the surface ‚Äì this prevents the patties from doming as they cook., Cook 4 minutes ‚Äì Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large non stick pan over medium high heat. Cook half the patties for 2 minutes on each side until golden. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate. Heat remaining oil and cook remaining patties., Serve with ketchup! (See recipe card intro for serving ideas)

TITLE: Spicy Wontons ‚Äì Din Tai Fung!
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 10 ‚Äì 12 wontons, 1 green onion, Extra chilli oil

2 garlic cloves, 1 caster / superfine sugar, 1/2 red chilli flakes, 1/4 sichuan pepper powder, 1/4 Chinese five spice powder, 1/2 Chinese chicken stock powder, 2 Chinese chilli oil, 1 vegetable oil, 2 1/2 light soy sauce, 1 rice vinegar, 2 1/2 hot water
INSTRUCTIONS: Mix spices ‚Äì Put the garlic, sugar, chilli flakes, sichuan pepper, five spices and stock powder in a medium mixing bowl., Heat oil ‚Äì Heat the chilli oil and vegetable oil in a small frying pan over medium heat until hot. Pour over garlic mixture. Enjoy the sizzle! (Don't worry, it doesn't spit), Add sauces: ‚Äì Whisk in soy sauce, rice vinegar and hot water. The oil will remain a little separated on top. Set aside while you make wontons.

Cook wontons ‚Äì Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil. Add wontons and cook until they float: 4 minutes for freshly made, 6 to 8 minutes from frozen., Assemble ‚Äì Transfer to serving dish using a slotted spoon. Pour over sauce, add an extra drizzle of chilli oil (if you dare!), sprinkle with green onion. Serve immediately!

TITLE: Bok Choy in Ginger Sauce
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 6 small bok choys, 2 vegetable oil, 1/4 ginger, 1/4 water
3 cornflour/cornstarch, 1 1/2 light soy sauce, 1 oyster sauce, 2 Chinese cooking wine, 1 sesame oil, 1/4 water, 1/4 cooking salt, white pepper
INSTRUCTIONS: Cutting ‚Äì Trim the base of the bok choy then separate all the leaves. Leave the delicate baby bok choy in the centre intact, it's precious! Cut giant stems in half lengthwise so they are all roughly the same size. Rinse in colander, shake off excess water (don't need to dry fully)., Sauce ‚Äì Stir Sauce ingredients except water in a jug until cornflour is dissolved. (Easier to make lump free with less liquid). Then stir in water., Gingery oil ‚Äì Put the ginger and oil in a large non-stick pan. Turn onto medium heat. Once the ginger starts sizzling, saut√© for 1 minute until it turns light golden and is a bit floppy. Add bok choy then use 2 spatulas to toss the ginger for around 15 seconds to coat., Steam ‚Äì Turn heat up to medium, pour water over. Cover with lid and steam for just 45 seconds., Sauce ‚Äì Remove lid (bok choy will still be a bit underdone), pour in sauce, toss for 30 seconds until sauce changes from murky to clear, and thickens. Bok choy should be just floppy but still soft crunch, not mushy. If your sauce gets too thick (Note 4), add a tiny splash of water and mix., Serve ‚Äì Pour the bok choy and all the sauce onto a serving plate, then eat!

TITLE: Golden coconut chicken curry
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 3 coconut oil, 3 star anise, 1 cinnamon stick, 1 onion, 500g / 1lb chicken thigh fillets, 1 garlic, 1 ginger, 3 turmeric, 2 chicken stock/broth, 400g / 14 oz coconut cream, 1 large head broccoli, 1 coriander/cilantro leaves
1 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1 1/2 garam masala, 1 1/2 coriander powder, 1/2 cumin powder, 1/2 fennel powder
Crispy fried shallots, Rice
INSTRUCTIONS: Spice mix ‚Äì Mix the spices in a small bowl., Toast ‚Äì Heat the oil in a large heavy based pot over medium high heat. Toast the star anise and cinnamon for 2 minutes., Add onion, cook for 2 minutes., Add chicken, cook for 3 minutes or it's no longer pink on the outside (still raw inside)., Add aromatics ‚Äì Add garlic, ginger and turmeric. Cook for 1 minute., Add spice mix and stir for 30 seconds., Simmer 12 minutes ‚Äì Add stock and coconut cream. Stir and bring to an energetic simmer. Cook for 12 minutes (no need to stir) so the sauce thickens slightly., Add broccoli florets. Bring back to a simmer and cook for 3 minutes or until softened., Serve ‚Äì Cool for 5 minutes, this will allow the sauce to thicken slightly. Then stir in coriander and serve with rice (basmati or jasmine especially nice). Garnish with extra coriander and crispy fried shallots.

TITLE: Easy Lemon Bars
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 3/4 plain flour, 1/4 rice flour, 1/2 icing sugar / powdered sugar, 1/4 salt, 110g / 1 stick unsalted butter
3 large eggs, 1 caster sugar / super-fine sugar, 2 plain flour, 1 lemon zest, 1/2 lemon juice
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180C/350F (160C fan). Spray a 20cm/8" square tin with oil and line with baking/parchment paper with overhang (so it can be lifted out once cooked)., Base ‚Äì Place Shortbread Base ingredients in a food processor fitted with the standard "S" blade. Pulse 5 to 10 times until it becomes like sand. (Or use tips of fingers, Note 2). Pour into the tin, spread, then press firmly into the base, pushing it right up to the edges. Using something flat to press in is helpful!, Bake base for 20 minutes or until golden on the edges and pale golden in the middle. Remove from oven. (‚ö†Ô∏è Note: don't let it cool, pour in curd immediately)., Lemon Curd ‚Äì While the base is baking, place Lemon Topping ingredients in a bowl and whisk until combined., Bake 20 minutes ‚Äì Pour Lemon Curd onto base, then bake for 20 minutes until the topping is set but still soft., Cool ‚Äì Remove from then oven and cool on the counter for 1 hour, then fridge for at least 2 hours. Slice into 16 squares. Dust with icing sugar (confectionary sugar) and serve!

TITLE: Garlic Noodles
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 140g/ 5oz dried ramen or noodle cakes
30g / 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 2 tbsp (6 cloves) garlic, finely minced, 2 oyster sauce, 2 fish sauce, 1 1/2 Maggi seasoning, 1/4 noodle cooking water, 1/4 finely grated parmesan, 1/4 green onion
INSTRUCTIONS: Noodles ‚Äì Cook the noodles in a large saucepan per packet directions. Scoop out ~1/2 cup cooking water. Strain noodles and set aside., Sauce ‚Äì Melt butter in the same saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring until soft. Add oyster sauce, fish sauce, Maggi seasoning and 1/4 cup cooking water. Stir to combine., Toss ‚Äì Add cooked noodles, parmesan and green onion. Toss until the noodles are all coated, and the sauce is not pooled in the bottom of the saucepan. Add more cooking water 1 tbsp at the time, if needed to loosen the noodles., Serve immediately!, Serving suggestion: fried egg and broccolini cooked with the noodles*, tossed with Asian Sesame Dressing you always have in your fridge. üôÇ* Broccolini takes about 3 minutes, so put it into the water before/after/with the noodles depending on the noodle cooking time.

TITLE: Farro Salad with Sizzled Garlic Dressing
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 farro, 1 apple cider vinegar, 2 water, 1 cooking/kosher salt
400g/ 14oz (4 cups) grape tomatoes, 1 olive oil, 1/4 each salt and pepper
1 eschallot, 2 baby spinach, 80g/ 3oz goats cheese
2 extra virgin olive oil, 1 1/2 garlic, 2 coriander seeds, 1 1/2 cumin seeds
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan)., Roast tomatoes and toast farro ‚Äì Toss tomatoes on a tray with the olive oil, salt and pepper. Spread farro on a separate tray. Put both in the oven, farro on the top shelf, tomatoes underneath. Bake for 8 minutes, shaking the trays halfway. The farro should be browned with a nutty flavour, the tomatoes should be a bit wrinkly but still holding their shape., Cool tomatoes on the tray while you prep everything else., Cook farro (Note 1) ‚Äì Put the toasted farro in a saucepan with the vinegar, water and salt. Bring to a boil over high heat then reduce to medium so it is simmering. Cover with lid then simmer for 40 ‚Äì 45 minutes or until all/most of the liquid is absorbed and the farro is ready. It should still have a bite to it (not soft like pasta) but not a hard centre. Add more water if needed, and keep cooking ‚Äì don't be afraid to cook it softer if you want. Drain off excess liquid, if there is any, then transfer to a large bowl. (Taste: a bit tangy, the "vinegar" component used in salad dressings!), Pile eschallots on top. Let farro cool to room temp., Sizzling garlic cumin dressing ‚Äì Heat oil in a small pan over medium low heat. Add coriander and cumin, cook for 30 seconds until light golden and you can smell it. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until light golden., Assembling ‚Äì Immediately pour hot oil over eschallots so it semi-cooks it. Toss. Add spinach, toss. Add tomatoes, gently stir through (some tomato collapsing is encouraged). Pour 1/3 into a serving bowl, crumble over 1/3 goats cheese. Repeat twice more, finishing with goats cheese. Eat!

TITLE: Haloumi fries
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 360g / 12oz haloumi cheese blocks, 2 canola oil, 2 large eggs
1/2 plain/all purpose flour, 1 Italian herbs, 1 smoked paprika, 1 ground white pepper
1 panko breadcrumbs, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt
1/2 plain Greek yoghurt, 1 garlic clove, 1/2 lemon juice, 1 extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Garlic dipping sauce ‚Äì Mix ingredients in a bowl and set aside for at least 20 minutes to let the flavours develop., Cut the haloumi into fries around 1.5cm / 0/6" thick. The length will depend on the shape of your haloumi. I cut mine into 5 slices lengthwise, then each into half which makes uniform fries, and get 20 pieces., Dry ‚Äì Pat halloumi mostly dry using tea towels., Prep ‚Äì Using 3 bowls large enough to toss the halloumi, put the eggs in one bowl, mix Flour Dredge in another and mix Crumbing ingredients in a third., Crumb ‚Äì Dip a haloumi fry in flour, shake off excess. Dip in egg, allow excess to drip off. Coat in breadcrumbs, pressing to adhere, then place on tray. PRO: Do 2 at a time. üôåüèª Toss haloumi in breadcrumbs (by tossing the bowl) so you don't have to touch. üôåüèª, Heat oil in a medium sauce pan over high heat until it reaches 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (Note 4)., Fry 5 haloumi sticks at a time for 1 1/2 minutes. Drain on a paper towel lined tray. Repeat with remaining haloumi., Air fry and baking ‚Äì see Note 5., Serve hot with yoghurt garlic dipping sauce!

TITLE: Tuna sandwich
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 425g/ 15 oz canned tuna in oil, 3/4 whole egg mayonnaise or Kewpie, 3/4 finely diced celery, 5 finely chopped dill pickle, 2 liquid from pickle jar, 2 Dijon mustard, 3 finely chopped dill, 1/3 finely sliced green onion, 1/2 black pepper
8 butter lettuce, Salted butter, 8 bread or 4 rolls
INSTRUCTIONS: Filling ‚Äì Put all the Tuna Filling ingredients in a bowl. Mix well using a wooden spoon, breaking up the tuna so the filling becomes fairly smooth. The pickles and celery will take a beating too which is encouraged -> flavour melding!, Sandwich ‚Äì Divide Tuna Filling between 4 sandwiches (or more/less depending on bread size). I butter the bread and use 2 pieces of lettuce per sandwich. Enjoy!

TITLE: Vietnamese Caramel Ginger Chicken
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 kg / 2 lb skinless chicken thigh fillets, 3 fish sauce, 1 bird‚Äôs eye chilli or Thai chilli, 3 vegetable oil, 1/4 brown sugar, 1/3 ginger, 2 eschallots, 1/2 boiling water
Fresh coriander/cilantro or green onion slices, Red chilli, Jasmine rice
INSTRUCTIONS: Toss chicken with fish sauce and chilli, then set aside while you prepare the other ingredients. You could marinate even overnight but it's not necessary., Pan size ‚Äì Use a large¬†non-stick pan (mine is 30cm/12", must be large). Else, be prepared to remove chicken at end to speed up sauce reduction. See Note 4!, Caramel ‚Äì Mix oil and sugar in the cold pan, then turn onto medium high heat.  As soon as the sugar is melted, remove the pan from the stove then carefully add the chicken (‚ö†Ô∏è it will sizzle so don't throw it in!) . Add ginger and shallots, toss briefly. The caramel may harden, that's ok, it will re-melt., Cook outside of chicken ‚Äì Then put the pan back on the stove and stir just until the chicken changes from pink to white all over, but not browned, and definitely not cooked through., Simmer 10 min ‚Äì Add water, stir, bring to a simmer. Simmer very rapidly, still on medium high (or even high!), for 10 to 12 minutes, until the liquid reduces right down to a glaze. It might take longer if your pan is smaller or your stove is weaker, that's ok. Stir every now and then while watery, then once it's reduced down to a glaze, toss regularly to get nice colour on the chicken. The further you take it, the better the colour!, Serve with jasmine rice¬†or¬†other plain rice garnished with extra slices of chilli and fresh coriander if desired. Smashed cucumbers or Asian Slaw would be a terrific side!

TITLE: Rocky Road
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 225 ‚Äì 250g / 8 oz dark chocolate melts or chips (1 1/2 cups), 225 ‚Äì 250g / 8 oz milk chocolate melts or chips (1 1/2 cups), 2 coconut oil or any plain flavoured oil
3 marshmallows, pink and white, 3/4 raspberry lollies, 1/3 desiccated coconut, 1/2 unsalted peanuts
INSTRUCTIONS: Line a 20cm/8" square pan with baking paper (parchment paper)., Melt chocolate ‚Äì Place chocolate and oil in a bowl. Microwave in 30 second increments, stirring in between, until melted and smooth., Add-ins ‚Äì Stir the Add-ins into the chocolate. Pour into pan, spreading out evenly., Refrigerate for 3 hours or until fully cool., Cut ‚Äì Remove from the fridge 30 minutes prior to cutting. I cut into 5 lines, then into chunks for eating or larger pieces for gifting!

TITLE: Spicy Asian Zucchini
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 5 zucchini, small / medium, 1 canola oil, 3/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 crispy fried shallots, 1 green onion stem
1 canola oil, 3 garlic cloves, 1 sambal oelak, 1 sesame oil, 1 soy sauce, 2 mirin
