INSTRUCTIONS: Toss the zucchini in oil then sprinkle with salt and toss to (roughly) coat all over., Cook ‚Äì Heat a large non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Place half the zucchini cut side down and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until the surface is golden. Turn and cook the skin side for 3 minutes. Pile onto a serving plate and repeat with remaining zucchini., Sauce ‚Äì cool the pan slightly then return to medium heat. Heat the oil then saut√© the garlic until light golden. Add remaining Sauce ingredients, simmer for 30 seconds until syrupy., Serve ‚Äì Pour over zucchini, pile on Crispy Asian Shallots and green onion. Eat!

TITLE: Lamb tagine
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1.6 kg/ 3.2lb boneless lamb shoulder, trim the fat, then, 1 kg / 2 lb lamb stewing meat or shoulder, already trimmed of fat

1 cooking/kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 3 canola oil, 3 garlic cloves, 2 brown onions, 1 1/2 tomato paste, 2 grated ginger, 2 cinnamon sticks, 2 1/2 chicken stock/broth, 1 dried apricots, 2 ‚Äì 3 lemon zest
1 ground coriander, 1 ground cumin, 2 ground cardamom, 2 turmeric powder, 1 1/2 fennel powder, 1 cayenne pepper, 1/4 ground cloves, 1/4 ground ginger, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt
1/2 slivered almonds, 1/2 coriander/cilantro leaves roughly chopped, 1 1/2 couscous
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞F/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan). (Note 6 re: other cook methods), Spice mix ‚Äì Mix the ingredients in a bowl then set aside., Brown lamb ‚Äì Toss lamb¬†with the salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large oven-proof dutch oven (with a lid) over high heat. Brown the lamb in 3 batches, turning to colour the pieces all over, about 3 minutes. Remove into a bowl, then repeat with remaining lamb. Set aside., Aromatics ‚Äì Turn heat down to medium high. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes until soft. Add tomato paste, ginger, cinnamon and spice mix. Cook for 1 1/2 minutes, stirring constantly., Sauce ‚Äì Add chicken stock and water, stir, then return the lamb into the pot., Slow cook 1 hr 45 min ‚Äì Bring to a simmer, cover with a lid then cook in the oven for 45 minutes. Add apricots, put the lid back on and cook for another 1 hour, checking halfway to ensure the sauce hasn't reduced all the way (if you're concerned, add 1/2 cup water)., Lemon finish ‚Äì Lamb should be tender ‚Äì check! Gently stir in lemon zest., Serve over plain couscous, sprinkled with almonds and coriander.

TITLE: Really great waffles
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 1/4 flour, 2 1/2 caster sugar / superfine sugar, cooking / kosher salt, 4 baking powder, 1 1/3 milk, 1/2 vanilla essence, 4 large eggs, 150g / 11 tbsp unsalted butter
Butter, Maple syrup, Icing sugar / powdered sugar, Strawberries, other fruit
INSTRUCTIONS: Whisk dry ‚Äì Place the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a large mixing bowl. Whisk to mix., Whisk in wet ‚Äì Add milk, eggs and vanilla. Whisk to combine. Add melted butter then whisk until lump free. The batter should be pourable but thick ‚Äì slightly thinner than pancakes., Recommended resting (Note 1) ‚Äì Cover then refrigerate overnight, or for at least 2 hours. Softer insides, better flavour. Else, proceed immediately with cooking., Preheat a waffle maker (Note 2, inc setting options). A non stick one will not need oil, plus there is butter in the batter., Cooking ‚Äì Use a ladle to pour batter in to just cover the iron. Don't get greedy ‚Äì it will leak out the sides! Cook until golden and crisp ‚Äì my good waffle iron takes 3 1/2 minutes, my Kmart one takes 6 minutes., Serving ‚Äì Transfer onto plates and serve as you go, with desired toppings. Or, put on a rack and keep warm in a preheated 70¬∞C/150¬∞F oven while you continue cooking!

TITLE: Sweet potato steaks
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 gigantic sweet potato ‚Äì to cut 2 x ‚Äústeaks‚Äù, 2 ‚Äì 3 olive oil
1 1/2 smoked paprika, 1/2 onion powder, 1/2 garlic powder, 1/4 cumin powder, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
1 plain yogurt, 2 1/2 tahini, 1 1/2 lemon juice, 1 garlic clove, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt
2 extra virgin olive oil, 3 garlic cloves, 1 1/2 eschallot, 1 red cayenne pepper, 1 green cayenne pepper, 1 white sesame seeds
2 pine nuts, 2 coriander/cilantro leaves, sumac, Pita or lebanese bread
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan-forced). Line a tray with parchment/baking paper., Bake sweet potato ‚Äì Rub sweet potato steaks with oil, then sprinkle each side evenly with spice mix (don‚Äôt rub, it smears). Bake 45 ‚Äì 50 minutes until potato is soft. Don‚Äôt flip., Tahini yogurt sauce ‚Äì Whisk ingredients in a medium heat-proof bowl until mostly combined. Microwave for 20 seconds on high. Whisk again ‚Äì it will be like softly whipped cream! Use warm or at room temp., Toast pine nuts in a small pan (no oil) preheated over medium heat. Once lightly golden, remove into a bowl., Topping ‚Äì In the same pan, heat oil (still on medium). Add all Topping ingredients and cook, stirring, until the garlic is golden. Transfer into a bowl immediately., Assemble ‚Äì Smear most of the yogurt sauce on plate (save some for drizzling). Put sweet potato on top. Sprinkle with Topping, drizzle with yogurt sauce, then sprinkle with pine nuts, coriander and sumac. EAT with crunchy toasted flatbread!

TITLE: One pot creamy tomato beef pasta
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 1/2 olive oil, 2 garlic cloves, 1 onion, 500g/ 1 lb beef mince / ground beef, 2 Italian herbs, 2 tomato paste, 400g/ 14 oz can crushed tomatoes, 1/2 red pepper flakes, 1 1/2 cooking salt/kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 4 cups (1 L) chicken stock/broth, 350g/ 12oz fusilli, penne, elbow macaroni, 3/4 thickened / heavy cream
Parmesan cheese, Parsley
INSTRUCTIONS: Saut√© ‚Äì Heat the oil on high heat in a large heavy-based pot. Cook garlic and onion for 1 1/2 minutes., Cook beef & seasonings ‚Äì Add beef and cook, breaking it up as you go, until you can no longer see red meat. Add the Italian herbs and cook for 30 seconds, then add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute to cook out the raw flavour., All in ‚Äì Add crushed tomato, chicken stock, salt, pepper and red pepper flakes, if using. Stir, then add the pasta., Cook 15 min ‚Äì Bring the liquid to a simmer, then cook for 15 minutes, stirring every couple of minutes then more frequently towards the end (ensure pasta doesn't stick to base) until the pasta is just about cooked., Creamy ‚Äì Add cream, then simmer for a further 1 to 2 minutes. It will still be quite saucy ‚Äì this is what you want! Pasta absorbs liquid quickly, so it will still be nice and oozy when you start eating., Serve ‚Äì Remove from the stove. Give it a good stir then ladle into bowls. Serve with parmesan and parsley.

TITLE: Apple turnovers ‚Äì with cream filled option!
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 Granny Smith apples, 2 cornflour/cornstarch, 1 cinnamon, 1/2 white sugar, 1/2 vanilla extract, salt
2 puff pastry sheets, 1 egg
2 Stabilised whipped cream OR stiff whipped cream
1 Whipped cream for dunking, Icing sugar / powdered sugar
INSTRUCTIONS: Filling ‚Äì Put apples in a large saucepan. Toss with cornflour. Add everything else. Cook on medium to medium-high heat, stirring regularly, for 5 minutes. Apple should be softened but not mushy or losing shape, with some but not too much caramel., Cool ‚Äì Spread the filling on a large plate then let it fully cool. (Note 5), Line a large cutting board or upside down tray with baking/parchment paper., Make turnovers ‚Äì Working one puff pastry sheet at a time, barely thawed, cut into 4 squares (12.5cm/5"). Brush 2 sides with egg, then pile filling on the egg brushed side. Avoid using sauce, soaks base and if it leaks onto edge it will not seal. (Save leftover sauce & apple for pancakes, french toast, ice cream etc!), Wrap ‚Äì Fold over, seal with fork dipped in flour (prevents sticking to pastry). Transfer to paper lined cutting board., Refrigerate for 20 minutes (cold = better puffing)., Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan)., Bake 25 min ‚Äì Slide the paper with the turnovers on it onto a large baking tray. (Note 6 for why) Brush turnovers with egg. Stab 3 times. Bake 25 minutes or until golden., Serve warm, dusted with icing sugar and whipped cream for dunking.
Transfer turnovers to a cooling rack. Fully cool. Split seam side open with knife. Pipe in cream. EAT!

TITLE: Thai Coconut Pumpkin Soup
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 vegetable oil, 1 brown onion, 2 garlic cloves, 3 Thai red curry paste, 1.8kg/ 3.6 lb pumpkin or butternut squash, 2 1/2 vegetable stock, 400ml/ 14 oz coconut milk,, 1 fish sauce
Crispy Asian shallots, Red cayenne pepper, Fresh coriander leaves, Roti
INSTRUCTIONS: Saut√© ‚Äì Heat oil in a large heavy based pot over medium high heat. Add onion and garlic, cook for 2 minutes until soft., Add curry paste and cook for 2 minutes., Add pumpkin and stir to coat in the flavours for around 2 minutes., Simmer 8 minutes ‚Äì Set aside 1/4 cup coconut milk for garnish. Add stock, remaining coconut milk and fish sauce. Bring to simmer then reduce heat to medium and simmer for 8 minutes until the pumpkin is soft., Blitz using stick blender until smooth., Serve topped with garnishes. Dunk in roti. Enjoy!

TITLE: How to cut butternut pumpkin (butternut squash)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 butternut pumpkin / butternut squash
INSTRUCTIONS: Peel off¬†the skin using a potato peeler. The skin is softer than pumpkin so it's easier., Cut in half¬†using a sharp knife. Just straight through the middle, lying down. Use the weight of your body pressing down on the knife and/or rock the knife back and forth., Stand upright,¬†then cut in half again., Scoop out¬†the seeds using a spoon., Cut the cheeks off¬†the side with the stem (too hard to cut through the stem). Then trim all the butternut flesh from around the hard stem., Cut ‚Äì¬†And finally, cut the butternut into the size you want! For Pumpkin Soup, you will want them in 3cm / 1.2" chunks.

TITLE: Garlic rice
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 50 ‚Äì 75g/ 4 ‚Äì 5 tbsp unsalted butter, 5 garlic cloves, 2 white rice (uncooked), 3 chicken stock/broth, 3/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1 parsley
INSTRUCTIONS: No need to rinse the rice. The rice will be fluffy because this recipe uses the right ratio: 1.5 cups liquid for every 1 cup of rice., Saut√© garlic ‚Äì Melt half the butter in a large saucepan over medium high heat. Once foamy, add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds until it turns light golden., Coat rice ‚Äì Add the rice and stir for 30 seconds or until the grains turn translucent., Simmer ‚Äì Add stock and salt. Turn heat up to high, then once the water starts bubbling, put the lid on and immediately turn the stove down to low (or medium low, if your stove is weak/small). (Note 5), Cook 15 minutes ‚Äì Cook the rice for 15 minutes. No stirring, don't lift the lid., Rest 10 minutes ‚Äì Tilt the saucepan and have a quick peek to ensure all the water is absorbed. Then remove off the stove, with the lid still on, and rest for 10 minutes., Fluff rice, then fluff through remaining butter until melted. Toss through parsley, then tumble into serving dish. Sprinkle with extra parsley then serve!

TITLE: Panang Curry ‚Äì real, from scratch
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 700g/ 1.4 lb whole raw prawns/shrimp, 350g / 12 oz boneless, skinless chicken thighs
1 1/2 chicken stock/broth

2/3 dried Chinese chillies (not Thai!), 3 roasted peanuts unsalted, 2 lemongrass stems, 2 eschalots, 1 galangal, finely grated, 5 garlic cloves, 1 1/2 shrimp paste in bean oil, 1/2 each ground coriander, cumin, nutmeg, 1 finely sliced kaffir lime leaves
3 canola oil, 1 1/4 coconut cream, 3 1/2 white sugar, 4 1/2 fish sauce, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 200g/7oz green beans, 12 Thai basil leaves
Jasmin rice, 2 unsalted peanuts, Red cayenne peppers, Thai basil leaves
INSTRUCTIONS: Simmer ‚Äì Peel and devein prawns, reserving heads and shells. Bring chicken stock to a simmer in a small pot on high heat. Add prawn heads & shells, bring back to a simmer, then reduce to low heat. Simmer uncovered for 15 minutes, periodically crushing the heads lightly with a potato masher and skimming off any orange scum., Strain into a jug, discarding heads. You should have just over 300 ml (1 1/4 cups) of stock. Leave undisturbed to let the sediment settle (~ 5min+).

Cut chillies in half then tap / squeeze out seeds (use a chopstick if needed for stubborn seeds). Discard seeds (spicy!). Chop chilli., Soak dried chillis in 2 cups of boiling water for 30 minutes. Drain in a colander, reserve soaking liquid., Peanuts ‚Äì Put peanuts in a tall jar that comfortably fits the head of a stick blender (or use a small blender). Cover the jar opening with your hand and pulse until finely ground., Blitz paste ‚Äì Add drained chillis and remaining Curry Paste ingredients, along with 1/4 cup of the reserved chilli soaking liquid. Blend, scraping down the sides as you go, for about 30 seconds until smooth, using extra chilli water only if needed to help blend.

Cook curry paste ‚Äì Heat oil in a large deep frying pan over medium-low heat. Cook curry paste for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. The paste should be drier, darker, smelling aromatic and no longer raw., Sauce ‚Äì Add 1 cup (250 ml) prawn stock, being careful to pour off just the clearer liquid and leaving the sediment behind. Stir in the coconut cream, sugar, fish sauce and salt. Mix in the green beans., Simmer for 2 minutes until the sauce thickens and the beans are half cooked., Add prawns, stir, then simmer for another 2 minutes until the prawns are cooked. Stir in the Thai basil leaves. The final taste should lean mostly savoury and sweet, and medium spiciness., Serve over jasmine rice garnished with chopped peanuts, chilli and more Thai basil leaves!

TITLE: Cobb Salad
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 400g/14 oz chicken breast (2 pieces), 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
200g/7oz streaky bacon strips, 4 boiled eggs, 12 cos / romaine lettuce, 2 large tomatoes, 2 avocados, 200g/7oz gorgonzola dolce (my favourite) or roquefort (traditional),, 2 chives
1 dijon mustard, 5 extra virgin olive oil, 5 apple cider vinegar, 3/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 2 eschallot, 1/2 white sugar
INSTRUCTIONS: Dressing: Shake ingredients in a jar., Flavour chicken: Poach chicken using this method (20 minute foolproof-guaranteed-juicy). Cool to room temperature then cut into 2cm / 0.75‚Äù cubes. Toss with salt, pepper and 2 tablespoons of Dressing. Set aside., Crisp bacon: Place bacon strips in a non-stick pan (not heated, no oil). Turn heat onto medium high ‚Äì as the pan heats up, the fat will begin to melt. Cook for 2 minutes until golden, turn and cook the other side for 1 1/2 minutes until golden. Drain on paper towels. Once cool and crisp, chop into 1.5cm / 0.6" pieces., Assemble: Spread lettuce on a large platter. Arrange the ingredients on top in the Cobb Salad signature neat rows: egg, bacon, avocado, tomato and chicken. Crumble blue cheese across the top, sprinkle with chives. Pour dressing into a jug., Serving: Let everybody help themselves to the salad and Dressing!

TITLE: Crispy Lebanese Meat Stuffed Pita ‚Äì Arayes
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 5 pita bread, Olive oil spray

1/2 brown onion, 500g/ 1 lb lamb or beef mince, 2 garlic cloves, 1 finely chopped parsley, 3 ground coriander, 3 ground cumin, 1 1/2 smoked paprika, 3/4 ground allspice, 1/2 cayenne pepper, 1 1/4 cooking/kosher salt
1 plain yogurt, 2 tahini, 1 lemon juice, 1 garlic clove, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Grate the onion in a bowl using a standard box grater. We want the juices and all! (Note 4), Meat filling ‚Äì Add remaining meat filling ingredients. Mix well with your hands., Divide stuffing in 10 (about 55 to 60g per portion, 1/4 cup). Flatten into a semi-circle shape slightly smaller than the pita bread half., Stuff ‚Äì Gently open a pita then place the meat inside. Close, then press to spread to the edge and make it fairly evenly flat. (Is your pita tearing? See Note 5 for tip!)

Preheat oven to 50C/120F. Place a rack on a tray. (To keep cooked Arayes warm.), Cook ‚Äì Heat a large frying pan over medium high heat. Spray both sides of the pita with olive oil then place 2 or 3 pieces in the pan (whatever you can fit). Cook for about 2 minutes on each side, pressing down lightly with a spatula, until golden and crispy. The meat is spread so thin it cooks really quickly! {Sandwich press ‚Äì Note 7}, Keep warm ‚Äì Transfer cooked Arayes onto the rack and put in the oven to keep warm. Cook remaining pita., Serve ‚Äì Cut in half if desired (sometimes I do, sometimes I don't!). Pile Arayes onto a serving platter. Serve with Whipped Tahini sauce. Enjoy!
Place ingredients in a heatproof bowl and whisk to combine. Microwave for 15 seconds on high. Whisk again ‚Äì it should resemble soft whipped cream. Use slightly warm or at room temperature.

TITLE: My best Grilled Cheese Sandwich
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 sourdough bread, 30g/ 2 tbsp SALTED butter, 1/3 vintage cheddar cheese or gruyere,, 30g/ 1/3 cup mozzarella,
INSTRUCTIONS: Butter bread ‚Äì Slather both sides of each piece of bread with the butter (yes, all 4 sides!)., Light toast ‚Äì Heat a heavy-based skillet or frying pan over medium low heat (no oil or butter). Place both pieces of bread in the skillet and lightly toast for 1 minute to warm it through and create a light crust. (When we flip, this gives the cheese a head start)., Pile on cheese ‚Äì Flip one slice of bread, then pile on the cheddar cheese followed by the mozzarella. Place the other slice of bread on top, with the hot toasted side in contact with the cheese., Cook 3 minutes ‚Äì Cook for 3 minutes or until the bread is evenly golden and crisp, pressing down lightly with a spatula every now and then. If it's browning too quickly, remove remove from the stove to cool down a bit and lower heat., Flip, 3 minutes ‚Äì Turn the sandwich over, and cook the other side for 3 minutes or until the bread is golden and the cheese is melted., Devour ‚Äì Transfer to cutting board. Cut in half in one swift motion. Admire cheese pull. Devour.

TITLE: Japchae ‚Äì Korean Noodles
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 600g/1.2lb bone-in beef short ribs *RECOMMENDED*, 300g/10 oz boneless beef short ribs *RECOMMENDED*, 300g/10oz scotch fillet / boneless rib eye
2 soy sauce, 2 white sugar, 2 finely minced garlic, 1/2 black pepper
1/4 soy sauce, 2 white sugar, 1/2 finely minced garlic, 1 1/2 sesame oil, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper

250g/ 8oz sweet potato noodles, 4 vegetable oil, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 1 onion, 3 green onion stems, 200g/7oz fresh shiitake mushrooms, 2 carrots, 1 red capsicum/bell pepper, 4 1/2 baby spinach, 2 white sesame seeds
INSTRUCTIONS: Cut beef into strips that are ~ 5mm thick, 1cm wide and about 5cm long (1/5" x 2/5" x 2"). If using shortribs, trim excess fat, cut the meat off the bone. Then cut each piece in half lengthwise (to form 2 "steaks") then slice into 5mm thick. (See step photos in post or video at 0.11s, Note 6), Marinate ‚Äì Put beef in a bowl. Add marinade ingredients, then mix. Set aside marinate while you proceed with recipe, ~15 ‚Äì 20 minutes is all it needs. (Note 5)

Sauce ‚Äì Mix the Sauce ingredients in a very large mixing bowl., Noodles ‚Äì Cook sweet potato noodles per packet directions (normally 8 min in boiling water). Drain, briefly rinse under tap water then shake off excess water well. Add noodles into the bowl with the dressing. DO NOT MIX.

Batch 1 ‚Äì Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large non-stick pan (30cm/12") over high heat. Cook the brown onion, white part of green onion and shiitake mushrooms with 1/2 tsp salt for 2 1/2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly, just until starting to soften but not going golden. Pour on top of the noodles ‚Äì don't mix yet!, Batch 2 ‚Äì Using the same pan still on high heat, heat 1 tbsp oil then cook the carrot and capsicum for 1 1/2 minutes, constantly stirring. Add spinach, green onion and the final 1/2 tsp salt. Keep cooking for 1 1/2 minutes until the spinach is wilted. Transfer into the noodle bowl ‚Äì still don't mix!, Cook beef ‚Äì In the same pan, heat the final 1 tbsp of oil still on high heat. Add beef and cook for 1 1/2 minutes until very lightly golden and just cooked through. Add to the noodle bowl. Don't mix!, Mix! Add most of the sesame seeds (reserve some for topping). NOW you can mix! Toss, toss, toss., Serve ‚Äì Transfer into a serving bowl, sprinkle with remaining sesame seeds. This is meant to be eaten warm, not piping hot. Eat!

TITLE: Golden Gaytime Popcorn ‚Äì copycat recipe!
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 1/4 vegetable oil, 1/2 popping corn
100g / 7 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 brown sugar, 1/2 light corn syrup, 1/2 cooking/ kosher salt, 2 toffee or caramel essence OR 1 tsp vanilla, 1/2 baking soda (bi-carb)
1 1/4 dark or white chocolate melts or chips, 4 plain sweet biscuits
INSTRUCTIONS: Test oil ‚Äì Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add a few pieces of popcorn and wait until it pops, then quickly remove., Pop ‚Äì Add remaining popcorn, elevate off stove to shake and spread corn out evenly. Cover with a lid. Once the popcorn starts popping in earnest, shake the pot gently once. Then crack the lid a tiny bit ‚Äì let's steam escape for crisper popcorn., Remove from heat when the popping stops (when you can count to 3 between pops) and transfer to a (very!) large bowl.

Preheat oven to 110¬∞C/230¬∞F (both fan and standard ovens)., Combine ‚Äì Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar, corn syrup and salt. Stir until just combined., Simmer ‚Äì When it starts to bubble, simmer for 4 minutes ‚Äì DO NOT STIR!, Baking soda "foamy" ‚Äì Remove from heat then quickly whisk in caramel (toffee or vanilla) and baking soda. When you stop whisking, the caramel will foam and increase in volume., Coat popcorn ‚Äì Quickly pour straight over popcorn, toss until caramel cools and starts to harden.

Spread popcorn on 2 large paper lined baking trays., Bake for 45 minutes, tossing every 10 minutes or so. Caramel will remelt for the first 2-3 tosses ‚Äì tossing coats popcorn more evenly with caramel. (If using glucose, bake further 15 minutes)., Cool ‚Äì Remove from oven, leave to cool on the tray for 20 minutes. Then break up the popcorn ‚Äì no need to be too pedantic, clumps are great!

Crumbs ‚Äì Place biscuits in a ziplock bag and bash into crumbs., Melt chocolate ‚Äì Place chocolate in a heatproof bowl and microwave in 30 second increments on high, stirring in between, until melted and smooth ‚Äì about 1 1/2 minutes. (If doing a small amount of white chocolate, reduce to 20 second increments)., Piping bags ‚Äì Transfer chocolate into a piping bag. Use scissors to snip a small opening at the tip. (Alternative: just drizzle with a spoon)., Drizzle & crumb ‚Äì Push the popcorn together but in a single layer. Drizzle criss-cross (or any pattern!) all over the popcorn. Sprinkle with biscuits crumbs while the chocolate is wet so it sticks., Fridge ‚Äì Refrigerate for 15 minutes until the chocolate is firm. Gently break popcorn into pieces. EAT!, Store in an airtight container in a cool place. Stays crisp for at least a week. Our test batches never lasted any longer!

TITLE: Bursty Tomato Burrata Salad
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 200g/ 6 oz fresh burrata cheese, 1/4 basil pesto
500g/ 1 lb (4 cups) cherry or grape tomatoes, 2 extra virgin olive oil, 2 eschalot, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 2 sherry vinegar
1/2 salt flakes, 1 extra virgin olive oil, Few fresh basil leaves, Warmed crusty bread
INSTRUCTIONS: De-chill ‚Äì Take the burrata out of the fridge and leave on the counter for 30 minutes, to take the fridge-chill out of it. Keep it in the water in the tub.

Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan)., Roast 10 min ‚Äì Toss the cherry tomatoes with the olive oil, eschalot, salt and pepper (in a bowl, or on a tray). Spread on a tray. Roast 10 minutes until softened but not collapsing., Vinegar ‚Äì Gently push the tomatoes to one end of the tray. Drizzle over vinegar. No need to mix.

Tomatoes ‚Äì Carefully transfer tomatoes to a plate, spreading them out in a single layer., Burrata ‚Äì Gently (GENTLY!!) drain the water out of the tub and roll the burrata out into your hand. Place a burrata on top of tomatoes., Finish ‚Äì Drizzle the 1 tablespoon of good extra virgin olive oil all over the plate. Dollop pesto randomly all over. Sprinkle with salt flakes and basil., Serve with crusty bread on the side!, Eating!, Nominate a person to do the cutting honours. Break into the burrata with a serving spoon. Let the centre ooze out. Make sure you scoop up a bit of everything, pile onto bread and eat! Don't forget to mop the plate clean. The juices are the best part.

TITLE: Sizzling ginger steamed fish
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 thinnish white fish fillet, 1 cooking sake, Small pinch salt, Small pinch white pepper
1/2 green onion, 2 ginger, 1 large red chilli
2 light soy sauce, 2 sesame oil, 2 peanut oil
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan)., Prepare parcel ‚Äì Place a 2 x 25cm / 10" piece of foil on a work surface. Top with a piece of parchment/baking paper slightly smaller. Place fish on paper., Season fish & wrap ‚Äì Sprinkle each side of the fish with a SMALL pinch of salt and pepper. Drizzle the top of each fish with 1/2 tsp sake. Form a parcel ‚Äì make a parcel with the paper first, then the foil. (See video or step photos)., Bake ‚Äì Place parcels on a tray. Bake for 12 minutes or until the internal temperature is 55¬∞C/130¬∞F (I pierce thermometer through foil) or the fish flesh flakes (open to check). Thin fish cooks fast when enclosed!, Rest 3 min ‚Äì Put each parcel on a plate and unwrap, folding down the sides to create a ‚Äúboat‚Äù that will catch the sauce that you can squidge the fish in. Rest for 3 minutes ‚Äì heat the oil while it rests., Heat oil until hot in a tiny saucepan or small pan over medium heat., Sizzle! Top the fish with green onion, ginger and chilli. Drizzle with soy and sesame oil. Pour oil all over the green onion and ginger ‚Äì it will sizzle dramatically!, Serve immediately. Eat fish out of foil, squidging the flaky pieces well in the sauce before eating. See post for what I served it with!

TITLE: Hot Chocolate Fudge Cake
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 plain/all-purpose flour, 1/3 cocoa powder, 3/4 baking powder, 3/4 baking soda/bi-carb, 1 caster/superfine sugar, 1/4 salt
1 large egg, 1/2 milk, 75g / 5 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 oil, 1 vanilla extract, 1/2 boiling water
1 thickened / heavy cream, or pure cream, 1 1/4 dark chocolate melts or chips
Vanilla ice cream
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan). Grease a 20cm/8" cake pan with butter then line with paper., Whisk Dry ingredients in a large bowl., Add Wet ‚Äì Then add all the Wet ingredients EXCEPT the boiling water. Whisk until combined. Then add the boiling water and whisk until smooth. The batter will be pretty thin., Bake 40 min ‚Äì Pour into the pan. Bake for 40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out mostly clean ‚Äì a faint smear of batter isn't a bad thing, we're making a fudge cake here!, Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Invert onto a plate, then onto a cooling rack or plate right side up. Cool for a further 10 minutes ‚Äì the cake will still be warm for serving., Serving ‚Äì Cut slices of the warm cake. Top with a scoop of ice cream. Douse with fudge sauce ‚Äì just shy of 1/4 cup per slice (10 slices). Eat and swoon!

Heat cream until hot, just before boiling point, using your method of choice ‚Äì saucepan or microwave., Stand 5 min ‚Äì Put chocolate in bowl. Pour over hot cream. Ensure all chocolate is submerged, then cover with a plate. Leave for 5 minutes., Mix ‚Äì Using a whisk or rubber spatula, mix vigorously until the cream and chocolate combine into a silky chocolate sauce., Cool to thicken for 20 minutes. Give it a stir then pour into a jug for serving!

TITLE: Balsamic marinated mushrooms
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 700g/ 1.4 lb small whole white mushrooms, 3 extra virgin olive oil, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 5 sprigs fresh thyme, 2 garlic cloves, 2 garlic cloves
4 balsamic vinegar, 3 extra virgin olive oil
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/375¬∞F (180¬∞C fan)., Season ‚Äì Put mushrooms into a roasting pan (not tray, easier to mix well in pan). They can be snug but should be in a single layer (mushrooms shrink ~25-30%). Toss with olive oil first. Then add salt, pepper, thyme and garlic (minced & whole), then toss again., Roast 35 minutes, tossing well at the 20 minute mark, or until the mushrooms are browned and soft., Marinade ‚Äì While hot, transfer mushrooms into a bowl (including all the juices). Add balsamic and olive oil. Toss well., Marinate 2 to 24 hrs ‚Äì Let the mushrooms cool and marinate for 2 hours (uncovered), tossing once or twice, or for even better flavour, marinate overnight (covered in fridge once cool)., Serving ‚Äì Always serve at room temperature or slightly warmed, for best flavour. And don't waste the juices ‚Äì it's full of flavour!, Serving options ‚Äì As part of a grazing board, on polenta or mash as a meal, on toast slathered with goats cheese or cream cheese, on the side of fried eggs, on creamy risotto or risoni/orzo. See in post for a long list!

TITLE: Creamy Tuscan Chicken Soup
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 500 g/1 lb chicken thighs, 1/2 each salt and pepper

30g / 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 onion, 2 garlic cloves, 2 large celery stems, 1/2 chardonnay, 4 chicken stock/broth, 3 water, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 250g/8 oz small pasta shells, 1 parmesan,, 1 thickened/heavy cream, 2 baby spinach, 1/2 sun dried tomato strips
2 cornflour/cornstarch mixed with 2 tsp water
INSTRUCTIONS: Cook outside of chicken ‚Äì Sprinkle each side with the salt and pepper. Melt butter in a large pot over medium high heat. Once foamy, place the chicken in and cook the first side for 3 minutes or until light golden, then the other side for 2 minutes ‚Äì it's fine if the inside is still raw, it cooks more later. Remove onto a plate., Soup flavour base ‚Äì Turn the stove down to medium low. Add garlic, onion and celery into the same pot then cook for 3 minutes or until the onion is softened., Deglaze ‚Äì Turn up to high, add wine, stir, then let it simmer until the wine reduces by half., Broth & pasta ‚Äì Add stock/broth, water, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil then add the pasta. Cook for the time per the pasta packet directions (~10 minutes), stirring every now and then so the pasta doesn't stick to the base of the pot., Add chicken partway ‚Äì While the pasta is cooking, chop the chicken into 1.5cm / 1/2" pieces then add into the pot to finish cooking., Finish soup ‚Äì Once the pasta is cooked, turn heat down to low. Stir in parmesan until melted. Stir in the cornflour-water mixture, cream and spinach. Stir for a minute until spinach is wilted and soup thickens slightly., Serve ‚Äì Ladle into bowls. Sprinkle with sun dried tomato strips (and a bit of oil looks nice for finishing). Eat!, Storing ‚Äì Separate pasta from soup so it doesn't bloat, refrigerate both. Just scoop out with slotted spoon. (Note 6)

TITLE: Apple and rhubarb crumble
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 500g/ 4 1/2 cups rhubarb stems, 1/3 white sugar, 3 Granny Smith apples (~600g/1.2lb whole), Zest of 1 orange
1 rolled oats, 1 flour, 3/4 brown sugar, 1/2 baking powder, 1/2 cinnamon powder, 90g/ 6 tbsp unsalted butter, of salt
Vanilla ice cream
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/375¬∞F (180¬∞C fan)., Filling: Place rhubarb, apple, sugar and orange zest in a large mixing bowl and toss well. Spread evenly in a 30 x 20cm baking dish (12 x 8") (Note 3), Crumble topping: Place topping ingredients in a bowl and mix with a wooden spoon until all the flour is incorporated (use cutting motion/ smearing up wall, as needed). It will be a sandy mixture., Scrunch & top: Grab handfuls of crumble and enclose your fist to press into lumps. Break into clumps and scatter over the filling. (Note 4 explains this unusual step!)., Bake for 35 minutes or until rhubarb is soft and the crumble is golden brown. (Bake time ‚Äì Note 5), Rest & serve: Remove from the oven, rest for 5 minutes. Scoop into bowls and serve with vanilla ice cream or custard!

TITLE: Italian Orzo Salad (Risoni) with Crispy Salami Bits
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 250g / 8oz risoni / orzo pasta, 2 salt, 2 extra virgin olive oil
250g/ 8 oz salami slices, 1 sliced kalamata olives, 2 baby rocket / arugula, 400g/ 14oz cherry tomatoes, 1 large green capsicum, 1/2 red onion, 1 1/2 colby cheese
1/3 extra virgin olive oil, 3 red wine vinegar, 1 garlic clove, 1 dried basil, 1/4 red chilli flakes, 1 dried oregano, 1/2 sugar, 1 cooking/kosher salt
INSTRUCTIONS: Cook pasta ‚Äì Bring a large pot of water to the boil. Add salt and risoni/orzo, then cook per packet directions (usually ~10 minutes). Drain in colander, rinse, shake off excess water well. Transfer to large bowl. Toss with the olive oil then let cool., Dressing ‚Äì Shake in a jar., Crispy salami ‚Äì Put salami in cold large non-stick pan, with no oil. Turn onto medium high ‚Äì as the pan heats up, the fat will melt so it cooks in its own fat. Cook for 3 ‚Äì 5 minutes, stirring regularly, until light golden. Drain on paper towels. It will crisp as it cools., Toss ‚Äì Set aside 1/3 of the salami for topping. Put all remaining salad ingredients in with the risoni. Toss. Pour over dressing. Toss, toss, toss!, Serve! Tumble into serving bowl. Sprinkle with remaining salami. Divide between bowls. Eat with spoon! Best eaten at room temp, not fridge cold (can taste flavours better).

TITLE: Beef Chow Mein ‚Äì great beef mince noodle recipe!
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 200g/ 7 oz chow mein noodles, 1 1/2 canola oil, 2 garlic cloves, 200g/ 7 oz beef mince / ground beef, 3 green onion stems, 1 egg, 2 green cabbage, 1 carrot, 1 heaped cups bean sprouts
1 1/2 light soy sauce, 1 1/2 dark soy sauce, 1 1/2 oyster sauce, 1 1/2 Chinese cooking wine, 1 1/2 white sugar, white pepper
1 1/2 cornflour / cornstarch, 3 water
INSTRUCTIONS: Sauce ‚Äì Mix ingredients in a small bowl then set aside. Some is used to flavour the beef, then the rest for the noodles., Sauce thickener (cornflour slurry) ‚Äì Mix the cornflour / cornstarch and water in a separate small bowl., Prepare noodles per packet directions then drain., Cook beef ‚Äì Heat the oil in a large non-stick pan over high heat. Cook garlic for 10 seconds, then add the beef and cook until you can no longer see pink. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of the Sauce and the white part of the green onions. Cook for another 2 minutes to get the beef nicely caramelised., Finish sauce ‚Äì Mix the cornflour slurry into the remaining sauce., Egg ‚Äì Add the egg into the pan then mix it through the beef, it will sort of scramble. Egg makes the beef stick to the noodles better!, Cabbage & carrot ‚Äì When the egg is mostly cooked, add the carrot and cabbage. Cook for 1 minute until cabbage starts to wilt., Sauce & noodles ‚Äì Give the sauce a quick mix. Add the bean sprouts, noodles and sauce into the pan. Toss well for 1 minute or until sauce is dispersed through the noodles. Add green part of green onions. Toss for another 1 minute., Serve ‚Äì Divide between bowls and serve!

TITLE: Crispy rice with spicy tuna (Nobu copycat)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 crispy rice cakes, ONE topping of choice (below) ‚Äì Nobu sashimi tuna or canned tuna, 1 avocado, 15 jalape√±o slices, 1/2 black sesame seeds
225g / 7oz sashimi grade tuna, 1 sriracha, 4 kewpie mayonnaise, 1 sesame oil, 1/4 cooking salt, 2 finely chopped green onion, 1 white sesame seeds, 1/2 black sesame seeds
360g/12oz canned tuna in oil, 3 sriracha, 4 kewpie mayonnaise, 1 lemon juice, 1 sesame oil, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 finely chopped green onion, 2 white sesame seeds, 1 1/2 black sesame seeds
INSTRUCTIONS: Start the rice the day before or first thing in the morning ‚Äì it needs minimum 4 hours to chill., Make the toppings first, then refrigerate while you cook the crispy rice cakes., Cook the crispy rice cakes and sprinkle with salt per the recipe., Assemble ‚Äì Place rice cakes on a serving platter. Pile on toppings ‚Äì I use teaspoons to make football shapes then slide on. Sprinkle with black sesame seeds, top with jalape√±o. Eat!

Freeze to firm ‚Äì Place tuna in the freezer for 30 minutes to partially freeze ‚Äì it's much easier to finely chop when slightly firm., Cut into 0.5cm / 1/2" cubes ‚Äì the smaller the better! Place into a bowl and let it de-chill for 20 minutes (not as nice ice-cold)., Mix ‚Äì Add everything into the tuna and mix until combined.
Place tuna in a bowl and use a fork to mash it up really finely. Add everything else and mix well.

TITLE: Crispy rice
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 sushi rice, 1 1/2 water, 1/3 canola oil, 3/4 cooking / kosher salt
1 rice vinegar, 1 caster sugar
INSTRUCTIONS: Cook rice, rest, pour over seasoning, fluff. Press firmly into 20cm/8" lined pan, weigh down. Cool, fridge overnight (min 6 hrs). Cut into 15 rectangles, pan fry 4 min each side, sprinkle with salt.

Sushi seasoning ‚Äì Mix together until sugar dissolves., Cook rice (Note 4) ‚Äì Place rice and water in a small pot (no lid) over medium high heat. Once it's bubbling on the edges and the middle is rippling, put the lid on and turn down to medium low (or low for strong stoves). Cook for 13 minutes or until water is absorbed., Rest ‚Äì Remove from heat then rest for 10 minutes with the lid still on., Season ‚Äì Remove lid. Pour over sushi seasoning. Fluff rice with rubber spatula.

Press ‚Äì Place a sheet of baking/parchment paper on a 20cm/8" square pan. Scrape hot rice into the pan and spread evenly. Cover with another piece of paper and press in very firmly., Weigh down (recommended, Note 5) ‚Äì For best results, place something flat on top (2nd same size pan is ideal) then weigh down with 5 x 400g/14oz cans., Cool ‚Äì Fully cool, cover with cling wrap, then refrigerate overnight (min 6 hours). Speedy option: Fridge uncovered until fully cool, cover, freeze 1 hour, fridge 1 hour., Cut ‚Äì Lift rice out using paper overhang. Wet the knife blade (neater cuts). Cut rice into 15 rectangles (5 strips, then each into 3).

Pan fry ‚Äì Heat about 1/4 cup of the oil in a large non-stick pan over medium high. Place in half the rice cakes ‚Äì they should sizzle gently. Lower heat to medium. Cook for 4 minutes until really golden and crispy. Turn and cook the other side for 4 minutes., Salt ‚Äì Remove onto a paper towels lined plate. Sprinkle each side with salt while hot., Keep cooking ‚Äì Add remaining oil and cook remaining rice cakes.
Serve as snack (you won't be able to stop!) or a base for canap√©s., Topping suggestions ‚Äì Spicy tuna (Nobu copycat), tuna poke, salmon mousse, crostini toppings.

TITLE: Herb & Garlic Butter Chicken Marylands (chicken leg quarters)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 pieces (~1.5 kg/3 lb) chicken marylands (US: leg quarters), 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1/3 chardonnay or other dry white wine
100g/7 tbsp unsalted butter, 4 garlic cloves, 2 fresh rosemary leaves, 2 thyme leaves, 3/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 220¬∞C/425¬∞F (200¬∞C fan)., Mix Herb & Garlic Butter ingredients until combined., Butter chicken ‚Äì Use an upside down tablespoon to loosen the chicken skin from the flesh on the thigh and most of the leg (Note 4). Smear 80% of the butter under the skin, just a small amount (~5%) on the underside (flesh side) then the remainder on top of the skin. (The flesh side gets lots of flavour from the pan juices)., Put chicken in roasting pan, skin side up. Sprinkle skin with the 1/2 tsp salt. Pour wine around chicken., Roast 50 minutes ‚Äì Roast 10 minutes to get the skin going. Then reduce the heat to 200¬∞C /400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan) and roast for a further 40 minutes, basting every 10 minutes from the 20 minute mark onwards., Rest & serve ‚Äì Remove from oven. Rest 10 minutes then serve with the garlic-herb-butter pan juices as the sauce!

TITLE: The best Potato Salad
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 1 kg / 2 lb potatoes, 2 cooking / kosher salt, 250g / 8oz streaky bacon, 1/2 French Dressing, 3/4 cucumber, finely diced, 1 celery, finely sliced diagonally, 1/4 white onion, finely minced
1/3 mayonnaise, 1/3 sour cream, 1 horseradish cream, 1/2 cooking / kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
1 dijon mustard, 2 white wine vinegar, 1/4 extra virgin olive oil, 1 water, 1/2 white sugar, 1/2 garlic clove, 1/2 salt, 1/4 black pepper
INSTRUCTIONS: French Dressing ‚Äì Shake ingredients in a jar until well combined., Cook potatoes (CAREFUL! Note 5) ‚Äì Put potatoes and 2 teaspoon salt in a large pot of cold water. Turn the stove on. Once the water is simmering, cook for 4 minutes or until the potatoes are JUST cooked (still bit firm in the middle) ‚Äì they will keep cooking with residual heat. Drain immediately (gently!)., Douse hot potatoes! Carefully transfer potatoes into a large bowl and pour over French Dressing. Gently toss to coat then set aside for 2 hours so potatoes absorb the dressing and cool (less fragile)., Crispy bacon ‚Äì Lay half the bacon in a cold non-stick pan. Turn onto medium high and cook until golden (the fat will melt as the pan warms up so it cooks in its own fat). Turn and cook the other side until golden. Drain paper towels, repeat with remaining bacon. Once cool and crisp, chop into small pieces., Creamy Dressing ‚Äì Mix ingredients in a bowl until combined., Toss ‚Äì Add creamy dressing, celery, cucumber, onion, and most of the bacon. Toss gently to combine., Serving ‚Äì Serve garnished with remaining bacon. If time permits, I recommend setting aside for a few hours, or even better, overnight, to give the flavours a chance to meld. But still amazing served straight away!¬†Always serve at room temperature, not fridge cold.

TITLE: Affogato
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 large or 2 small(ish) vanilla gelato or ice cream, 1 shot hot espresso coffee, 1 frangelico, amaretto or other liquor
INSTRUCTIONS: Put ice cream in glass suitable for affogato eating (Note 4)., Place shot of espresso and liquor (if using) on the side., Pour the hot espresso then liquor over the ice cream. Enjoy swirls of melty ice cream blending into the coffee. Dig in immediately!

TITLE: Goulash (Hungarian beef stew)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 kg/2 lb beef chuck, 1 3/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1 black pepper, 1 extra virgin olive oil, 2 tbsp/ 30g unsalted butter, 2 brown onions, 5 garlic cloves, 2 capsicum/bell peppers, 2 tomatoes, 1/4 Hungarian-style paprika, 1 caraway seeds, 1 bay leaf, 1 litre / 4 cups beef stock/broth, 2 carrots, 2 potatoes, 1 finely chopped parsley
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan), though you can use your slow cooker or stove instead (oven easiest! Note 4)., Season beef ‚Äì Toss the beef with half the salt and pepper., Cook onion ‚Äì Heat the oil and melt the butter in a large oven-proof dutch oven over high heat. Cook onion for 6 minutes until the edges are light golden., Cook beef ‚Äì Add the beef and stir until the outside changes from red to brown, about 2 minutes. It won't go golden brown, it's not supposed to., Add vegetables ‚Äì Add garlic, capsicum and tomato. Stir for 3 minutes ‚Äì the tomato will mostly breakdown., Add paprika, caraway and bay leaf. Stir for 30 seconds., Slow cook ‚Äì Add beef stock, stir, bring to simmer. Cover with a lid and transfer to the oven for 1 1/2 hours., Add potato ‚Äì The beef should be pretty tender but not quite "fall-apart". Stir in carrot and potatoes. Return to oven, covered, for another 30 minutes. Beef should now be "fall-apart" ‚Äì if not, return to the oven for 10 minutes at a time., Serve ‚Äì Ladle goulash into bowls and sprinkle with parsley. Eat as is, with optional bread for dunking! (Pictured with cheese bread)

TITLE: Spicy Asian Cucumber Salad
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 cucumbers, 3/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1 eschalot/French onion, 1 green onion, 2 chilli crisp, 2 white seame seeds
1 1/2 rice vinegar, 2 soy sauce, 2 sesame oil
INSTRUCTIONS: Smash ‚Äì Hit cucumbers with a meat mallet, rolling pin or similar to make the sides burst open. Cut in half lengthwise then into 2.5cm/1" pieces., Salt 30 min ‚Äì Place in a bowl, toss with salt. Set aside for 30 minutes to draw out water (Note 5). Drain/strain and discard salty water, leave cucumbers in same bowl.

Whisk Dressing in a bowl., CHECK spiciness of your chilli crisp ‚Äì they vary by brand. If using Laoganma, stick with recipe, else adjust to taste., Toss ‚Äì Put green onion, eschalots, sesame seeds, dressing and chilli crisp in with the cucumbers. Toss until eschalots go floppy ‚Äì ~30 seconds., Serve, sprinkled with extra sesame seeds and dollops of chilli crisp if you dare!, Note: Water continues to come out of cucumbers so after few hours/next day, you'll have a lot more dressing but not as intense flavoured. So eat/serve with spoon to get plenty of dressing in every bite!

TITLE: Cheese bread (no knead!)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 3 bread flour, 2 instant yeast, 1 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1 1/2 very warm tap water, 2 1/2 Colby cheese
INSTRUCTIONS: Mix dry ingredients, mix in water. Rise 2 ‚Äì 3 hrs until doubled., Preheat pot 240¬∞C/450¬∞F (220¬∞C fan). Turn dough out. Reserve 1/3 cheese for topping. Fold inwards 4 times, stuffed/layered with remaining cheese. Flip onto parchment paper. Pile reserved cheese on top., Bake 35 minutes covered, 10 minutes uncovered. Rest 10 minutes. Eat!

Shaggy dough ‚Äì Using a rubber spatula, mix flour, salt and yeast in a large bowl. Add water, then mix using the handle of the spatula until you can no longer see flour. The dough should be too sticky to knead by hand, but not pourable like cake batter (see video at X seconds)., Rise ‚Äì Cover with cling wrap and leave to rise in a warm place for 2 to 3 hours until the dough doubles in volume (Note 5). The surface should be bubbly, and the mixture should jiggle when you shake the bowl., Preheat pot ‚Äì Half an hour before the dough is ready, put a 24-28cm / 4.5-8 quart heavy based pot with a lid in the oven to preheat to 240¬∞C/450¬∞F (220¬∞C fan-forced). Note 7 for no dutch oven method.

Pat into disc ‚Äì Sprinkle work surface with 1 tbsp flour. Scrape dough out, sprinkle surface with flour, pat into a ~20cm/8" disc., Cheese it ‚Äì Set aside 1/3 of the cheese for topping. Cover surface with half the remaining cheese., Fold inwards stuffed with cheese ‚Äì Using a dough scraper or anything of similar shape (cake server, large knife, spatula), fold the sides inwards 4 times to roughly form a roundish shape, topping each layer of with the remaining cheese (but keep the final layer cheese free, it will be the base of the bread). (Note 6 for tips), Paper transfer ‚Äì Flip the dough onto a sheet of parchment/baking paper so the seamside is (mostly) facedown. Tidy the shape if desired. (Note 6), Cheese crown ‚Äì Pile the reserved cheese on.

Hot pot transfer ‚Äì Remove hot pot from the oven. Use paper to transfer dough into the pot, keeping it on the paper. Put lid on., Bake 35 minutes. Remove lid. Bake 10 minutes to colour the surface., Cool ‚Äì Remove pot from oven. Use paper to transfer bread onto a cooling rack. Remove paper. Cool at least 10 minutes before slicing! (Note 8)

TITLE: Corn ribs
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 whole corn cobs, 3 extra virgin olive oil, 2 parsley or coriander/cilantro
1 1/2 garlic powder, 2 1/2 smoked paprika, 2 cooking/kosher salt, 2 black pepper
50g/ 3 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 garlic clove
INSTRUCTIONS: Cut corn ‚Äì Using a sharp knife and a non-slip cutting board, cut off the base and the pointy end of the corn. Stand the corn upright then cut the corn into half then half again to make quarters. My way: Bang the knife with your hand to lock it into the top of the corn, then keep hitting the knife to move it down the corn. Halfway, you might be able to stop banging and just rock the knife down., Easiest method ‚Äì Cut half length ribs. Shorter ribs = easier to cut. See note 2.

BBQ (best!) or oven ‚Äì Heat BBQ on high or oven 200¬∞C/375¬∞F (180¬∞C fan)., Garlic butter ‚Äì Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Then add the garlic and cook for 20 seconds until it smells amazing! Remove from the stove and keep warm/liquid (I usually put it on the side of the BBQ)., Seasoning ‚Äì mix in a small bowl., Season corn ‚Äì Place corn in a large bowl. Toss with olive oil. Then sprinkle the seasoning over gradually, tossing in between, to coat as evenly as possible. Most will get stuck in the cob ‚Äì tasty "bone" sucking!, BBQ ‚Äì Place corn on the BBQ kernel side down. Cook for 8 minutes or until you get charred spots ‚Äì watch it curl into "ribs"! Then cook each cut side for 1 minute., Oven ‚Äì Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, kernel side up. (Note: the corn doesn't curl as much, also, no charred spots)., Butter it ‚Äì Transfer corn back into the bowl. Pour over garlic butter and toss., Serve ‚Äì Pile onto plate, sprinkle with parsley then grab and eat like ribs! Optional pink sauce pictured in notes. Don't forget to suck all the seasoned garlic butter from the cob "bone" ‚Äì it might be the best part. üôÇ

TITLE: Chicken Marsala
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 chicken breasts, 1/2 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 1/4 flour

2 extra virgin olive oil, 2 tbsp / 30g unsalted butter, 2 eschalots, 1 garlic, 2 white mushrooms, 1 dry marsala wine, 1/2 chicken stock/broth, 1/2 thickened / heavy cream, 1/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1/8 black pepper, 1 finely chopped parsley
INSTRUCTIONS: Pound ‚Äì Cut each breast in half to form 2 thin steaks. Cover with a freezer bag or Go-Between (Note 5) and pound to 1 cm / 0.4‚Ä≥ thickness using a meat mallet or rolling pin. This tenderises and ensures even cooking of the chicken., Dust ‚Äì Sprinkle the surface with half the salt, pepper then flour. Lightly rub flour across surface, turn and repeat with remaining salt, pepper and flour. Shake excess flour off each piece just before cooking., Cook ‚Äì Put half the butter and oil in a large non-stick pan over medium high heat. Once the butter is melted and foamy, place chicken in, then cook for 3 to 4 minutes until it's gorgeously golden and crispy. Turn and cook the other side for 2 minutes. Remove onto a plate.

Saut√© aromatics ‚Äì In the same pan, add remaining butter and oil. Once butter is melted, add eschalots and garlic. Cook for 1 minute., Cook mushrooms ‚Äì Add mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring regularly., Reduce marsala ‚Äì Add marsala, turn up heat to high and boil for 3 minutes or until reduced by half., Thicken sauce ‚Äì Add chicken stock, cream, salt and pepper. Stir, then lower heat so it's simmering (not boiling rapidly) and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes until the sauce thickens to a cream consistency (not too thick, will thicken more)., Rewarm chicken ‚Äì Nestle chicken into sauce and leave for 30 seconds to reheat., Serve! Take off the stove. Sprinkle with parsley, serve over starchy vehicle of choice (I chose mash. Rice, small pasta, polenta or bread for plate mopping also work well!).

TITLE: Glazed lemon loaf
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 plain flour / all-purpose flour, 4 baking powder, 1/8 salt
1 plain yogurt, 2 large eggs, 75g / 5 tbsp unsalted butter, 1/4 vegetable or canola oil, 2 lemon zest, 1/4 lemon juice, 1 1/4 caster sugar / superfine sugar, 1/2 vanilla extract, 1 1/2 lemon extract
1 soft icing sugar/powdered sugar, 3 ‚Äì 3 1/2 lemon juice
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to  180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan-forced). Grease then line a 21 x 11 x 7 cm (8.5 x 4.5 x 2.75") with baking / parchment paper. (Note 4), Batter ‚Äì Whisk Dry ingredients in a large bowl. Whisk Wet ingredients in a separate bowl. Pour Wet ingredients into the Dry ingredients. Whisk just until lump free. Pour into the prepared loaf pan then smooth the surface., Bake 45 minutes uncovered. Loosely cover with foil then bake a further 20 minutes or until a skewer inserted comes out clean., Cool & glaze ‚Äì Stand 10 min in pan then turn out onto a cooling rack. Fully cool before glazing (~3 hours). Use a spoon to spread and coax lovely glaze drips down the side! Cut thick slices and serve., Glaze ‚Äì Whisk ingredients until combined and smooth, a thick smooth frosting that will drip thickly, not be transparent. Start with 3 1/2 teaspoons lemon juice, and add 1/2 tsp extra, as needed. (Note 5 on thickness)

TITLE: Easy Moroccan Stuffed Eggplant (beef or lamb)
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 2 eggplants, 3/4 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1 extra virgin olive oil, 1 lemon juice
1 1/2 EACH coriander, paprika, 1 cumin, 3/4 all spice powder, 1/2 EACH garlic powder, ginger, turmeric powder, 1/4 cinnamon, 1/4 cayenne pepper
1 olive oil, 1 garlic clove, 1/2 onion, 250g / 8oz beef or lamb mince, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 2 tomato paste, 1/4 water
Yoghurt, 2 coriander/cilantro leaves, 2 pinenuts
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan)., Sweat eggplants (recommended, see Note 5 to skip) ‚Äì Cut eggplants in half then score with 2.5cm / 1" diamonds. Rub surface with salt, getting some into the slits. Place face down in a colander and set aside for 30 minutes. Gently squeeze like a sponge to remove excess water, pat surface dry., Mix Chermoula spice mix ingredients in a bowl. Remove 3 teaspoons for the meat and set aside. Add olive oil and lemon juice into the remaining spice mix and mix into a paste., Roast eggplant ‚Äì Place eggplant on baking tray. Slather spice mix onto the surface. Roast for 45 minutes until softened., Spiced topping ‚Äì Heat oil in a non stick skillet over medium high heat. Cook onion and garlic for 1 minute. Turn heat up to high, add lamb/beef and cook, breaking it up as you go, until you no longer see red. Add reserved spices and salt, then cook for a further 1 minute. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Stir in water, cook for 1 minute until it's juicy but not watery., Assemble ‚Äì Top eggplant with beef/lamb. Sprinkle over coriander, dollop with yogurt and pine nuts. Finish with an extra drizzle of extra virgin olive oil, if desired!

TITLE: Chili crisp noodles
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 Chinese sesame paste, 2 light soy sauce, 1 rice vinegar, 1 white sugar, 2 sesame oil, 1/8 cooking / kosher salt, 2 chilli crisp (get oil + chili bits), 1 ginger, 1 garlic, 1 green onion stem, 1/3 coriander/cilantro
140g/ 5oz (2 cakes) instant noodles / ramen noodles, 250g/8oz fresh noodles
INSTRUCTIONS: CHECK the spiciness of your chilli crisp ‚Äì taste it!! Laoganma is not actually that spicy (most store bought brands I've used are similar) and the quantity used is based on that brand. If yours is very spicy, start with less and add more later., Base sauce ‚Äì Mix the sesame oil, vinegar, soy, sugar, salt and sesame paste in a bowl. Top with green onion (don‚Äôt mix in)., Sizzling chili crisp ‚Äì Heat chilli crisp and oil in a small pan over medium heat. Add ginger and garlic, stir 30 seconds until golden and it smells amazing. Pour over green onion ‚Äì enjoy the sizzle! Then mix., Toss ‚Äì Cook noodles per packet directions. Drag the noodles straight from the saucepan into the bowl (extra water loosens the sauce). Toss. Use cooking water to loosen more if needed. Toss through coriander/cilantro., Adjust & finish ‚Äì  Taste. Add more salt if needed and more chilli crisp if desired (not all chilli crisp is the same saltiness / spiciness). Eat!

TITLE: Ham and cheese omelette
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 3 large eggs, of salt, 1 cream
1 tbsp/ 15 g unsalted butter, 1/3 chopped ham, 1/3 ‚Äì 1/2 shredded colby cheese
1 stem chive, Garlic butter roasted mushrooms, Roasted cherry tomatoes, Toast
INSTRUCTIONS: Heat control ‚Äì If at any stage your omelette is cooking too fast, remove the pan off the stove to let it cool down and lower the heat., Whisk the eggs, salt and cream in a bowl for 10 seconds until slightly foamy., Warm ham ‚Äì Melt 1/3 of the butter in a 24cm/9.5" non-stick pan (or thereabouts, Note 5) over medium heat until foamy. Swirl/spread to coat the base, then cook ham using a rubber spatula for 90 seconds until warmed through. Remove into bowl., Semi-scramble eggs ‚Äì Melt and swirl remaining butter in the pan. Give the eggs a quick whisk then pour into the pan. Leave for 15 seconds or until the very edges set, then do long leisurely strokes around and across the pan to scrape up cooked egg and let the raw egg run onto the base. Continue for 30 seconds or so until the egg is partially cooked. GOAL: wet enough to spread like jam, but not so wet that the egg runs when you tilt the pan., Spread the egg evenly across the pan (no need to be meticulous). Top half with cheese, then ham. (By this time, the omelette should be almost cooked through but still shiny/custardy on the surface)., Loosen the naked side then fold over using 2 rubber spatulas. Leave in the pan for another 30 seconds to melt the cheese and finish cooking inside., Serve ‚Äì Slide or flip onto a plate and serve! Sprinkle with chives if desired.

TITLE: Antipasto chickpea salad
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 5 oil reserved from sun-dried tomatoes jar, 2 1/2 sherry vinegar, 1 medium garlic clove, 1/4 ground coriander, 1/4 cooking salt/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper

2 cans chickpeas, 3 baby rocket/arugula leaves, 350g/12 oz roasted red pepper strips, 200g/7 oz jar marinated artichoke hearts, 1/2 sliced black kalamata olives, 3/4 sun-dried tomato strips in oil, 250g/8oz cherry tomatoes, 1/3 coriander/cilantro leaves, 200g/7 oz Danish feta (or Greek)
INSTRUCTIONS: Dressing ‚Äì Shake ingredients in a jar to combine., Toss ‚Äì Set aside a bit of coriander/cilantro and feta for garnish. Place all remaining salad ingredients into a big mixing bowl. Pour dressing over salad, and toss gently together to combine well. The feta will get a bit smeary ‚Äì love it!, Serve ‚Äì Transfer to serving dish. Garnish with reserved feta and coriander/cilantro. Dig in!

TITLE: Xinjiang Cumin Lamb Stir Fry
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 500g/ 1 lb boneless lamb leg meat (or rump), 1 soy sauce, 1 Chinese cooking wine, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1 1/4 baking soda, 2 cornflour / cornstarch
2 cumin powder, 1/2 white sugar, 1/2 ground Sichuan pepper
4 vegetable oil, 1/2 dried Chinese chillis, 1 onion, 2 finely minced ginger, 5 garlic, 1/2 coriander/cilantro, 1 toasted sesame seeds
Plain rice
INSTRUCTIONS: Marinade ‚Äì Combine lamb, soy sauce, Chinese cooking wine, salt, baking soda and cornflour in a mixing bowl. Mix well then set aside for marinade for 30 minutes (counter fine)., Spice mix ‚Äì Mix the ingredients in a small bowl., Cook lamb ‚Äì Heat 3 tablespoons of the oil in a large non-stick skillet (30cm/1") over medium-high heat until hot. Add half the lamb and spread out in a single layer. Leave for 30 seconds then, using 2 wooden spoons, toss for a further 1 minute until the lamb is slightly golden. Remove onto a plate then repeat with remaining lamb (you shouldn't need more oil)., Saut√© aromatics ‚Äì Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil. Add the dried chilli, ginger and garlic. Stir for 10 seconds to release flavour, then add the onion. Cook for 2 minutes until the onion just starts to soften., Spiced lamb ‚Äì Add the cooked lamb then sprinkle the spice mix over. Toss well to evenly coat., Finish dish ‚Äì Add the cilantro, sesame seeds and toss. Serve over rice! (Note: the dried chillies are not meant to be eaten.)

TITLE: No-bowl Chocolate Nut Bars
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 100g (7 tbsp) unsalted butter, 1 cup (100g) plain biscuits, crushed, 1 desiccated coconut, 1 unsalted peanuts, 1 dark choc chips, 395g (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180C/350F (160C fan-forced), Line pan ‚Äì Lightly spray a 20cm/8" square pan with oil then press in a sheet of paper (no need to be meticulous here)., Melt butter ‚Äì Place the butter in the pan then melt in the oven for 5 minutes., Biscuit base ‚Äì Swirl pan to spread butter then sprinkle over crushed biscuits. Spread then gently press down (again, I am not meticulous about evenness here)., Layer ‚Äì Scatter over the coconut, followed by about 2/3 of the peanuts and choc chips (reserve some for the top). Pour over condensed milk, spread for even coverage. Top with remaining nuts and chocolate chips., Bake for 30 minutes or until the edge of the surface is golden brown., Fully cool before cutting (3 hours on counter, or 1 hr counter + 1 hr fridge). Remove using paper overhang then cut and eat!

TITLE: Garlic cheese pizza
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 classic pizza dough, 1 fast no-yeast pizza dough, 1 Store bought
2 extra virgin olive oil, 2 garlic, 1/8 cooking salt / kosher salt, 1 mozzarella cheese, 1/2 parmesan
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 250¬∞C / 480¬∞F (230¬∞C fan). Allow time to get it nice and hot!!, Garlic infused oil ‚Äì Mix olive oil and garlic in a small bowl. Set aside to infuse with flavour for 10 minutes., Pizza base ‚Äì Make and roll out chosen pizza base, stretch onto pan., Top ‚Äì Spread oil (and all garlic) onto the base, leaving the crust baked. Sprinkle with salt, parmesan then mozzarella. (If using no-yeast base, spray/brush exposed crust with olive oil.), Bake 8 minutes, turning after 4 minutes, or until the the cheese has golden spots. Cut and eat, stat!

TITLE: Up-and-go breakfast muffins!
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1/3 coconut oil, 1 large egg, 2/3 milk, 1/3 yogurt, 1/2 honey, 1/2 vanilla extract
1 1/4 wheat germ (best), 1 1/2 wholemeal flour, 1/4 salt, 1 cinnamon powder, 1 baking powder, 1 baking soda
250g / 8 oz raspberries, 2 diced fresh fruit, 1 1/4 dried fruit, nuts, choc chips etc
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 190¬∞C / 375¬∞F (170¬∞C fan). Line a 12 hole standard muffin tin with muffin cases OR spray generously with oil., Whisk wet ‚Äì Place coconut oil in a microwave proof bowl. Microwave for 45 seconds on high or until melted. Add remaining Wet ingredients, whisk until smooth., Mix in Dry ‚Äì Sprinkle the Dry ingredients across the surface in the order listed. Mix just until combined., Raspberries ‚Äì Gently stir in the whole raspberries or other add-ins of choice., Fill muffin tin ‚Äì Divide batter between the 12 holes using an ice cream scoop. Decorate top with halved raspberries., Bake 25 minutes. Cool 5 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack.

TITLE: Creamy fish on potato gratin
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 white fish fillets, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper

3 tbsp / 50g unsalted butter, 2 large leeks, 3 garlic cloves, 2 medium starchy potatoes, 3/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 1/2 dry white wine, 1/2 vegetable stock/broth, 1 thickened/heavy cream
3/4 panko breadcrumbs, 2 extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 parmesan
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan) with a shelf in the middle., Potatoes ‚Äì Cut the potatoes into quarters, then sliced 4mm / 1/6" thick. Place cut potato in a large bowl of water (prevents from going brown, removes excess starch so it cooks quicker). Drain before use., Crunchy topping: Mix panko and olive oil in a bowl. Then stir in parmesan., Season fish: Sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides of the fish fillets. Set aside., Saut√© ‚Äì Melt butter in a large oven-proof skillet (30cm/12") over high heat until foamy. Add leek and garlic, then cook for 3 minutes., Saut√© potatoes ‚Äì Add potato, salt and pepper. Cook for 6 minutes, stirring regularly. The potatoes should be half cooked at this stage., Reduce wine and stock ‚Äì Pour in white wine. Simmer rapidly until it is mostly evaporated ‚Äì about 1 minute. Pour in stock, then simmer for 1 1/2 minutes or until reduced by half., Top with fish ‚Äì Turn the stove off. Place fish on top of the potatoes, presentation side up. (Note 1) Pour cream all over, aiming for full coverage. Sprinkle with panko breadcrumbs., Bake for 30 minutes ‚Äì I know this sounds like a long time but the fish stays succulent!, Colour topping ‚Äì Switch to the oven grill (broiler) on high and move the skillet up to the top shelf. Grill/broil 4 minutes or until golden., Rest ‚Äì Remove and rest for 5 minutes, then serve! Eat the fish and gratin together with each mouthful for maximum eating pleasure!!

TITLE: Spicy Korean Noodle Soup (quick & healthy)
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 cups / 1 litre chicken stock/broth, 2/3 cabbage kimchi, 2 kimchi juice, 3 gochujang, 2 light soy sauce, 2 fish sauce, 1 Chinese cooking wine, 2 ginger, 1 large garlic clove
200g/ 7oz thin fresh egg noodles, 4 choi sum, 1 small carrot, 2 1/2 sesame oil, 1/4 finely sliced green onions
INSTRUCTIONS: Broth ‚Äì Place all broth ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, then reduce heat so it‚Äôs simmering gently. Simmer 10 minutes without a lid., Cook vegetables ‚Äì Add choi sum stems and carrot to the broth. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add choi sum leaves and simmer for another minute. Stir in sesame oil just before serving., Noodles ‚Äì Meanwhile, cook egg noodles in boiling water per packet directions. Drain, give the noodles a quick rinse under tap water. Shake off excess water well., Assemble ‚Äì Divide noodles between bowls. Top with the vegetables. Pick the garlic and ginger out of the broth, then broth pour over the noodles. Sprinkle with green onions and serve!

TITLE: Fluffy Ricotta Pancakes
AUTHOR: Nagi | RecipeTin Eats
INGREDIENTS: 3/4 ricotta cheese, 3 large eggs, 3 caster sugar (superfine sugar), 3/4 milk, 1/2 vanilla extract, 1 white vinegar
1 1/3 plain/all-purpose flour, 2 baking powder, 1/4 baking soda (bi0carb), of salt
1 tbsp (15g) butter, 8 oz / 250g strawberries, 1 caster/superfine sugar, Maple syrup
INSTRUCTIONS: Whisk wet ‚Äì Place the Wet ingredients in a bowl and whisk vigorously to combine. You should have little ricotta curd bits in it, but you don't want giant ricotta clumps., Add dry ‚Äì Scatter the Dry ingredients across the surface then whisk until combined. The batter is a little thicker than standard pancake batter., Lightly butter pan ‚Äì Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat until hot (I use 2 pans). Brush lightly with melted butter (or melt a bit then wipe off excess with paper towels ‚Äì Note 4)., Batter ‚Äì Pour in 1/4 cup batter ‚Äì it should just about spread evenly into a round but may need a bit of coaxing. (I use an ice cream scoop ‚Äì Note 5), Cook 3 minutes ‚Äì Cook the first side for 1 1/2 minutes or until golden brown (turn heat down if browning too fast). Flip then cook the other side for 1 1/2 minutes or until golden. Remove onto a plate., Cook remaining ‚Äì If your non-stick coating is good, you won't need more butter though a very light brush of melted butter every 2nd or 3rd pancake won't hurt. Continue cooking, lowering the heat as you go as the pan gets hotter. You should get 9 to 10 in total. Keep cooked pancakes stacked so they keep each other warm (or use a low 50C/125F oven)., Serve ricotta pancakes with macerated strawberries (below), softened butter and copious amounts of maple syrup!
Toss together strawberries and sugar in a small bowl. Set aside for 20 minutes to allow them to sweat and soften slightly. (Even overnight in fridge is fine.) Serve on pancakes!

TITLE: Crunchy crumbed chicken drumsticks
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 8 chicken drumsticks, 1/2 flour, 3 large eggs, 1 panko breadcrumbs, Canola oil spray
1 dried oregano, 1 dried basil, 1 garlic powder, 1 1/2 smoked paprika, 1 1/2 cayenne pepper or pure chilli powder, 1 1/2 cooking salt, 2 black pepper
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan). Place a rack on a foil lined tray. Spray rack with oil., Crumbing bowls ‚Äì Place the flour, whisked eggs and panko in 3 separate medium bowls (bear in mind shape to fit the drumsticks!)., Mix Seasoning in a small bowl. Put 1 tablespoon into the flour and the rest in the panko, then mix., Crumb ‚Äì Pat drumsticks dry with paper towels. Coat in flour (shake off excess), then egg (let excess drip off). Place in panko and rotate, pressing to adhere all over, including the handle. (Note 3 for mess-free hands technique!), Spray ‚Äì Place drumstick on the rack. Repeat with remaining chicken. Spray very generously with oil., Bake 25 minutes. Turn drumsticks, spray again with oil. Bake a further 20 minutes until golden brown and super crunchy!, Serve Eat and enjoy the CRUNCH!

TITLE: Mexican Chipotle Pork and Beans
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1.5kg / 3lb pork shoulder, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 2 cumin powder

200g / 7 oz chipotle in adobo, 2 olive oil, 1 onion, 4 garlic cloves, 1/4 tomato paste, 1 orange juice, 2 chicken stock/broth, 2 bay leaves, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 3 x 420g / 16 oz canned butter beans / lima beans
1 dried oregano, 1 cumin powder, 1 coriander powder, 1/2 allspice powder
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan)., SPICINESS ‚Äì Read note above about spiciness!, Puree chipotle in adobo until smooth using a stick blender or similar., Sprinkle pork all over with salt, pepper and cumin., Brown pork ‚Äì Heat all the oil in a large oven-proof pot over high heat. Brown the pork all over in 2 batches, the remove onto a plate (~ 1 minute each side)., Saut√© ‚Äì Cool the pot slightly then return to medium heat. If the pot looks dry, add 1 tbsp oil. Saut√© onion, garlic, the herbs & spices for 3 minutes., Cook off tomato & chipotle ‚Äì Add tomato paste and cook it off for 2 minutes. Add chipotle puree and cook for 2 minutes., Slow cook 2 hours ‚Äì Add remaining ingredients EXCEPT beans. Stir, then bring to simmer. Place pork in ‚Äì arrange so its submerged as best as possible. Cover with lid. Place in oven for 2 hours. (Note 6 other cook methods), Add beans, cook 30 min ‚Äì Remove lid, add beans. Return to oven for 30 minutes without lid to caramelise the surface. The pork will be fork-tender!, Serve like stew over Mexican red rice or with tortillas for dunking. Or make wickedly food tacos with finely chopped white onion, fresh coriander/cilantro, avocado slices and a squeeze of lime. More serving options above the recipe video.

TITLE: Chicken pasta bake
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 500g / 1 lb chicken thighs, 1/2 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper, 1/2 garlic powder, 2 Italian herb mix

300g/10oz rigatoni, 2 salt, 5 streaky bacon, 1/2 onion, 2 garlic cloves, 1 1/2 dried oregano, 1/2 chilli flakes / red pepper flakes, 1/2 chardonnay or other dry white wine, 2 tomato paste, 700g / 24oz tomato passata, 1/2 water, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 1/2 black pepper, 3 tomatoes, 2 big handfuls baby spinach, 2 mozzarella,, 1/2 parmesan,
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan)., Cook pasta per packet directions, using boiling water seasoned with the 2 teaspoons of salt. Drain, rinse briefly under tap water, then set aside to cool while making the sauce., Season chicken ‚Äì Toss together Seasoned Chicken ingredients in a bowl., Crisp bacon ‚Äì Put bacon in an unheated very large non-stick pan (Note 2). Turn stove on medium high. The fat will melt so the bacon cooks in its own fat. Cook until light golden, remove onto paper towels, leaving fat in the pan. Once cool, cut into 1cm / 1/3" pieces., Sizzle chicken ‚Äì Top up bacon fat with olive oil if you don‚Äôt have at least 1 tbsp. Increase heat to high. Cook chicken for 3 minutes until light golden on the outside but still raw inside. Remove into a bowl with a slotted spoon., Sauce ‚Äì In the same pan, cook garlic and onion for 1 minute, then add chilli flakes and oregano. Cook for 2 minutes until onion is translucent. Add wine and rapidly simmer for 1 to 2 minutes until mostly evaporated. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute to concentrate and improve flavour. Add passata, then use the water to rinse out the bottle. Add salt, pepper, chicken (including all juices on the plate). Mix, then simmer for 5 minutes on medium., Toss ‚Äì Add baby spinach, tomato, pasta and bacon. Toss well., Assemble ‚Äì Transfer to 23 x 33cm/9 x 13" pan. Top with mozzarella then parmesan. Bake 25 minutes until melted with some golden spots., Serve ‚Äì Stand for 5 minutes then serve!

TITLE: Kedgeree ‚Äì British curried rice and fish
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 4 cups/ 1 litre chicken stock/broth, 500g/1 lb smoked haddock or cod, 2 1/4 long grain rice, 75g / 5 tbsp unsalted butter, 15 curry leaves, 6 green cardamom pods, 1 brown onion, 2 garlic cloves, 2 curry powder, 1/2 turmeric powder, 1 frozen peas, 1/2 coriander/cilantro leaves, 3 hard boiled eggs
INSTRUCTIONS: Poach fish ‚Äì Bring chicken stock to a boil in a large saucepan or small pot. Place fish in (it should all be just about submerged, Note 4) and adjust heat so the stock is barely rippling. Poach it gently for 8 minutes or until the fish flakes apart. Remove fish onto a large plate., Flake fish ‚Äì When cool enough to handle, discard skin (gently scrape with a butter knife) and flake fish into large pieces, checking for any bones., Reserve stock ‚Äì Measure out 1/2 cup of the poaching liquid and set aside for later (drizzle on at end to juice up the rice)., Cook rice 13 min ‚Äì Add rice into the poaching liquid in the saucepan. Bring to a simmer over high heat. Cover with lid then reduce heat to low. Cook for 13 minutes., Rest rice 10 min ‚Äì Remove the saucepan from the stove with the lid on and rest for 10 minutes. Fluff rice using a rubber spatula., Curried butter ‚Äì While the rice is resting, melt the butter in a very large (30cm/12") non stick skillet or pot, over medium-high heat. Add the cardamom pods and curry leaves and stir for 30 seconds. Add the onions, garlic and saut√© for 5 minutes until browning at the edges, stirring regularly., Toss rice ‚Äì Lower heat to medium. Stir in the curry powder and turmeric, and then the rice. Toss the rice in the spiced butter until well coated and uniformly yellow. Pour over the reserved 1/2 cup of fish poaching stock, and toss to mix through (it moistens the rice)., Season with salt if required ‚Äì Check the rice for seasoning. If you used store-bought packet stock, you should find there's enough natural saltiness already. Otherwise season to taste and mix rice well., Peas & fish ‚Äì Stir through the peas and most of the coriander (hold some back for garnish). Then gently fold through the fish, taking care to keep some pieces in large chunks., Serve ‚Äì Spoon out rice onto one large platter or individual plates to serve. Top with boiled egg halves, and garnish with the remaining coriander. EAT!

TITLE: Beef Empanadas
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 1/2 plain/all-purpose flour, 175g/ 12 tbsp cold unsalted butter, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 1 egg yolk, 1/2 warm milk

1 1/2 olive oil, 1/2 onion, 1 garlic cloves, 300g/10 oz beef mince, 120g/4 oz chorizo, 2 tomato paste, 1 fresh thyme, 1/2 EACH dried oregano, cumin, paprika, 1/4 cayenne pepper, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 3/4 chicken stock/broth, 1/2 tomato passata, 150g/5oz potato, 1/3 green onion
2 hard boiled eggs, 1/4 green olives, 2 eggs
Empanada sauce, Other options
INSTRUCTIONS: Blitz chorizo ‚Äì Roughly chop chorizo into 1.5cm / 1/2" pieces. Blitz using a stick blender until it becomes a paste (Note 1), Saut√© aromatics ‚Äì Heat oil in a large non stick pan over high heat. Cook onion and garlic for 2 minutes., Cook meat ‚Äì Add chorizo and cook for 2 minutes. Add beef and cook until you no longer see raw beef. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Then add everything else except green onion, then stir., Cook 15 min ‚Äì Bring to a simmer then lower heat so it's simmering gently. Cook for 15 minutes, stirring every now and then. Goal ‚Äì juicy but not watery filling, with cooked potato., Cool ‚Äì Stir through green onion. Transfer to bowl and fully cool before using (~ 2 hours).

Blitz dough ‚Äì Whisk milk and yolk in a small jug. Pulse flour, salt and butter in a food processor until the butter becomes fine crumbs ‚Äì largest lumps no bigger than peas (~ 4 to 6 times). Add egg-milk mixture, then blitz on low until it comes together into a ball of dough ‚Äì about 10 seconds. (Note 2 for hand method), Chill 30 min ‚Äì Turn out onto a lightly floured work surface, then bring together into a smooth log ~20cm/8" long. Cut in half, shape into 2cm / 0/8" thick round discs. Wrap in cling wrap then refrigerate 30 minutes (or overnight ‚Äì Note 3)., Cut rounds ‚Äì Place one chilled disc on a lightly floured work surface. Roll out to 3 mm / 0.1" thickness. Cut 15 cm/6" rounds (I use a bowl), or other size as desired (Note 3). Keep covered in the fridge, stacked on paper, as you continue to roll and cut. You should get 10 or 11 rounds.

Preheat oven to 220¬∞C/425¬∞F (200¬∞C fan)., Filling ‚Äì Filling should be cold but spreadable (Note 4). Place 3 tablespoons (55g) of filling on the top half of a round of pastry. Spread flat in a half-moon shape, leaving a 1.5cm / 0.6" border. Sprinkle with olive and egg., Seal ‚Äì Brush edge with egg white, fold to enclose, pressing out air and sealing the edge. Optional: Do empanada pleats ‚Äì see step photos in post or video at 3 min 30 sec. Alternatively, crimp with fork or leave plain., Bake 20 min ‚Äì Place empanadas on 2 baking trays. Brush with egg yolk. Bake 20 minutes or until golden brown all over and crispy on the base., Serve hot with dipping sauce of choice ‚Äì my favourite is the homemade Empanada Sauce!

TITLE: Empanada dipping sauce
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 2 medium tomatoes, 2 garlic cloves, 1 extra virgin olive oil, 1/8 ground cumin, 1/8 ground cayenne or pure chilli, 1/8 white sugar, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1 1/2 lime juice, 2 sliced green onion
Beef empanadas
INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat the oven to 220¬∞C/425¬∞F (200¬∞C fan)., Roast tomato 20 min ‚Äì Toss the tomatoes and garlic with the olive oil in a bowl. Place the tomatoes on the tray, cut side up, then roast for 20 minutes., Roast garlic 15 min ‚Äì Add garlic to the tray and roast for another 15 minutes until the edges of the tomato are browned. Remove from oven and cool on tray., Blitz ‚Äì Transfer to a container that just fits the head of a stick blender. Add all remaining ingredients except the green onion. Blitz until smooth ‚Äì about 5 seconds. Add the green onion and blitz until it's finely chopped., Serve with empanadas ‚Äì or corn chips, vegetable sticks, bread!

TITLE: Moroccan Lamb Meatballs
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1 1/2 olive oil

500 g / 1 lb lamb mince (ground lamb), 1 small onion, 1/2 panko breadcrumbs, 1 egg, 2 garlic, crushed, 1/4 coriander/cilantro leaves, 1 1/2 EACH cumin, coriander, paprika, 1/2 EACH cinnamon, cayenne pepper, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
3/4 plain yoghurt, 1/2 mint leaves, 2 lemon juice, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt
4 pita pockets, 5 shredded lettuce, 2 tomatoes, 1 red onion, OR Shredded Red Cabbage, Carrot and Mint Salad, Extra coriander/cilantro leaves,
INSTRUCTIONS: Mint yogurt sauce ‚Äì Set aside 1/2 cup yogurt. Place all other ingredients in a jug that fits the head of a stick blender. Blitz until it turns green ‚Äì it will be runny. Stir in reserved yogurt (this thickens it again). Refrigerate until required., Meatballs ‚Äì Place all Meatball ingredients in a bowl. Mix well with your hands. Measure out 1 heaped tablespoon, then roll into balls. Repeat with remaining mixture ‚Äì should have 20 ‚Äì 24 meatballs., Cook ‚Äì Heat oil in a large non stick pan over medium heat. Add half the meatballs and cook, turning to brown all over, for 8 minutes, or until cooked through. Transfer to plate. (Oven option ‚Äì Note 4), Serving ‚Äì Cut pita pockets in half, warm for 10 seconds in the microwave, then pry it open. Stuff with lettuce, tomato, onion, then meatballs (I do 2 per half pocket). Drizzle with Mint Yogurt Sauce and fresh coriander.

TITLE: Brown butter oatmeal choc chip cookies
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 150g/10 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 flour, 1 1/2 rolled oats, 1 baking soda (bi-carb), 1/8 cooking/kosher salt, 1 brown sugar, 1 large egg, 1 vanilla extract, 200g/ 7 oz 70% dark chocolate block, I use Lindt
