INSTRUCTIONS: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350¬∞F (160¬∞C fan). Lightly grease then line three baking trays with paper., Brown butter ‚Äì Melt butter in a small silver pan or saucepan over medium heat (Note 2). Leave to simmer on medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes, stirring every now and then, until (when you push foam aside) you see little golden-brown bits. Immediately pour the butter and all the brown bits into a large mixing bowl (large enough to mix the cookie dough) and set aside to cool for 5 minutes., Chop choc ‚Äì Cut the chocolate into 1cm /1/4" pieces. Transfer the chunks into a bowl and leave the fine chocolate dust behind for another purpose (makes cookies speckled, Note 1)., Mix dry ingredients ‚Äì Whisk flour, oats, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl., Back to the butter ‚Äì Add sugar to the brown butter and whisk (it might not combine fully). Add egg and vanilla, whisk until smooth., Finish dough ‚Äì Add dry ingredients into the egg-butter mixture. Mix with a wooden spoon until the flour is almost mixed in. Add chocolate, and stir until mixed through and you can no longer see flour. Set aside for 5 minutes to let the mixture firm up a bit., Cookies ‚Äì Scoop a heaped tablespoon of dough onto the tray, 5 cm / 2 " apart. (I use a size 40 cookie scoop, makes 22 cookies) Flatten to 8 mm / 1/3" thick, reshaping sides if needed if they split/go wonky., Bake¬†‚Äì Bake 2 trays for 11 minutes, switching shelves and rotating the tray at the 7 minute mark, or until the surface is light golden. For 1 tray, bake 10 minutes, rotating the tray at the 6 minute mark., Cool on the tray for 10 minutes, then transfer onto a cooling rack to fully cool. (A sprinkle of salt flakes wouldn't go astray!)

TITLE: Thai red curry pot roast chicken
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 1.8 kg/ 3.6 lb whole chicken, 1 cooking/kosher salt, 3 vegetable oil, 115g/ 4 oz (1/2 cup) Thai red curry paste, 2 large garlic cloves, 2 fresh ginger, 2 fresh lemongrass, 1 chicken stock/broth, 400 ml/ 14 oz coconut cream, 6 kaffir lime leaves, 1 white sugar, 2 fish sauce, 600g/ 1.2lb small potatoes (12 or so),, 120g/ 4oz green beans, 15 Thai basil leaves
Jasmine rice, Red chilli, Coriander / cilantro leaves
INSTRUCTIONS: De-chill & salt chicken ‚Äì Take the chicken out of the fridge 1 hour prior. Pat dry then sprinkle with the salt., Preheat oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F (180¬∞C fan)., Saut√© curry paste ‚Äì Use a large, oven-proof pot with a lid. Heat oil on medium high heat. Cook curry paste, garlic, ginger and lemongrass for 2 minutes. This step substantially improves the flavour of store bought curry paste., Sauce ‚Äì Add chicken stock, stir, then simmer rapidly for 3 minutes to reduce by half. Stir in coconut cream, hand-crushed kaffir lime leaves, sugar and fish sauce., Place chicken into the sauce. Spoon over sauce. Surround with potatoes., Bake 1 hour ‚Äì Place the lid on and bake for 40 minutes. Remove lid spoon sauce over chicken (ie. baste). Turn the oven up to 220¬∞C/425¬∞F (200¬∞C fan). Bake uncovered for 10 minutes, baste, bake another 10 minutes., Beans, then bake 10 minutes ‚Äì Push beans into the sauce (wherever they fit!). Baste again then bake for a final 10 minutes (no lid)., Rest 10 minutes ‚Äì Remove chicken onto a plate (Note 7). Rest 10 minutes. Put lid on pot to keep sauce warm., Serving ‚Äì Carve chicken, place on platter. Stir basil leaves into sauce. Pour/spoon sauce, potatoes and beans over chicken. Garnish with chilli and coriander, if desired. Serve with jasmine rice!

TITLE: The most amazing canned tuna pasta!
AUTHOR: Nagi
INGREDIENTS: 200g / 7oz spaghetti, 1 cooking salt
285g/ 10 oz canned tuna in oil, 2 garlic, 2 anchovy fillets, 1/2 chilli flakes / red pepper flakes, 2 baby capers, 1 parsley, 1 lemon zest, 2 lemon juice, 1/4 cooking/kosher salt, 1/4 black pepper
INSTRUCTIONS: Cook pasta ‚Äì Bring 3 litres / 3 quarts of water to the boil with the 1 tablespoon of salt. Cook pasta per the packet time minus 1 minute. Just before draining, scoop out ~1 cup pasta cooking water, then drain the pasta., Saut√© aromatics ‚Äì In the same pot, heat the reserved oil from the tuna cans over medium heat. Add the garlic, anchovies and chilli flakes. Cook and stir for 1 minute., Toss pasta ‚Äì Add the pasta, capers and 1/3 cup of reserved pasta water. Toss using 2 spatulas for 2 minutes., Add tuna ‚Äì Turn off the heat. Add tuna, parsley, lemon zest, juice, salt and pepper. Toss gently to mix through ‚Äì try to keep some tuna chunks., Serve immediately!
